39501896.review:
추천하자면 중간쯤 되겠다.
스토리나 캐릭터들의 약빤 상태를 보자면 충분히 할만하다.
게임전투시스템은 턴제이동식이다. 유저는 이동만하며 이동 후 누구를 공격하고 어떤 액션을 취할진 오토이다.
이 부분에서 좀 지루한 감이 있다. 캐릭터를 수집한다고 하지만 사실상 아이템을 수집하는 경향이 더 큰거같다.
크게 인간형 캐릭터와 특수능력을 가진 몬스터형으로 나뉘는데 인간형은 아이템의 폭이 넓어 선택의 폭이 넓은 반면
몬스터형에 경우엔 이러한 것이 상대적으로 떨어지는 편이며, 인플레이에서 캐릭터슬롯은 6칸인데 특수한 몬스터들은
이 슬롯은 2칸씩 먹는다, 과연 그 어빌리티가 슬롯 하나를 소비할만큼 효율적인가는 좀 더 분석해봐야겠다.
전략턴제라고 하지만 큰 전략이 존재하진 않는다. 가위바위보처럼 어느정도 상관관계는 가지긴하지만
약빤 느낌을 즐기고싶으면 사라 아니면 사지않는게 좋을수도 있다

继承了Behemoth一贯的简笔画搞怪冒险传统。很不幸，这种风格和战棋类游戏最不匹配。

游戏的核心玩法恐怕是收集而不是战棋，因为游戏的战斗系统实在乏善可陈：基本上是火焰纹章式的走一步打一下不说，角色没有什么主动技能可用也不说，连普通攻击都是随机选择目标的。

总之冲着战棋游戏过来的我是大失所望。如果是喜欢收集或者单纯的behemoth粉，应该还是会喜欢这游戏的。

Плюсы:
+ Прекрасная музыка, заседающая в голове.
+ Безбашенный сюжет
+ Абсурдный, неплохой юмор, который в онсовном отражается в диалогах и в сюжете.
+ Замечательное визуальное оформление
Все вышеперечисленное у студии Бегемот всегда на высоте, и они стараются держать планку
Теперь о неприятном.
Минусы:
-Скучноватый геймплей, затянутые бои
-Очень слабая ролевая составляющая. Прокачка почти никак не влияет на персонажей, весь бой зависит от надетой экипировки
Итого:
Скучный геймплей в красивой обертке. Играется интересно, потом надоели бои, и играл с автобоем.
Но в игре виден потенциалб надеюсь "Бегемот" изменит ее к лучшему.
Жду обновлений.

39418327.review:
很好的回合制策略游戏！绝对不会有枯燥的游戏体验哟，不同的物种有不同的特点。不同的物种有不同的组合，不同的组合会出现不同的效果，能很好地带我这种喜欢不动脑子（误）玩游戏的网瘾少女认真考虑每一步该怎么走。emmmm年轻人，如果你放弃了思考，你也可以考虑自动战斗哒√
        同时这款游戏的亮点绝不仅仅是回合策略，收集要素也超棒der（物种收集，武器收集，服装收集），所以每天驾车车出去才不是为了任务，而是看哪家怪物可爱就蹭过去悄咪咪捕捉一波w，值得一提的是，过一段时间外出探险地图会刷新，这个设定也可以说是加分项了，新鲜感up！
        再就是点名批评The Behemoth，他们家的游戏让我染上了抖腿的坏毛病！讲真，这款游戏的BGM真的很容易上瘾啊2333，欢快又独特！啊啊啊啊啊简直毫无抵抗力。导致我的日常就是：
“pit people on！缝纫机 开启！”
        然后就是剧情方面！求更新剧情，因为快的话，一个小时就能刷完主线剧情了，这这...这完全不够我吃嘛，这个游戏的剧情可以说是一团糟，毫无逻辑，但你就是会死心塌地爱上它的疯狂与幽默！嗨呀，这也是没办法的事嘛，因为真的很优秀啊。同时游戏主角间的彩蛋也很多啊，战斗中仔细观察的话，你会发现你们家的宝贝er们的对话真的很可爱啊！
        主线剧情的很快刷玩，导致你不知道做什么，剩下的只有一些任务啊，啧任务是不可能做任务的，这辈子都不可能做任务的，所以在疯狂捕捉物种之后，你时常会感到空虚无力，怎么办？！哼哼朋友，请不要忘记它是一款联机游戏，竞技场欢迎你，同时和朋友们互锤狗头也是超级不错的选择w
         最后，如果在一个深夜，你看到野外地图出现了一个叫你妈森林的地方，请不要笑出声，因为接下来你会发现，这个游戏大部分地点名称都...有毒,嗯......你们就慢慢去探索吧！这个真的很适合你在玩过你库里的“大作”之后玩。pit people是那种蹲在角落一声不吭，但你接触的话就会爱不释手的精致小游戏！请爱它qwq
         



           蛋糕人真可爱，耶！

39372318.review:
The Behemoth is an amazing team. Every game they produce has a unique style, yet they intersect somehow.
If you liked Battleblock Theater, Castle Crashers, or even Alien Hominid you will feel rewarded for having enjoyed those games also.

Pit People is one of those games that looks like it was made with a $50.00 budget but still comes out better and more polished than AAA games. The sillyness in the dialogue or even just roaming around laughing at enemies costumes makes this game both addicting and entertaining.

CO-OP is smooth. Playing with your friends and making jokes seems to be the spirit of this game.
that being said, single player is still very engaging for those worried that the campaign would be too dry without co-op.

If you are new to Behemoth games, now is just as good of a time as any to jump right in to Pit People.

39323981.review:
Get this if you want a game you can play while doing anything else. It's simple enough that you don't even need to pay attention to it when you play, but fun enough to keep you coming back time and time again.
 This can prove to be a serious time killer if you are super into it, as it feels like a semi procedural pokemon capture adventure where you tackle hillarious missions and explore one of the more fun overworld maps in the genre. 
 Early game fights lack complexity, but once you realize you can recruit pretty much anything to your side and you add some diversity to your troops, you start to get addicted.
 Story missions have never once failed to make me chuckle. The sense of humor this game touts is astounding. So much flavor in every bite.

39035905.review:
My buddy and I were looking for a co-op game to purchase during the steam sale and I sent him a link to this game to check out.  

I saw the similiarties that this game had art style wise to Battle Block Theater and Castle Crashers and a matter of fact, I loved those games!  However, I didn't know how Behemoth would handle the concept of turn based combat within this game because most TBS games are either a hit or miss for me.  Also, I was slightly concerned that the game was going to be childish and marketed towards younger children.

But when I played this game for the first time,  I was won over.  A combination of the art styles, gameplay, witty humor, and combat style drew me in.  Behemoth implemented story rich, funny cut scenes into Pit People that are always worth watching (seriously, watch them, they're worth your time).  If you have someone to play co-op with, you will develop an instant addiction Pit People.

I purchased this game during the Steam Sale for $9.94, and it was worth every single penny.  Even if you are reading this after the steam sale, the MSRP for Pit People is $15 and that price is also an absolute steal.

Pick it up, you won't be dissapointed 10/10

39004922.review: I've played and completed all the major Behemoth releases - Alien Hominid, Castle Crashers and Battleblock Theater, which are all great games in their own right. But Pit People is for me at least, a rank above all of them. The grid-based role playing strategy game with Behemoth quality and style in character design and customization just makes this stand out spectacularly. Not to mention fantastic voice acting and one of the best soundtracks I've heard in years. Then there's the seemingly infinite amount of quests and unlockables - including weapons, hats, monsters which are useable in battle ranging from villainous to adorable, different vinyls for the town theme and more. Then there's the fact that it's in early access, with a new map and entire campaign mode to be completed. Pit People is one of the highest quality and feature-full games you can play on Steam. Get it now if you like fun.

38841302.review: Like all Behemoth games, the story is absolutely ridiculous, and the, um, 'narration' and dialogue are both zany and, um, jerk-y. As opposed to a platformer and whatever the heck Castle Crashers is classified as, this game is a fairly quick, turn-based strategy game with a highly explorable overworld (an a fun feature in which one can avoid random encounters, thus lowering any consequential grinding). The controls are incredibly simple in their mechanics, making it easy to learn and fun to play, and the customisation options are truly a masterpiece of conglomerated bodily components to create uniquely designed characters. There is still challenging aspects to the game that do require a full consideration of enemy movements in regard to one's own pawns- I mean "players"' actions, and also do your side quests as well as your primary quests. Cough. Anyways, thus far, I am incredibly pleased with this game and am excited for its completion.

38799435.review: This game is brilliant. This is definitely your go to game if you are looking for something to quench your thirst for dark humor, sarcasm, and the absurd. Even though in terms of game play all it has to offer ultimately is repetitive fast paced role play, the kind that you would eventually try as hard as you can to avoid (If you've played games like final fantasy IX, you will know what I am talking about) what it lacks in game play depth or story depth it makes up for in the ingeniously hilarious sense of humor and diversity of collectable items, that again, are well thought of to come off as unexpected, absurd, and greatly reflective of the wit of the game creators. It keeps you playing because you want to experience more of its humor and you are left wondering where the game will take you, because anything goes and anything can happen. If you are into products like rick and morty YOU WILL ENJOY THIS. If, like me, you have enjoyed previous games by Behemoth, especially for their fun, cute and funny art style and witty sense of humor you will enjoy this because it is an upgrade of both. And these 2 things coupled with the outstanding job of the voice actor definitely make it stand out as a game. These Behemoth games should even be classified as a whole distinctive genre on their own. Worth every singly penny. Obviously many aspects can be improved, many things cam be integrated over time nevertheless even in its crude form it is still a gem.

38793005.review:
Hilarious strategy game made by The Behemoth. 
Likes
-Various races of units made to fill different roles. (Healer, buffer, saboteur, dps, etc)
-You get to pick the equipment of the Humans/Demi-clops/Cyclops so you can customize the role they play to your liking
-Tons of cosmetic choices make your team actually feel like YOUR team.
-Some characters can be found with rare text animations and colors for their name.
-No options to rename characters making the hunt for character names you like yet another thing to hunt for.

Dislikes
-Some races of creatures (Zombies, Gnomes and Kobolds) come in pairs. Currently there isn't a way to trade members of those pairs with the same creatures. For instance, lets say you have a Zombie pair - Hearts(in special red text)/Peanut. If you wanted to switch "Hearts" into another zombie pair, you can't.
-There are tons of equipment but very few of them have elemental properties.
-There's a gold cap of 19,999

Я давно хотел купить эту игру, и когда я её всётаки приобрёл, я не пожелел об этой покупке.
Я думал что в ней будет слишком скучно и всё однотипно ,но я сильно ошибался .
The Behemoth всегда делают отличные проекты такие как BBT CC и вот вышел в свет PP( Pit People)
ПЛЮСЫ:
1. в игре отличный sound track что очень радует ведь не в каждой игре можно услышить музыку под которую хочется играть 
2.в игре разнообразные персонажи :от артерелерийских единорожек ползающих на жопе до наистремнейших риперов которые дебафают.
3. в игре есть Free Play т. е. мир обсолютно рандомно генерируется и по всей локации разбросаны мобы и квести (на данный момент я нашёл только несколько квестов и это отвезти зверюшку в определённое место)
4. классный юмор , в этой игре самый разнообразный юмор от чёрного до нейтрального 
МИНУСЫ:
1. ранний доступ(временый минус) покаместь сюжет игры не доделан до конца игру мойно пройти за часов 4-5


Делаем вывод на том что у игры 4 плюса и 1 минус ну The Behemoth  меня продолжают радовать.
Советую всем, к томуже в игр возрадили старый и не актуальный жанр.
в общем даю этой игре 8.5/10 и помни космический медведь следит за тобой

I would have forgotten that I had a family if I wasn't playing couch co-op with my wife.

The game is engaging, funny, and easy on the eyes.  I look forward to forcing my friends to choke on the glory of this game as soon as they come over.  Given that this game is currently in the pre-release phase, I can't wait to see what they have in store for us.  It's easy to drop in or drop out, AND unlike most other games, you can log out your other player when the controller goes quiet instead of being forced to log back in to log out.

The only issue that I have is the lack of established world map when your city returns to its prior location.  But the game makes up for it with a huge arrow pointing at your quest location.

I plan to ruin my sleep patterns without regret with this game.

38705782.review:
PROS:
Fun story.
Unique setting.
Nice artwork.
Great voice-acting.

CONS:
Tactical combat is very, very limited and repeditive.
Poor interface and controls makes unit selection and clarity a real chore.
Vast majority of battles are cakewalks that require no strategy.
Poor itemisation makes vast majority of loot useless. 
Characters don't seem to get perceptively stronger no matter how much you level them up.
Very limited selection of quest types.


Hopefully everything about the combat and loot is going to get overhauled in a future patch, but until then I'd discorage buying this unless you're purely interested in the story and comedy elements.

This game is not also easy but also its not hard at the same time.

38270566.review:
[h1]A very good game, even in Early Access![/h1]
Funny and fun, here's some bullet points on why: [list]
[*]Extremely fun Co-op
[*]Still incredibly fun Singleplayer 
[*]Really cheesy and hilarious dialogue
[*]Lots of character-types to collect
[*]Large variety of characters in those character-types
[*]"Rock, Paper, Scissors"-esque style of gameplay in relation to weapons and powers
[/list]
I've played this game both single- and multiplayer and have beaten the main story that has been released up to the time of this review. After 28 hours of playing, I still have yet to find and beat all of the Side-Quests, which is pretty incredible since the quality of these are very high.

Some of the enemies are inherently less fun to fight than others most of the time though.
[strike]Lookin' at you literally any team that has more than one Octoclops >:^([/strike]

Mas que jogo fantástico! Sério! O jogo é um clássico da Behemoth, com arte, humor, sons e etc. Mas tudo de uma forma tão nova e diferente que você até esquece que é mais do mesmo só que diferente.
O sistema de lutas é balanceado e preciso, não tem nenhum personagem ou formação de time que seja mais "apelão" que outra, só tem bonecos e composições que se saem melhores que outras quando batem de frente.
As armas, os monstros, a história, os locais, as missões e tudo no jogo é simplesmente surpreendente de bem feito. É tudo pensado até no seu mais profundo detalhe.
E sinceramente, parabéns a The Behemoth. Pra mim, acertaram com um jogo de Aventura. Acertaram com um jogo de Puzzle. E acertaram com um jogo de Estratégia. Que empresa completa e bem estruturada, só posso esperar pra ver mais jogos dessa fantástica máquina de obras de arte digitais!

This will be the last time I buy an EA game for a long time.

Very little depth or strategy to this game at all.

Single player consists of maybe a half dozen regular missions with slightly different win conditions.

Multiplayer is absolutely dead. About as tactically deep as single player as well, which is to say not at all. You can often instantly tell who will win the match just by glancing at their party composition. Within the first 5-10 turns you will definitely know who is going to win.

Playerbase consists of children.

The requirement to "collect" your party members will make you play this game beyond the first hour, so won't be able to get a refund.

37817820.review:
怎么说呢...感觉The Behemoth做的游戏越来越不好玩...至少不对我的胃口了...
The Behemoth是一家很有意思的开发商，作品都自带首发中文，画风睿智而脑洞清奇。我从他们宣布开发《坑人》之后就一直关注着他们分享的有关这部作品的开发日志，Pit People贝塔测试的时候因为玩的时间并不长所以感觉还行，但EA阶段实际玩上手之后就会发现这游戏把养成元素做成了主要优点，但游戏主要的内容，也就是战棋对战这方面，真是成也随机、败也随机。而且不管是主线还是支线的剧情，这些对局显得千篇一律，只是换个皮肤、换个叙述方式让你再玩一遍，再加上魔性洗脑的无限循环BGM，这样用心开发的成果虽然看上去诱人，但总体来说算是让我很失望吧。

如果是现在这个阶段，我并不推荐这款游戏，即使它带着前辈们的光环。一路走来从狂扁小朋友到战斗方块剧场，再到城堡破坏者，可以看到The Behemoth的野心是很大的，他们一直在试图去做系统越来越复杂的游戏。明年年初Pit People要结束EA了，希望到时候开发商能加入更多改进吧。

37105014.review:
"I find myself wondering what the world must've been like before the bear crashed into our frail planet, transforming all we once knew into a colourful kaleidoscope of delicious chaos and I love .... it."

Never before have I been hooked by a game so quickly. The Behemoth are now 4 for 4 and I couldn't be more stoked about it.

The gameplay is grid-based & turn-based RPG team combat ... but the real joy lies in the execution of it all. The art, the story, the characters, the hilarious way they speak, the vibrant world. It's fun in its purest digital form.

Will Stamper as the Narrator is sublime, following on from his role in Battleblock Theater. I just love his delivery - it gets me chuckling every time.

The soundtrack is top-notch as well and I've found myself looking it up on YT a few times. Patric Catani has really captured the chaotic cartoony absurdity of 'Pit People'. "It's Us" (i.e. the opening theme) is a personal favourite of mine.

Love the game, love what The Behemoth is doing, glad I bought it, wish more people would too.

36748567.review:
Pit people is a turn-based tactical pokemonesque rpg about positioning and [strike] throwing people into the dungeon	[/strike] gathering volunteers to fight for you. There's hundreds of items to collect and missions to do. Almost every unit you see can be captured and put to [strike] death	[/strike] the test against people or AI. I personally prefer fighting other people, as of now I have about 1,500 victories in pvp. Although you don't gain experience when fighting players, you do get rewards and more points than you would in the unfair arena if you're working towards gold rankings. If fighting isn't your style, you can always spectate a battle and get rich by watching battles between players. You may even find me in there destroying someones team.

If the game is feeling too easy for you, you can turn on the insane difficulty and enable permadeath and bring your [strike] sacrifices	[/strike] warriors into the pit.

36723442.review:
The most recent game from developer The Behemoth, Pit People is a turn-based game with simple combat mechanics: just position your little dudes and they'll do the attacking for you. The game is not absent of Behemoth's fantastic sense of humor, you'll love the characters (and their absurd voices) as well as the story.

Co-op is available, both local and online. You can play with a friend in the story, or against them in the arena.

Worried about that Early Access status? Behemoth has just announced that they are putting the final touches on the game and are getting ready for the full release early 2018.

36655321.review:
[h1] ASPECTOS DO JOGO [/h1]

Bom, como vocês já devem saber, Pit People é um RPG baseado em turnos, e é totalmente fiel ao seu estilo de jogo definido. Ele apresenta um sistema de customização bem criativo, e estranho (em um sentido bom, ok?). Cada peça de roupa tem algo em particular, é possível fazer misturas bem esquisitas, mas interessantes, e fortes, se baseado nos aspectos básicos de ataque e defesa.

[h1] PREÇO [/h1]

O preço atual dessa análise é de R$27,99. O preço está muito bom, pelo o que ele [i]vai oferecer[/i]. Como ele ainda está em desenvolvimento, talvez o preço não pareça tão convidativo, mas eu garanto que você vai se divertir bastante com o pedaço que nos podemos jogar.
Para mim, o preço vale a pena.

[h1] VALE A PENA? [/h1]

Isso depende muito se você quer jogar agora, em Early Acess ou não. Se você é um grande fã da Behemoth, gosta de RPGs em turnos, esse jogo é para você. Só é importante ressaltar que como Pit People ainda está em desenvolvimento, pode ocorrer vários bugs, então esteja ciente disto antes de reclamar.

Fun. Just a fun game.
It's challenging but fair.
As will all of Behemoths games, this one is hilarious, has a great soundtrack, and controls fantastically well.
Would recommend 9/10 game, and it's only in early access

Would like to see more characters, more customisability on classes that aren't humans (but what's already there is great) and some more variety in what weapons and gear does. Maybe an option for a character to say, take off their pants in order to carry more gear, something funny and in keeping with the games atmosphere.
Possibly some kind of changes to the roster setup? Because at the moment having 6 character slots not be unlocked from the get go is a little redundant, seeing as you can unlock both of them in about 20 mins of play after starting the game. Just seemed a little odd how easy it was to get - there was no sense of progression. Maybe unlock them after doing quests for the town or something. Or they unlock by completing random quests that aren't one of the 4 options you get on leaving the city? Just an idea, so that there's an element of choice as to whether you want to rush the story quests and ignore side quests, but have less characters, in an effort to make things more challenging, whilst it also acts as an inscentive to do the other optional quests out and about in the world.
Just an idea.

What is already here is fantastic, and so much fun to play.
Eagerly awaiting all that they add in the future

Oh and 1 more thing, I think it'd be really cool if there was an alternate ending for dying in the tutorial when the bear tells you to die
also it would be nice if when you get the rewards for the Pit, it told you what your final ranking was on the leaderboard. Just a minor thing that would add to the experience a little

36007318.review:
[ I've played a lot more than my played-time says ]

>> tl;dr:
Same old but very new fantastic Behemoth game, but missing something important that will hopefully come in the development process. 8.5/10

----
>> For ape creatures who read:
Although there are many, many things about this game that make it just as good as any other Behemoth-- given, better than most other games out there right now-- I'm going to start this review with my one main criticism that I hope the Devs were already considering, which is that:

The battle dynamics, although at first really fun and definitely well-thought through by the devs, feels like it lacks an extra important layer of depth to keep the replayability of the game and the challenge of the battles exciting. To better explain this, the depth of the game's battle strategy can be broken down into:

- Organize and modify your team at base [making a compatible party suitable to your playstyle].
- Strategically place your units on the field of battle for optimum damage, tank-ability and utility.
- [Sometimes] manage which enemies you target to save the last enemy to be recruited.

These two and a half only layers of the battle scenarios are strangely enough to keep you playing the game for a long time. But, I do admit, it eventually can become redundant, and maybe even boring. There are only so many combinations of your "team set-up vs. enemy team set-up"s you can go through before it starts to become repetitive routine strategy.

What I can only hope for is that the Devs add in at least one sort of extra layer of depth to the battle-dynamic which they add in through the development process; A layer like:

- In-battle item use.
- Added character-type activatable or auto-activated abilities (ex: leap for archers, charge for cyclops, etc).
- Talent tree sort-of-thing for personalization of each character you own.
- Something more brilliant that only a Behemoth dev can come up with.

A layer that can take you out of your routine comfort in a battle to yell "F***, I hate it when that f***er does that" or "F***, I love it when my little character dude does that".

Anyway, despite that one main criticism, the game really does nail everything you can love about a Behemoth game and more: Comedy, re-playability, well-constructed world, killer music, the always loved animation style, the unpredictability of every story-quest. Other reviews capture the best parts of the game in more depth.

All in all, 8.5/10. I just think it needs that one bit of spice.

36000881.review:
Pit People is one of my favorite games of all time. It has an amazing art style, great music, and humorous characters. With 3 story missions, 5+ multi part side stories, over 60 world map quests and over 1,500 cosmetics collect this game has a ton of content. There are almost 20 unique recruits to choose to assemble your team including giant farting mushrooms, lazy rocket chair driving gnomes, and a floating octopus with one tentacle. You can play 2 player co-op or you can fight in the pit for a 1v1 or a 2v2. Keep in mind that this is early access, and there is more to come.

Overall, Pit People is an amazing game. It might be a little simple of a strategy game for some people, but the Behemoth never disappoints. After all, their other hit games were not too complex, so why does a strategy game have to be?

I first bought this game because it is made by the Behemoth, and I enjoyed CastleCrashers and BattleBlockTheater alot. When I first play it, I feel like the combat is slow/repetitive and the AI thinking for themselves is weird. But once you get through the tutorial and recruit Sophia, the game is now hecka fun. After the tutorial, all enemy types are now avaliable and could be recruited to your team. Each species does different attacks and have different stats. You could do the story mission which is not in an abundant amount, the side missions which is more fighting and hilarious dialogue, or just explore and recruit people. The customizability for your team is huge as there is a lot of weapons, and there is a lot more factors you need to concider when assembling a team. The fighting is intense as you move your units around either to focus attack on a single target or positioning for retreat/attack. Playing multiplayer is one of the best part of the game, as everyone have a different team, but because this game is in early access, not much people are online.

I will recommend this game once it is finished, right now the game is fun but does not have a lot of content. Considering Behemoth's reputation, I am sure they will finish the game sometime soon with even more content.

Pit People представляет собой стандартную пошаговую стратегию и не привносит чего-то революционного в жанр. Есть глобальная карта, домашний замок и отряд. На базе есть несколько сооружений, где можно: переключить сложность игры на Unfair; изменить музыку; подключиться/пригласить к сетевой игре; купить экипировку/юнитов; поменять состав отряда; пойти в "Яму" и сражаться против ботов 1 vs 1 или 2 vs 1, а также против игроков 1 vs 1 или 2 vs 2, получая там вещи и золото. Также есть главные ворота, где можно купить полезные вещи (зелье воскрешения, разовый ускоритель, клетка, хилка для пати), взять главный квест и отправиться на глобальную карту.

Всё сделанно в стиле бегемотов,  ржачно и качественно.

35486009.review:
Wow. Not only is the development cycle of this game all over the place, so is the community.

To start, Pit People isn't a horrible game but it definitely isn't great. If you like turn based strategy or The Behemoth's typical humor you will most likely enjoy this game...at first. When stepping into Pit People you have this incredible feeling of exploration and a deep combat system with nearly infinite unlocks and collectables. However after a few hours the game is bare-boned and shallow as they come. 

Firstly, the classes of characters in this game are not developed and balanced enough. They don't feel unique enough and when putting them in raw combat to compare they all pretty much play out the same. There really isn't a strategy aspect to the game as it stands and I don't think it ever will. Your party will almost always be able to take on 2 encounters before having to heal or return back to the hub. If you're great or if you're terrible it always takes about 2 battles to make you need to retreat. This game gets incredibly stale after your 10th battle; they're all the same despite what enemies are present and how many there are. It is very clear The Behemoth is doing trial and error on this one as they go. The strategy aspect of this game is absent.

Secondly, the map and it's exploration. This game has about 5-6 maps in which each time you load into a new world it picks a spawn point on one of those 6 maps. There's really no point to this aspect of the game. I was fine with it at first but after updates they removed the beacon back to the city. This makes trying to get back more annoying than difficult because time stops when you stop to open the map and try to guess where you are... Over the updates there was also a feature to make elite enemies stun immune, more aggressive, and inescapable. This is incredibly annoying because now special enemies on the world map just attack you out of nowhere and there's no way to stop them beyond out-driving them. The same missions spawn in all the same places each time there's really no point. They could have just gone with a really big static map and it wouldn't have changed anything...

Lastly the collectables. This aspect is just rushed. They had their artists pump in as many crazy things as they could but they're almost entirely cosmetic. The weapons in this game used to be all the same and they tried to change that by making some unique. As time went on, they did this more and more with wider differences. Now, a lot of these weapons are beyond useless and simply cant be used in a strategic sense. There's no easy way to get these collectables or direct means of getting them. If you could just pay for a random item in a gambling machine it would be fine. Currently, the only way to obtain items is catching an enemy (kill all the enemies first, and have a character with a net catch it) and by random loot drops from doing missions/beating enemies.

Everything about this game just screams placeholder and subject to change on a balance level. The Behemoth is taking their sweet time with the game. (months between updates) Despite these huge time gaps between content they aren't changing much. The gameplay isn't getting anymore engaging, the main story isn't progressing, and most of each update is just more collectable dumps. The core of this game will never change. It's still the same casual flat "strategy game" through and through. After countless rebalances of how levels and stats work the game is still exactly the same as the first build, worse really. I wanted to give this game a good review, I really did but it's clear these are permanent problems lingering over the game.

The icing on the disaster cake is the community. Right off the bat, it's dead. Most people try to be helpful but its just a ghost town. 

I have personal problems with this community day in and day out. Back in the day I used to be extremely active, I would help people with any questions or problems. I would boast about having the most completion because I loved the game and played it religiously. However the downfall of the community was The Behemoth and their connection to said community. 

They moved over to discord and the forums here were getting more and more silent by the day. So they decided to make a community manager, a fellow player. I don't want to seem jealous, but they made this guy a manager out of no where for no reason and he isn't an employee. He simply embraced a meme and became the center of attention by making his profile themed after Pit People. Sure, this is fine at first but he really isn't helpful or active like I was. He was basically made community mod to be a jester to liven up the place. (That worked really well right...?)

Then just yesterday I go onto the forums after being disappearing after many months and updates. I come looking for help to get 100% completion or as close as I could. What do we have...? No one. The forums are empty for the most part. I stumble across a group of select people trying to make a full list of everything in the game. Turns out, they're close buddies who won't help out unless it's to help themselves. They just want Steam forum fame on an empty game. So I continue my search...

I go to the Discord today asking around there. I find someone who's willing to help. To my surprise they had more items than me despite me 100%'ing the game a few updates ago. What do they do? Oh yeah, they scam me. Turns out this guy is also buds with the small group of completionists. Wow, great community huh? He accused me of cheating for having the max number of items when I played this game a lot longer before there was more content but okay...

Yeah, wah wah wah personal beefs right? Wrong. As mentioned the game is stale and the community is a former shell of what it was.
35486009.developer_response:
Hello!  I thought I should respond to some of the objective statements that I feel are objectively inaccurate.  Somehow my previous reply has gone missing.

We have one community manager, who is Megan.  We have not appointed anyone else as a community manager.  We have had active players who have become moderators, though.  

I'm not sure what connection you feel we're missing with our community.  Between Megan, support staff and myself, we reach out daily to tens or hundreds of people on Steam, Discord, Twitter, Email, and otherwise!  Lots of uplifting snail mail, too :)

If you're having troubles with Elites on the worldmap, you can bring Nitro and either run them over to kill them or use it to escape.  I always make sure I have one handy nowadays due to the new danger imposed.

If you're wanting to last more than an average of 2 battles before having to head home, you can bring Healing Camps to stay out longer or try to stretch your level-ups between.

If you're having a hard time finding the city again you can either follow the clearing in the clouds back, check the trail map, or leave yourself a beacon as soon as you exit the city for the first time.  This will leave a waypoint back home from everywhere.

Sorry someone in the community didn't trade you proper.  We have a trade mode in the game that makes sure each person has sent something over if you want to prevent that in the future.

Thanks for the feedback!

35069098.review:
If you liked Behemoths other games maybe hold your horses on this one. Pit People whilst sharing an art style and humour isn't at all like those games. Unlike other Behemoth games it isnt fast paced and its humor comes from the story rather than from its visuals and its gameplay isn't exactly top notch. Its supposed to a stratagy game but bar a few differing abilities there is not much to the combat, you get to choose where your characters move and thats it. The turn based system is also painfully slow too making battles just not that fun. Every fight is just "move here, now wait".
I also didn't think it was that funny, like i said before it puts its humor into the dialoge rather than visual gags like in other games, the world is still fantastic in many places though. The visuals are great in combat and out of it with a lot going on in the backgrounds. The story is its strongest part but as of now its just a handful of quests and a few (really good) cutscenes.
This game isn't bad but it isn't "overhelmingly positive" in my view. If its combat got beefed up so the player would actually do stuff in it then this game would be great.

35064923.review:
Although Pit People has yet to be finished and the main quest line is still short, there is an enormous amount of side-content that can last you 50+ hours.

Behemoth's signature humor makes this turn-based grid strategy game a lot of fun, though it's best experienced with a friend. I for one really enjoy it.

35048431.review:
[h1] 	少见策略的策略游戏  不用动作的动作游戏[/h1]

已退款，準備等正式版再入手
無視時間，用同學的賬戶在玩這個遊戲

感覺遊戲像有些評論里說的一樣——遊戲性不足，但是優點也十分明顯：
1、新穎[spoiler] ？？？ [/spoiler]的戰鬥機制
2、一如既往的搞怪劇情
3、收集系統比較有特點
可以說是繼承了前面幾部作品的優點了
接下來說缺點：
1、判定機制有點pit people
2、劇情不算緊湊，比較零散。很多時候玩著都是懵逼的[strike] 這可能算優點？ [/strike]，有時不知道要乾些什麼，只能到處抓抓小弟，撿點金幣。任務提示感覺不是很仔細，跑圖都能跑暈。如果這是按一個策略遊戲來評論，這一點其實無關緊要。
3、各種職業/人物的平衡：比如弓兵，[u］可以遠程攻擊，但血量較少，沒毛病。 [/u]但各種人物之間的配合幾乎沒有，沒有陣容搭配這一說，大多數時間我是看不出來各個職業的優勢的，除了一些非要用特殊陣容的的，全是一個類型的人都強無敵，技巧淡化了，但可以看出官方是在有意強調陣容/技巧這一點的。（我的錯覺
4、戰鬥機制簡單：遊戲中的戰鬥甚至可以用石頭剪刀布來比擬，就只是點鼠標控制行動，沒有一些隨機事件（戰鬥中）或彩蛋，也沒有戰鬥道具之類的，就好像你控制一個人，卻只能平A。如果能加入一些可佈置陷阱、能炸開障礙物的炸藥之類的會好一些，並且多一些套路，使玩法更加有趣。

差不多就總結到這，還有一些細節問題不多贅述，與前作相比還是有許多不足。個人認為這個遊戲的重點還是在於PVP，至於PVE可能玩起來會有點無聊，如果不是對這種遊戲非常感冒的話，建議等進一步完善再購買。

如果滿分10分，我會給7分.

34520241.review:
The developers of this game have 2 other games that are 'Overwhelmingly Positive' on Steam... and in my opinion, Pit People is another that deserves that title! It seems this developer CAN'T make a bad (or even mediocre) game. Pit People is a tactical-turn-based, squad-management, open-world game. Right after finishing the prologue, you can travel ANYWHERE you want on the world map and fight anything and anyone that you want, which is a refreshing degree of freedom. The game is quite difficult if you don't understand the positioning of your squad on the battlefield, or the squad-management aspect of the game but you shouldn't feel bad if your squad gets destroyed... the game honestly has a nice degree of difficulty to it. Combat is 'slow', but it's a turn-based game so that can be expected... battles can sometimes take 10minutes+ for per fight, but time simply FLIES by because of the amazingly-upbeat music! The music is simply delightful and gives the whole game a whimsical feel to it (almost makes it feel like a cartoon). The dialogue of the characters is also quite funny and the 'voices' of the characters even more so... There's honestly nothing negative I can say about the game and for $15 it's WELL worth it, because you can easily get 50hours+ out of the game, even in the current early access state. The game is well deserved of it's 'Overwhelmingly Positive' title.

Video review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rPoiMgjo7S8 (in-depth, 1hrs10mins video review)

34285911.review:
[h1] Disclaimer	[/h1]

To start off I would like to first highlight that despite having 17 hours in the game as of the time of writing this review, I have yet to experience some of the major aspects of this game.

A. These being first Co-op element of the game which typically increases the fun factor of most games by upwards of 100% and I feel in this games case would make for a far far far superior experience.

B. The pit, an arena in the games city hub area thingy that features arena battles against both npcs and AI with coop also being an option.

C. The "hard core mode" or whatever it is called, while less important as not many people will be hinging their purchase decision on an additional difficulty setting, it still bears mention.
(Okay not entirely true, I did switch it on at one point but there were loud noises, flashing light, smoke and fire... long story short I got scared an immediately turned it off again ;-;)

                                                 [b] With that out of the way, Let Us Begin! [/b]

[h1] The Pros	[/h1]

This game. Is. Bonkers. 
I never expected in my life that I would be setting the personal objective to go out of my way in a video game in order to..

Get a prettier pair of leggings.. that are purely cosmetic.. for my spider lady.. so that they would match the style of my companion.. who rides on her back.. and is also a sentient cupcake.. that flings portions of its body into teammates mouths.. so that it can heal them.. while slowly killing itself in the process.

Now in case you aren’t sold quite yet, here are some more general pros in my opinion.

- It can be described as "babies first strategy game" and [b] NOT [/b] and a derogatory sense.
Even if you have never played a strategy game or plain suck at any of those that you have tried, rest assured that you will be able to perform competently in this game. Simple and Satisfying is the motto I use for the gameplay.

[b] **AND YET! [/b] The system cannot be called shallow so easily given the wealth of weapon types, unit types, team combinations and hazards/status effects that all serve to enrich the base combat experience.

Additional likeable features of the game that come to mind include the games vast degree of customization items (well over 1000 individual items) that give little advantage over each other in reguards to stats.
Sure some might have certain resistances or attributes such [i] +dodge%chance [/i] etc. 

However as a whole this does not subtract from the game experience, it helps avoid a balancing nightmare and constant player worrying "are the stats good enough? Do I have anything optimal? Omg heavens forbid I am not min/maxing to the fullest extent" ad infimum."

Instead this lets the player simply... have fun! New hat? Like the hat? Stick that sucker on! 
Fashion souls to your hearts content, better to kick butt in style am I right! ^-^

A final attractive feature I will mention before moving along to the next portion of this review [spoiler] (which I can already tell is going to be long af so settle in kiddies) [/spoiler] is the games full co-op (both local and online) functionality. Worked seamlessly into the game, for example;

[list]

[*] Want to go to the shops in the city while your partner edits his team build? Sure! You can both do as you please without causing any inconvenience to the other party.

[*] Over world map travel? There’s only one carriage with one driver... so one of you gets to be the gunner on top, allowing for some additional team interactions and coordination to stun enemies that you would rather not start an encounter with.
(Can be done as a solo player as you are given control over movement and guns in that instance so don't worry)

[*] Combat? You both take you full teams into the battles and.. well it's a turn based strategy game so it's not like much can really go wrong or inconvenience either party mechanically.

[/list]

[h1] The Cons	[/h1]

Combat can get very repetitive and once you capture all the creatures you want, unless you spot an over world mob with an item you [b] really really [/b] want, you may find yourself in the same position as me.
Actively avoiding combat outside of quests and even if you get sucked into one... just fleeing because scccreeww that.

This however is not a con within the context of said quests, this being due to the simple fact that a lot of tender love and care is put into quests. The maps which these encounters take place in are typically hand crafted and narrated, not only adding charm and character to both the enemies and the environment but also changing the gameplay.

Through adding in map objectives (camps to destroy, buttons to press, key targets, etc.) you can complete the mission without having to actually kill everything in the level! 

My favourite example [b] (will be vague to avoid spoilers) [/b] of this is during a mission where most of the gimmick is to throw tons more foes at you than you initially expected. 
This still works. Why? The way the enemies are introduced is entertaining and each new enemy adds a new map objective making it easier beat the level beyond brute forcing i.t 
[i] (aka surround the mofo's one by one and dog pile them for a quick 1/2 round kill.) [/i]

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Another issue with the game to some might be the early access status of the game, however with Behemoth working on the game given their track record with past titles and the update work on this game over the years you can stand to feel a little less anxious.

The main storyline is still underdeveloped in the sense that there are only a handful of mission (albeit recently paced, narrated and designed with interesting cut scenes and objectives) that you can be done within a few hours easily.
This will however continue to be expanded over time and is more forgivable given both the quality level and the games vast array of side quests. 

These aforementioned side quests will keep you running all over the world map always excited for the next to see how the stories unfold. For example (spoilers) One mission leads you to [spoiler] Travel to the FRIGGEN SUN to retrieve some sorta solar great sword of massive damage and aoe fire starting nonsense!	[/spoiler]

A final note before we wrap up for the cons is… hard core strategy players... 
This might not be the game for you, the game is quite simplistic compared to other strategy games due to features such as the fact that if you move a unit to a positon. Whereby it *can* target more than one opponent... you have no control over which foe it will actually attack so... soooo yeah, that might cheese your onions if you know what I mean.

[h1] Conclusion	[/h1]

The game is only going to get better with time and the price is said to be getting hiked up about five bucks or so whenever the game leaves early access. So all around I would say it is a fantastic monetary and time investment.

                     [b] !Hours of fun and so much more potential to be tapped into as development continues! [/b]

34208213.review:
This is an amazing game and probably my favorite "Behemoth" game to be made since "Castle Crashers" I love this game and it is so far astonishing for an Early Access game I will now give my pros and cons (by the way this review will change when the full game is released)

Pros
-Combat is unique and interesting and is really fun
-The Behemoth has an amazing art style "Dan Paladin" is a very talented artist and I hope he stays the artist of these games he is awesome I love his art style
-I don't know who wrote the dialogue but they did an awesome job as well and there are some really really funny lines said by characters through out the game all around the comedy is really good
-The amount of quests you can do is amazing there are a lot of side quests sadly there aren't many Story Quests but that is only because the game is in Early Access so it's forgivable
-The amount of characters you can recruit and fight is amazing and they all have really cool looking designs
-All the weapons, shields, bows, and just all the items in this game are amazing there are so many of them and they all look really good
-The limited amount of story in this game so far is really interesting and I am very excited to see how the story goes on from where it is now
-Awesome music the people that made the music did an absolutely amazing job I love the music
-The amount of stuff in the overworld is just perfectly done

Cons
-The sound an enemy makes when they see you in the overworld is a tad annoying especially if there are a lot of enemies that notice you

Verdict
-Great art style love it
-Unique combat system I love it
-Awesome soundtrack 
-Amazing amount of quests to do really make this game's runtime longer
-Overworld is really interesting
-The sound enemies make when noticing you is a tad annoying

**Score 10/10** 
(This score may change when the game is fully released)

34095615.review:
I don't really know what to write in this review, I am a huge fan of Behemoth, (I mean look at my profile) but I can't say that I enjoyed most of my time playing, in fact, my playtime as I write this review is incredibly little for me, when I get a new game I can easily spend 20 hours on it or more in a week.

I was hyped for this game, and when it was released into Early Access I wanted to get it immediately, but I forgot later, and when I eventually did buy it was more because it was a Behemoth game than anything else.

Probably my biggest problem with the game is it's not quite as action-packed as most Behemoth games are, this tends to be slow, and the entire gameplay is moving your characters and then your characters do whatever they want. Essentially gameplay is slow and not too engaging, it feels like an incredibly simple board game, it might NOT be incredibly simple but it certainly seems like it. Also, combat and overall gameplay is incredibly repetitive.

Despite being an open-world, their doesn't seem to be much to do, in this game you can pick a quest that has little amusing cutscenes explaining the situation, then you fight. And the combat just isn't enjoyable for me, because again, it's simply selecting a character and moving them. Exploration seems fairly bland to me, the world feels almost randomly generated, being open plains with tree/mountain/buildings/water that have no seemingly real significance besides being things you need to walk around. I'd go so far as to say exploring in Castle Crashers and Battleblock Theater was more interesting. In Castle Crashers you could go through a level, find a cool new weapon, blow up walls to find hidden rooms, or even bring that one bird that finds secrets. In Battleblock Theater you could find secret rooms, and walls that looked real but you could actually walk through, leading you to treasure like gems or yarn.

Treasure is also interesting in Pit People, as far as I know, there is:
-New units.
-New Cosmetics/Armor.
-New Weapons.

It seems to me from my time playing that Pit People has the most character customization, but personally with the different types of weapons and armor I think they overdid it, it's been a while, but I remember lots of different options for armor and weapons. I believe there is like 3 types of shields, 3 types of helmets, a few different types of bows and swords. Seems kind of like a lot for a game so simple. In my opinion, Battleblock Theater actually did weapons really well, weapons are so incredibly different there are lots of things you can do with each one. (Freezing ice or exploding frogs?) Unlike Pit People in my opinion, where you can trade a light shield for a slightly bigger shield. (And yes I am aware that these have minor differences, you know what I mean.)

The humor, possibly the most important thing. Hmm. When I played the game, I was amused for most of the experience, but nothing sticks out as a particularly funny moment and I actually don't recall laughing at all. I won't pretend to be a humor expert, but I didn't laugh. 

I think it's cool that Behemoth has decided to branch out a bit from their usual (beat-em-up?) games, but personally it's not my cup of tea so far. Maybe it will be though, the game is still in Early Access, right? I don't really think I'd recommend this game unfortunately, I really do love Behemoth, but this game isn't something I'd recommend to someone (But I'd still encourage them to try it anyway) who:
A: Enjoyed previous Behemoth games.
B: Enjoys strategy games.

As I haven't said much of anything positive in this review, I'm going to have to not recommend it. Which is causing me physical pain, I love Behemoth, and I'll try this game again sometime.

If I remember more things I will update this review.

34057724.review:
只玩了3.6小时就评论有点冒昧，不过的确是如一些负面评论一样，游戏性一般。

可这是不是一个好游戏呢，我想应该是的，相比The Behemoth早期的作品Castle Crashers，Pit Peolple更成熟更完善，从制作精良的角度来看，如果CC是稚嫩的幼童，那么PP就至少在青年之列了。

可是从故事性来看呢，CC有完整的故事，从王宫里走出来的尬舞骑士，一路跨越平原森林、冰堡火山，最终成功和公主羞羞。PP应该也是有故事的，但就目前来看，主要是小品类型（推测最后会有一个大BOSS）。CC呢属于猴子类型的故事，猴子去取经，讲完就完了，PP就是兄贵类型的故事了，比如杀你全家拉你入伙（捕获角色），再比如。。。

再从世界观来看，我们的朋友，哈帝·海汀顿的帽子绿炸了天际，然后PP混乱的世界开始了，那么CC应该是在PP之后或者和PP同一时期。

再谈趣味，CC有众多骑士与武器可以解锁，但也没有特别炸裂的人物和武器（可能是出于平衡性考虑？另外听说DLC的人物和武器都是不错的），而在PP上就是武器、装备的搭配，其中又包括攻防、重量、属性的选择，自由搭配相比预定义的武器属性，应该是属于进步了。（但由于关键部分汉化未完成、一些提示的缺失，体验一般般）另外很多人吐槽的，PP1000多的人物，应该算是亮点，毕竟就算用同一个模型，1000多人物就对应着1000多的属性和代码，这是不得了的。

可是我还是觉得，CC比PP好玩，为什么呢？

玩CC的，进去就发现自己要战天斗地，一路就是推推推，偶尔有个什么突发事件，会觉得匠心独具，很有意思。

所以，游戏很棒，可惜不（太）吸引人，如果不是The Behemoth的死忠，还是不推荐买的。

The game is take turn battle Rpg-ish, Ip from Behemoth. So that's new.
Amusingly, the bois behind this knew a little more than just silly and amusing artistic value. They also had a good idea for constructing it.
I'm no game critic, but I sure can commend the one feature anyone can vary well note when playing the game. And that is, that your ability to fight has nothing to do with a menu of traits- No sir, this game is played by the bord. Which is to say, your characters do their characterly things based on their position and circumstance. All you gotta do is kick your noggen until it says "I am so abudently kicked that I know just where to move my characters", and presto, you got a great turn for your battle, a turn which is turned into a special spicy array of positions.
If there is a silly wall in your way, you can't get to your foe with your foe devouring sword. And standing betwixt two enemies means double the attack radius.
The organic gameplay feels... organic. 
If you don't play this game, then you will be PitPeopleless, anythingless. That's extra less than you were before; Be honest, your not exactly the most upstanding son of a gun are you? So play Pit People, redeem your silly face.

33819021.review: Great funny game what are you waiting for buy it!!!!!!!!!!!

33814910.review:
Behemoth, you did it again. And this time you really did it!
When I first saw the game in the store, I quickly got the feeling where the game origins come from. Hearing the same narator from the previous titles, I lost it at the very spot.

But my personal question as a life long rts/4x player was: How convincing could a "strategy" (Round based strategy with rpg elements) game be from such a studio?

Well, I was oddly surprised and genuinly impressed when I watched the very beginning in a Let's play video and considered a journey with the game afterwards. The way too familiar characteristics as the artstyle, sound and music (Also the same guy from BBT) never lost their charm, and while I played around 25h in solo I'm looking forward to play it in coop as I rarely had that much actual fun in most games recently.

Taking a closer look the [b]graphics and animations[/b], they surely are nothing comparable to other games like Battlefield, but then again, what would you expect from a 2D strategy game? I wouldn't even dare to compare it to any games other than perhaps Don't starve, if that even. With this kinda pointless statement being said, the graphics are gorgeous and yet simple with clear lines and single color tones, nothing to complain there. The animations are doing their job, but I see in this category why the game is in early acess state. The game holds a large amount of different characters which require different animations (i.e. attack [with various weapon types], take damage, special moves etc.), but some are simply not done (yet?). This problem simply was solved with no animation other than idling, at least you see the feedback from dealt damage by showing numbers of dealt / received damage and mostly the victim animating from taking a hit.

This topic might be a rather personal thing, but I mostly prefer to mute any ingame [b]music[/b] and play something else in the background. This game actually managed to keep me from doing so. While it's quite difficult for me to name the direction the music the game is following, I'm really enjoying the it, as well as the electro swing music played in town. However, I was a bit surprised when I figured out it's actually from a different artist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mSBzvhud3Io . Well, they surely picked a song matching this rather crazy ambiente of a city.

Overall, This game might become my personal favorite game released (in EA state) this year, though there are a few points someone might complain about:

-The character control turns out a bit confusing in multiple aspects, as well as the camera control trying to center the screen but messing up sometimes
-After finnishing the current existing story, I understand people recommending to wait until the full development of the game. You can finnish the existing main story really quick and it suddenly just stops. That was a little turn off when I reached this point.
-I hope that some items will experience various stat modifications in the future. As of now, most items have the same stats and are basically just reskins. A much higher complexity would allow more strategy coming from the equipment.

Overall, I certainly do like this game. Keep it up, Behemoth!<3
[spoiler]And please don't add too many more meme references[/spoilers]

2. 퀘스트 깨는 것을 좋아하시는 분에게 추천드립니다. 저는 다른 RPG장르의 게임을 할 때, 손해가 되는 퀘스트일지라도 무조건 완수하는 성격인데 이 게임에는 메인 퀘스트 외에도 여러 필드 퀘스트가 있고 거점이 게속 이동하기 때문에 다양한 퀘스틀 만나보실 수 있습니다.

다만 개발 단계에 있는 게임이기 떄문에 컨텐츠가 부족하다고 생각하실 수 있고, 메인 퀘스트 또한 아직 짧아 스토리 전개도 얼마 되지 않았습니다. 이런 점 때문에 망설여지신다면 더 경과를 지켜보시다 구매하시는 것이 좋을 듯 싶습니다.(2017.7.26 기준입니다.)

33760958.review:
The best description is on their store page: "strategic game of positioning" which I feel is exactly what this game is. Don't come into this game thinking you'll get a tactical RPG, this is a game where your positioning of units and rock/paper/scissors type elements will dictate your victory. Combat is completely out of your hands outside of positioning- meaning that this is a more passive type of RPG than a traditional TRPG.

 It's a fun and unique system and the co-op elements are amazing but for me it got boring after about 9 hours of playing. Why? Because there isn't much progression involved, you won't be much stronger mid way through the game than you were at the start. Let me clarify, what mostly changes is your capacity for different group make-ups and different ways to counter certain enemies. You'll be stronger in the sense that more options will open up to you, not that your stats/skills are necessarily better. Your stats DO slowly increase as you level but most enemies level with you so it doesn't really net out to any progression that feels like you're getting stronger. You can certainly get cool new items but as an example, a new bow might have less damage than your old bow but will provide some other stat or freeze to compensate. A new monster may be armor piercing but is weak to unicorns. Stuff like that really isn't "progression" in the traditional sense though  as it's all fairly balanced. I guess it's all to encourage you to use anything you want and to balance PVP a bit easier but to me it just means there's less reasons to keep playing.

联机系统使我们的脑力对抗更加激烈。

......


剩下的部分，请各位玩家进入游戏中自己探索。

33724894.review:
[h1]Немного об игре..[/h1]

В игре присутствуют [b]18[/b]  по своему уникальных персонажей, которых вы можете поймать и затем ими играть. Команда состоит из 6 слотов. Только 1 персонаж в игре занимает 3 слота. Вы можете экспериментировать и создать совершенно уникальную команду, которая будет только у Вас, а затем играть на Арене 1х1 или 2х2 или против Бота.

Из за того что игра находиться в [u]раннем доступе[/u], в ней сделана лишь небольшая часть кампании + имеются баги.

[h1]Немного о багах.[/h1]

1) Отключение от сессии на Арене. За то время, которое я наиграл, я очень часто наблюдал, как меня или кого то другого просто выкидывает из сессии. И тех кого выкинуло, заменяет бот. 
2) Сброс пользовательских настроек игры. Бывает выйдешь из игры, зайдешь на следующий день, а у тебя все стоит по умолчанию.

[h1]Немного о комьюнити.[/h1]

Низкий Онлайн. Это очень расстраивает меня. Проблема в том, что Pit People привлекает в основном школьников своей мультяшной графикой, но ведь не у всех есть деньги на игры.

Awesome game, still in Early Access but the core of the gameplay at the moment is the multiplayer which is awesome. As a matter of fact if it wasn't for the EA flag and the incomplete story mode I don't think I'd even realize this game wasn't complete. Pit People basically plays as a fast-paced tactics RPG with a Pokemon style collection element that feels amazing as you progress through the game.

I primarily play via gamepad on my steamlink and it works great, my wife will sometimes join me for coop and the game has no problem reading both gamepads and the keyboard/mouse at all; and even prompts the playstation controller buttons on screen by default - I was really blown away by that bit. 33634251.review:
Pit People is great for co-op!  Finally, something I can jump into that's cooperative instead of competitive and which requires very little investment or foreknowledge to enjoy with a friend.  Don't get me wrong - you certainly benefit from experience with the game and by having more options in your roster - but generally speaking a fresh player is nearly as capable as a veteran and you can have a good time with both casual and dedicated friends in the game.  It doesn't have a ton to offer in single player if you're not into collecting but for co-op I definitely recommend it.  It's fun to see what wacky, creative or just plain devastating combinations you and your buddy can come up with.

I'll admit I stayed away from Pit People for a long time because I just didn't like Castle Crashers... both in terms of gameplay and the humor.  This title works for me in both areas and I was pleasantly surprised.  The "Early Access" aspect was also a point of concern for me but I'm  happy to report the game is quite complete enough for co-op.  Balance changes are still ongoing though so I recommend you don't get too attached to specific strategies and enjoy the variety.

33570677.review:
TL:DR? Charming, Psychotic, and Lemony Fresh

The Behemoth once again bring their charming artstyle and unceasably comedic dialogue to the strategy realm, with hints of the team member catching of pokemon, thousands of unit cosmetics with varying functionality seen in every other jrpg, and the afforementioned charm from Battleblock & Castle Crashers.

Quests and Characters are spread accross the world that inexplicably want to kill you just for 'almost running them over with your wagon.' Reference after reference is hidden everywhere from the NPCs, to the Areas, and even the occasional hairstyle. You wrap yourself into this world of crazy people as a gang of fanged beasts attempt to destroy all our precious cow painted ten-gallon hats, just to give an example of some of the thing you can encounter (and no I did not make that up.)

With the 20 different races to catch (one of them is a clone of another) of varying pros, cons, & strategies entailing them. Each one brings a new set of rules to follow and it's up to you how you want to utilize them in battle as a few are flexible enough to fit different roles. With synergies galore and a new weapon/hat/shield earned after every battle, no one team ever feels the same (unless of course you made it be the same as another team.)

One of it's prime features is the thing that the title speaks of, THE PIT, a multiplayer battle arena where you can duke it out 1v1, 2v2, or face 3 waves back-to-back alone or with a friend by your side. With gold cosmetics able to win via the tournament, you'll be able to show off your champions in their new beautiful outfits in no time!

The biggest problem with the game atm is that its story is missing, something clearly stated by The Behemoth. Although the multiplayer has been the star of their last two games, the story shed light onto the land's lore and brought it's own crowd of players there for a singleplayer experience. I can't feel truly satisfied with this greatness until I see an end to the story, HOWEVER, the core gameplay mechanics are still enough to bring you to enjoy and play it while still in it's early access. If you want to go through the story in one fell swoop then you should wait til full release
, however if you're fine with it's currently unfinished ORDER TODAY!

[b]리뷰[/b]

일단 매우 약빨았다...

그리고 엄청나게 멋진 게임이다.

후술하겠지만 베헤모스사의 모든 게임을 해봤다면 알겠지만, 베헤모스사의 모든 게임의 세계관이 [b]무려 13년간[/b] 이어지는게 엄청나다..

일단 게임의 방식은 턴제 배틀인데 어느 방향으로든 움직일수 있지만 칸의 개수가 정해진 체스같다.

어느 캐릭터를 어디에 두느냐에 따라 승패가 갈라지고, 캐릭터 또한 엄청나게 다양하다.

그리고 무기를 어떻게 사용하느냐에 더 피해를 주거나, 원거리에서 피해를 주거나, 적을 포획할수 있게 된다.

일단 간단하게 이렇게 설명하고 세계관에 대해 설명하겠다.

일단 피트 피플의 시작은 한 죽은 곰이 행성에 부딪히는것으로 시작하는데, 이것이 배틀블럭 씨어터 엔딩에서 부터 이어진다.
(참고로 그 엔딩에도 자세히 보면 에일리언 호미니드가 보인다.)

베헤모스 게임들은 신기하게 새로운 게임이 나온다면, 그걸 예전에 만든 게임 스토리에서 인용해오는데 그것이 무려 13년간 이어진게 신기하다...

(스토리의 순서는 에일리언 호미니드>캐슬 크래셔즈>배틀블럭 씨어터>피트 피플)

에일리언 호미니드의 콘솔판에서 나오는 주인공과 한 보스는 캐슬 크래셔즈라는 게임에 캐릭터와 펫으로 나오고, 캐슬 크래셔즈에서의 기본 캐릭터 4명은 배틀블럭 씨어터에서 가면으로 나온다. 그리고 배틀블럭 씨어터의 엔딩은 지금의 피트 피플을 만든 엄청나게 큰 그림이였다....

만약 이 게임을 더욱 즐기고 싶다면 배틀블럭 씨어터도 추천하는 바입니다.

33545778.review:
To any person who may find this message floating across the endless oceans,

I am writing this from a vastly remote location, a place far from home. Not sure how it happened. One second I was waiting on the cashier at the dollar store, on the way back from work, then the next moment an enormous wormhole or something, a huge black hole you only see in overly ambitious sci-fi movies sucked us all up, then plopped us out in this....this strange, strange world. All of us, everybody at the store, including the store itself. Immediately, we were in the hands of the gods. Their screwed up gods, I tell ya. Colorless fellas with sadistically twisted, morbid and disgusting heads or headpieces, I don't know what to call them, were chanting to a mass-proclaimed deity or something, shouting "Chog, chog!", rooting for the enormous beast to devour us whole in a sort of sacrificial ritual, but all I could think of was how similar their blindly devout chants sounded to the "Chug, chug!" you may hear in a 2005 frat party home video. All of them died, one by one, like mindless sheep in a particularly explicit slaughterhouse. It chills my bones to just think about all the blood and entrails, all the suffering I've witnessed. Some enforcers of the deity, coming at us with loaded machineguns, gigantic baseball bats, rocket launchers that shot cruelly sharp emerald swords and table forks the size of my leg. Huge, smirking bats, furry spiders who all for some reason looked like my mom's girlfriends and one eyed moster people. They all died before my own two eyes, all of them from the store. The naggy, slowpoke clerk, the smelly dude behind me in line, the old lady browsing the kitchen utensils, even her dog who was just patiently waiting, leashed at the entrance. Shot to a bloody damn pulp, that puppy. There were some other people, too. Lots of people, actually. Some of them looked normal, like us, confused and scared. Others looked like them, like the strange people from the crowd, eyes glazed at the arena. Some of those seemed to be joyed by the commotion. Religious followers of the deity, readily prepared to sacrifice themselves, as I found out later. Freakish. Death, death. A resounding thought. I closed my eyes. I felt a thunk, then heard a bang. When I woke up, I was surrounded by maybe 5-6 people, with a mixed variety of strange deformations and dressing habits. Silly hats, ridiculous weapons, fish bowls, cookies, all sorts of weird crap turned into make-shift shileds and weapons. I couldn't understand their gibberish language, but I felt that they had good intentions, towards me at the least. I got handed a few tools to make myself useful. Weapons, terribly unfashionable hats, et cetera. I've been roaming these murderous fields in their company every since. It's been fine so far, I took it better than expected. I was always used to changes, even before, when pops died. However, I am starting to be afraid. Even with all the gibberish, I am beginning to understand the words they are saying. And there is one, just one, even these battle-hardened warriors are deathly afriad to speak out loud. A name, only ever spoken of in whispers, from the shadows. A name that has given them, now us, something to be afraid. A massacrist vagabond, murderous fiend they seem to be....gibbering? Deep in the night, guarding our nomadic tents, they stutter his name. The killer. The murder machine, Horatio. We're all starting to be terribly afriad. I don't wanna die. I'm still just a boy. I put this message in a bottle, hoping it would reach someone. Please, tell my mom I love her very much. Tell her I stole the money from the stash, it wasn't Ellie. Sorry, Ellie, I owe ya one! Please, give Birdcrack, my sweet sweet dog a treat in my name! That is all, world! kthxbyenow

33525789.review:
I like it
Great titles and fresh new genre just like you see from these guys.

(More fleshed out review past the cons0)

Pros:
Has that charm the other titles have, an amazing voice actor, fun openining.
Fast flowing turn progression in combat situations.
pretty balanced characters

Cons:
Havent played online co op or versuses.
Local Play co op camera is trash.
Combat is too long. (Made me avoid enemies and didnt want to engage them)
Equipment system (at least early game) needs work, starting weapons barely mean shit, and there isnt really a ledgend to tell you what all the buffs mean, which is so fuckig needed.







Ive been playing these games from alien hominide up to battle blocks and enjoy how they always change genre and manage to keep the humor fresh, refined and unexpected. I welcomed this new titles and loved the opening which these guys have nailed but this game has a few issues that turned me off at the start of the game.

- The UI is very stylish but all over the place, transistioning is very slight and hard to see and the controls for the ui and very light meaning you can go flying all over the place. The Main Menu Could of been Simpled down without losing its charm. And the City Hub Menu is like castle crashers world hub, maybe pan the camera back or something idk it didnt look right to me.

- The combat is amazing, its free flowing and non turne based, the characters dont have alot of special abilites but you can recruit people who have one special ability. its amazing, and the fact that each character can only do one thing or two, the proximity targeting is a great balance for strategical planning. But the fights become way to long winded, as i said before i was turned off after the prolouge mainly cause of the combat, The co op pust a boat load of enemies on the field which at first looks exciting(i will get to that in a minute), but evtually become a turn off to me cause i know i will be here for more than ten minutes, both enemies and your team barely do much damage, i had flankers go for archers but it took 12 turns to get one and the flanker died,   The slow crawling pace of the fights are leagues different from the fast paced action based game previously made, and again i havent played to much but if i was to suggest maybe quicker fights but add a few more enemies to balance it out, heck bring in reinforcements, The previous titles liked to try and overwhelm you before but the challenges are always fair.

- Lastly , ive played the co op and like all the other titles you share a screen, but that becomes a major flaw, the camera doesnt pan out for both cursors, sometimes forcing one to move, it doesnt try to center both and making descions without having to wait on your partner to finish making his choices is a god damn bore, it either needs splitscreen or a better camera that pans out. i did not like waiting when i wanted to get right back in the fight, the enemy turns are instant but i had to wait for my partner so i could make my choices or vise versa. we ended up just meeting at the middle and forcing the enemy to come to use. the camera forces team play which isnt bad but im saying it again but its different the other titles, before co operation was not needed, hell you could obstruct and ruin your partner for the giggles but mechanics were also given so that you could do the opposite. Sometimes you are forced to co operate and sometimes its more fun to lone wolf. But this title, the camera is so bad for co op play that it some how forces you to work to gether so the camera wouldnt bother you.

Again i cant speak for the whole, game just my few hours of playing it. Im somewhat mixed on the early access, it lets me know the game is being worked on but i fear it may die out. I hope it improves and comes back well polished.

33464364.review:
Don't let the Early Access status prevent you from dropping a few bucks on this game. As an avid player of Battleblock Theater (On Xbox), it was easy to make the decision to buy. Humorous, diverse, a few secrets and a TON of weapons to find, one of the best soundtracks I've heard in a while, AND comes with a narrator out to make the main protagonist's life hell, Pit People is worth every dollar spent on it, even in it's current Early Access state. It has potential to be an amazing game after the release of the completed version. Speaking of Early Access, if you want it, you better get it now before the price raises for the completed game.


As a warning, here's some features and things to consider before you whip out your wallet:

-The story is incomplete, so you'll be waiting on that for a bit.
-It's not really getting constant updates.
-There aren't many City Quests series at the moment; we're standing at about 6, but each one offers it's own challenge, with weapons, gold, and sometimes exclusive fighters as rewards. The dialouge and story for said quests is quite humorous, you'll at one point find yourself recreating what's basically the American Revolution (see 'The R3DC04Ts Are Coming!')
-When traversing the world map, there are MANY quests to find and do, they'll usually result in fighting. You'll get juicy rewards from them though!
-There is a wide variety of fighters to 'recruit'. Said recruiting is done through killing your target's friends while leaving him alive to watch, then throwing a net at them and stuffing them into a cage not shortly after throwing said net at them.
-Also, said fighters can also have some pretty good gear that you can strip from them later and place onto your better fighters, others have overall stupid but funny names, said names are left up to RNGesus to pick.
-Once you've made a good, well balanced and well leveled team, you can place them into 'The Pit' to fight to the death against other players in real time via use of a giant space telephone. However, I can say from experience that finding somebody to battle with takes quite a while, so be prepared to wait. 



Choice is up to you if you want to buy Pit People or not, but I highly recommend you do. Once again, before the price raises after it's completed.

33412483.review:
Pit People is a fun tactical strategy game, but it has some strange mechanics that, while relatively unique, often fall rather flat.

Damage  tends to stay very low in Pit People, which can be a problem because unit health doesn't seem to follow the same standard. Taking out an enemy in a single turn is near impossible, and even healers are surprisingly tanky, which can end up making many fights into battles of attrition around a single choke point. 

All unit targetting is completely automatic, as a unit will target any enemy within range at random with priority given to closer targets when applicable. There are ways the player is expected to manipulate this, including making sure only a single target is within your range or flooding an enemy's range with minions and such to mess with their targetting, but it comes off as more annoying than anything else. However, there are some clever uses of this random targetting that make up for it, like one unit who can make people target other units on their team making enemy AoE units completely backfire and splash onto their own units, but those are far too chance based for my liking.

There's a vaguely Disgaea-esque distiction between human and monster units, where human units have a large amount of customization for their stats and equipment while monsters are limited to a single or often no customization option/s. That being said, most of the customizations boil down to damage+dodge or defense+block for melee, and damage or number of shots for ranged characters. 

[strike]Probably my biggest qualm with the game though is the fact that it is nearly impossible to see numbers on ANYTHING besides damage and status infliction. How much defense does my Gorgon have compared to my Mushroom? Who knows, one bar is slightly taller than the other! How much health does my Archer have? 4 and a half hearts worth! How much is a heart worth? Who knows! How much health does that Fairy have left? Somewhere between 1/4 and 1/3, and that's all you get to know![/strike] EDIT: As it turns out, most of this can be found out if you mouse over the stats in the customization menus. 

Despite all my mechanic complaints, Pit People is still a very fun game, but don't go into it expecting the height of strategic gameplay or you'll be pretty disappointed.

33403146.review:
Possibly one of the best turn-based X-Com style strategy games already, with an easy-to-learn hard-to-master combat system and an extremely addictive """recruitment""" system in which you find the bloke with the funniest name and store him in your """home""" just because they're called "Meme" or "Wonkydong".

Visually, the game retains the novelty of the iconic Behemoth art style even after all these years, already putting it far ahead of many games - especially in the AAA market - which lack any kind of personality. Everything is lively and original, just like Castle Crashers or BattleBlock Theather.

The music is quite something, too! Again, as expected from a top tier indie developer, many of the tracks really stick out as something out there and original with a much smaller emphasis on orchestral compositions and a much larger focus on combining unique sounds you don't hear every day or using singular instruments which really stand out.

Of course, since this is an Early Access game on Steam in 2017, you can easily expect one of two things about the dev support: Either the dev commits fully to noting every single mistake, responding to bug reports from their players and working with them on fixing said bugs and mistakes OR they couldn't care less and leave the game in Early Access for years to come. I'm extremely pleased to say that Pit People's dev team lands itself in the former category! I've personally reported a few bugs (/ grammar mistakes) and had the devs list the problems on their site then fix them within upcoming patches and work with me to find the root of a bug more complicated than spellchecking. 

Overall I can see an extreme passion for this game from the fantastic dev team and can't see it dropping below "Overwhelmingly Positive" in the near future. Definitely recommended if you enjoy strategy, witty dialogue and charming visuals!

33396270.review:
Take this with a grain of salt as I played this for less than an hour.

This game was on the top of my wishlist for a very long time before it came out as an early-release title. I love hex strategy games and thoroughly enjoyed Castle Crashers, so I figured combining a company that made a game I liked with a genre I liked was a no-brainer.

Unfortunately, I ended up putting in for a refund for two main reasons:

1. The game is a console port and it shows. The mouse and keyboard controls are extremely bad. If you're willing to play with a controller this may be less of an issue for you, but strategy games play pretty badly on a controller in the first place.

2. It's actually EXTREMELY casual. There's a super-hard mode available but it doesn't make the fundamental gameplay any less casual. The only command you give your characters is where to move. ALL other decisions are handled by the AI, including which character or characters within range to attack if multiples are present. What type of action is taken is handled in a relatively intelligent manner (the AI doesn't attempt melee attacks when out of range for example), but the bottom line is still that the only choice the player has is where to move.

The writing and art are great as expected from Behemoth, but I just can't recommend it as a strategy game when so few options are available to the player.
