33389372.review:
Let me get this out of the way: I don't understand this game, and it's overwhelmingly positive reception. I'll be getting my refund, thanks.

I don't understand the point of a tactics-esque game where you're not allowed to pick what strategy your units use and pick who attacks who. To compound on this basic flaw, there's not a lot (or none, whatsoever) of depth or variety to the gameplay, you just move your guys, hope they attack the right ones, and then end your turn. As far as I can tell, there's no skills, special abilities, classes or anything that the forerunners in the genre established.

Every fight becomes more or less the same... Put Horatio at the front so his shield can absorb some arrows, try to stun people and never succeed with throwing axes, and watch on in abject frustration as your useless cupcake heals the wrong people entirely while you're trying to keep your tank alive. Hit the people with helmets with your mace. Kill everyone but the named person and net them to recruit them onto your squad while praying their AI is slightly better than the other units you have. It's not. It's never better.

It's tedious.

And it's sense of humor, while a plus at first, does grow old by the time the tutorial is over... which means that there's a whole lot of game left having to deal with what is essentially the worst elements of Adventure Time mashed up with the worst elements of Kingdom of Loathing and other "early internet" "so random" fair. The beach bullies have sick hotrods, because why wouldn't they? A guy flies in dual-wielding AK47s on the back of a giraffe with a noose made of balloons and drops into the arena... to be killed in the same tedious way every other enemy is.

The presentation, at least, is good, but I could not good in conscience recommend this game to anyone, ever based on it's basic design flaws.

33347615.review:
В принипе игра хорошая так то если чо. Юморок хороший, графит выдержанный в старом стиле Behemoth, но вот только сам геймпле довольно странный, я поясню почему. Я не буду писать плюсы этой игры, их достаточно много, я сразу пройдусь по минусам, а люди пусть решают что для них критично и т.д.
Минусы:
- Долгие бои. Я хз как вы, мамкины любители тактики,  это терпите, но это чиздец. Один бой от 10 и больше минут, и всё это время не происходит ничего интересного. Нет, например, такого же экшона как в боях героев и т.д, порой просто рельно ты сидишь и думаешь "Баля, а мне ещё 80% игры проходит, а там вся игра их таких скучных боёв состоит. Почему скучные? Потому что меняется только положения врагов и, следовательно, твоих юнитов и друг друга вы еле колупаете, просто потом сидишь с джойстиком и думаешь когда это закончится. Именно из-за этого пропадает желание находить и драться с новыми видами врагов на карте, понимаешь просто что сейчас опять будет бой на 30 часов.
- Предметы. На данный момент 70% предметов не дают никакого преимущества, они тупо косметические. Я конечно понимаю, что это "смешно" кидаться вместо топоров лампочками или трубочками, или другим дерьмом, но камон бля, какой в этом смысл? Или взять просто поменять своему персонажу голову на какую-нибудь ультра тупую, которая ничего не даёт. Не знаю, сеттинг у игры очень своеобразный и ебанутый по хорошему, но порой ощущение полнейшого хаоса и беспорядка заставляет беситься.
Собственно первый минус меня заставляет постоянно думать перед включением игры. Я даже хз, ждать релиза или проходить сейчас. Надеюсь разрабы услышат ещё несколько таких-же как я бедолаг и сделают битвы более быстрыми и экшоновыми.

33303383.review:
I was holding back on reviewing on this game, for 2 reasons. It's in early access, and I felt like I might not have known what I was talking about if I had reviewed it earlier. But at 38 hours right now, I feel like I know enough about the game to assess what's right and wrong with it (at least at the moment). 

To start off, let me just say that I love The Behemoth. I've never played Alien Hominid, but I've poured a lot of hours into Battleblock Theater and Castle Crashers. Both of those games I immensely enjoyed, and still play quite a bit today. So, after seeing the release of this game in the steam store about 5 months ago, I was extremely excited. Fast-forward to the first few days of the summer sale. I bought this game right away.

In my first few hours of the game, I really enjoyed it. It seemed a little simplistic, but I figured that was just because I was still in the beginning. The art, music, and atmosphere were (and are) wonderful. But what occurred as I continued to play was the grave realization that perhaps the gameplay wasn't one of the strong points. 

Many other people have complained that battles are way too slow-paced, although that wasn't a real weak point in my eyes. My main problems were the repetitive gameplay, the lack of progression, and because of that, not much of a reason for encounters. 

Let's start with the repetitive gameplay. The game has somewhere around 100 quests. At the moment, there are about 3 story quests, 7 questlines, and the rest are one off quests found out in the wild. The problem with these is that there's only really 2 missions. One is to fight a battle. The other is to go to a certain point (and sometimes fight a battle when reaching said point.) On occasion a mission will have a small twist, such as having to destroy a wall, or having to protect a certain unit. Other than that though, the missions are mostly the same, with the exception of different dialouge, which is enjoyable, but doesn't help the lacking gameplay. 

The gameplay in a battle itself isn't bad, but gets repetitive after a while. After playing with the same team for a while, you'll see that the same strategies and moves always seem to emerge, and, most battles end up being handled in a similar way as the others. The main weak point with the repetition is that you don't get a lot out of it. This leads me to my next point, which is the fact that there is virtually no progression in the game.

The lack of progression in this games stems from the fact that leveling up does almost nothing for your unit leveling up. A level 99 (max) unit might have maybe 1 or 2 more in the damage stat than a level 1 unit. If you've played the game, you'll know that this is not a lot at all. Besides that, even though there are loads of them, the items that you use on your units have mostly the same exact stats, but are just sorted into different subgroups. There are about 4 different helm groups, a few different weapon groups, and that's about it. Some of them have light changes, but this is not a lot of them. And to add insult to injury, most units can't even use items that affect their performance. For example, cupcakes (healers) are all exactly the same. The items used on them are purely cosmetic and don't affect anything gameplay-wise. Besides the miniscule stat bonus you get from tons of leveling, every cupcake's stats are the exact same thing. Humans and cyclopses are the only units to be able to use all categories as far as I know. The rest either have none or can equip one of the helmet subgroups (with the exception of the gorgon, that can equip a sword)

[Update: As of Update 5, stat upgrades are used a lot more liberally, with 1 every 10 levels or so. I think this is a good addition, but the rest of the points in my review still stand.]

So, the only thing you get out of capturing/encounters are cosmetic items and gold. What does gold do? It lets you buy more cosmetic items in the market, or buy supplies before you leave the town (which are going to help you get more cosmetic items.) This just lets the game boil down into two things: An insanely tedious collect-a-thon (most quests last about 15-25 minutes and only net a few items.), and decent actual gameplay that gets old quickly. I feel like more effort was put into adding more to already thousands of items, than actually worrying about gameplay.

There are a few other things besides that. PvE in normal mode feels way too easy. I realize that differentiating normal and insane mode in a more free-roaming game is harder to do, but I feel like normal mode never really poses a challenge, whereas in the other Behemoth games, Normal mode posed a challenge, at least for a short time.  

TL;DR

The core gameplay in Pit People isn't bad. It just get's repetitive after grinding for items for a long time. If you really want to pick up this game, I recommend PvP, because I'd definitely say that it's the game's strongest point.

Overall, I think my main problem with this game is that it too heavily revolves around collecting cosmetic items, instead of having some kind of satisfying progression. I don't see why people enjoy this game *so* much, but if they do, good for them. If you enjoy dumping tons of hours into repetitive gameplay where collecting doesn't do any good for you, then you'll probably enjoy this game. The thing that really hurts is that I really wanted to enjoy this game. There's definitely tons of potential for great gameplay, an awesome atmospthere, great graphics and dialogue, and abstract but enjoyable music, but that's just my two cents.

5/10


Major Edit 1: I'd like to make clear that this review was written during update 4. If my opinion changes in the future, I'll make sure to revisit this review. The Update 5 roadmap has just been released, and it includes some features that I'm looking forward to (Leveling, Permadeath mode, etc.) It can be found here: http://steamcommunity.com/app/291860/discussions/0/1470840994976597316/

33282451.review:
Bienvenue sur le nouveau jeu de The Behemoth : Pit People 

Un jeu au monde coloré et à l'humour si particulier du Studio, ou votre but sera de tout faire pour venger votre famille.
Le jeu fonctionne comme un T-Rpg classique,  on déplace ses uniter sur la cartes et on élimite les unité ennemi en essayant au passage d'en enrôlé une si possible. 

Dis comme ça le jeu ne semble pas folichon, pourtant la possibilité de jouer en coop rends cela encore plus amusant, mieux que cela la coop et le multi sont la véritable force de ce jeu ! Et ça tombe bien, puisque je vais surtout décrire ces fonctionnalité là. Mais avant tout quelques rapides base sur le jeu en dehors des combats:

Le jeu se présente sous la forme d'une carte géante, composer de case hexagonal, en dehors de la ville. On s'y déplace au moyen d'un chariot équipé d'un canon étourdissant, dont l'utilité est d'obtenir le premier tours dans les batailles. On y croise plusieurs petites maisons habité par des pnjs pouvant proposer des quêtes et une ville. La ville se compose de plusieurs magasin, d'une entrée où on pourra préparer le voyage, grace à l'achat de divers objet contre quelques pièces d'or. D'un stand de marché ou il sera possible d'y recruter des combatant(marché aux esclaves) ou d'acheté divers armes et armures pour équiper sa petite troupe. On trouvera aussi en ville un téléphone géant pour l'accès aux fonctionnalité aux jeux en coop en ligne ou local. D'une arène nommé le Pit et d'un jukebox pour tout ce qui est option de jeu.

Voilà pour les bases du jeu, mais maintenant les fonctionnalité multijoueur :

Le multijoueur se déclinera sous deux forme la phase pvp et la phase coopération.

Le pvp se déroulera principalement dans ce que le jeu nomme le "Pit", une arène à la configuration incertaine ou il sera possible soit d'affronter d'autre joueur en équipe ou en solo, soit de faire équipe avec un joueur pour dérouiller du pnj et ce dans le but de faire progresser ses héros et de glaner quelques pièces fort utile pour aquérir les objets cité plus haut. 

La coopération quand à elle vous permettra de partager l'intégralité de l'aventure avec un ami. Celui-ci contrôlera sa propre équipe de héro et disposera aussi de son propre inventaire, il vous sera possible d'échanger les objet aquit au fil de l'aventure avec votre compagnon.  On notera aussi la présence de Friendly fire qui ajoutera à la fois un peu de piquant et de stratégie au gameplay, votre allié pouvant à tout moment se retourner contre vous et vous tuer aussi. 


Conclusion: Pit People est un bon petit jeu à partager avec un ami, qu'il soit fidèle ou non le jeu aura autant de saveur qu'un Cupcake.

33264246.review:
I had a friend tell me to check this out because it was done by the same people that made Castle Crashers and Battleblock Theatre.  I was initially a bit hesitant because of the early access status and the turn based combat which I generally haven't cared for in games since the early 2000's.

The first hour or two may be rough in figuring out the quirks and getting your butt kicked, but once I got the hang of it, this game's charm and absolute craziness that made me love the previously mentioned two games finally hooked me in here. At first combat feels slow with the turn based movement, but a couple of hours it turned out to be fine with the given need to position units carefully and plan out strategies ahead of time.  This game gives lots of customization options, lots of different classes you can recruit for your squad, and quite a bit of depth with each class and equipment having their own ups and downs.  

Playing solo gives quite a bit of content, but if you have a buddy to play co-op with, this game's content increases exponentially as you two can coordinate your own squads to take into battles.  Mixing and matching our teams has been an absolute blast.  The music in this game is pretty damn catchy too, with no themes really feeling like they overstay their welcome or becoming too repetitive.  If you loved the artwork from Behemoth's other titles, and you loved the narrator from Battleblock Theatre, you absolutely need to get this game while you still can at a lower price in it's early access status.

33262923.review:
Previous readers of my reviews have listed my reviews as Non-helpful, so I will try to clarify information about this game to help you make an informed decision on whether or not to buy this game. 

     I am one of the few original fans of Newgrounds.com and their amazing selections of humorous animations, underground soundtracks and colorful art galleries; I grew up on that site.  If any of that sounds familiar to yourself, then this is one of the best purchases you can come across, and possibly the best waste of time you'll ever invest in.  (In a good way.)  

     This game focuses on immature humor, fun challenging gameplay and collecting stuff in game (There is over 1400 items to collect).  If none of that tickles your fickle, then this absolutely not for you.

      The gameplay is a little bit similar to Xcom, turn based stradegy combat.  The story is more focused on the journey you make for yourself across the game's world map, much like castle crashers: Good hunting down Evil without much character development in a more comedic fashion.  The in game collectables are pretty to look at and are easy to unlock, half of them are weapons and the other half are cosmetics for your units.  The sidequests are cleverly written and very witty, the massive amount of content in this game glistens with charm from Developers who clearly care about what they make.

        Also a side note here, clearly the game isn't finished, the story missions are not all there.  If you compare the amount of story missions we have now to the story missions we had in Castle Crashers and Battleblock theatre, I'd say we are a loooong ways away from getting all the story missions and cutscenes in total.

33218741.review:
收集要素爱好者8分以上；个人7.5分

推荐的理由
++风格讨喜（很可爱）
风格独特，颇具匠心（卡通+黑色幽默）
+++收集要素
这款游戏对喜欢收集要素的玩家来说，是一款超值游戏。你可以在游戏中挥霍大把时间收集服装、武器、怪物（包括人形和非人形的）
+支线丰富
目前主线时间很短，但是里面支线任务丰富（一百多个貌似？），而且还提供了天梯（笑），PVP、PVE之类的
+平衡性
平衡性很好，角色等级的提升不会增加人物任何属性（可能我看错了），在PVP的情况下，阵容的合理搭配才能左右胜负
+++后续更新
个人极为看好。目前的内容，不看剧情主线的长短的话，这是一款极为良心的作品
+探索地图
很大很大！即使是我的错觉，地图上的内容也极其丰富。而且我中途发现世界地图变了一次！难道是主角的大本营会移动？

不推荐的理由
--主线很短
前面说过了，专注于主线的话，目前的剧情2个小时就可以过完（虽然我刷了6个多钟头2333）
-我想无双...
角色等级的提升如果不能带来实际的优势，升级也似乎不怎么令人振奋了。除了状态回满，升级似乎没其他好处。不过这就是这个游戏的特点，也不用太纠结
-刷久乏味
我短时间内玩多了容易感到乏味，别的游戏也这样吧应该……
-目前汉化不够完全
可以理解，毕竟游戏的内容还在不断完善增加更新中
---网络对战联赛经常无法正常上传数据（7月8日补充）
被连续恶心了多日，这个毛病终于让我受不了了……刷了半小时一小时，结果没有几分，这种糟透顶的经历不亚于玩主流电竞晋级赛赢了却莫名其妙被判负的感觉，因为这个，今天真想直接给这个游戏改成差评，烦透了！我已经完全丧失了联机刷分的动力。就在刚刚又狗屎的连胜两盘结果全不记分！完全导致我没心情搞第三盘（赢了就有大笔奖励，但可能仍然还是没有几分）。我真是受够了！这破服务器有改进的可能吗？不能的话，我只能等主线剧情出来才有继续玩的动力了——反正我不想再玩联机了，太恶心人了！

【结语】
买了之后感觉只赚不亏——主要是游戏内容还在不断的补充中。个人十分喜欢它(*^__^*)非常期待这游戏的成品会是什么样。制作良心，顺便还关注收藏了一波这厂的其他制作的其他游戏。
——以下2017/7/6 增加——
经常由于网络问题导致战绩上传失败，很糟心……

33157548.review:
[i] The Behemoth не может не радовать, это безоговорочный факт. [/i]

Ура, товарищи! Фантазия разработчиков вновь фонтанирует в сторону шедеврального проекта, имя которому - Pit People. Игра цепляет с первых же минут. Чего стоит одна только завязка сюжета, черника и внезапное появление антагониста, [spoiler] всевидящего всемогущего самовлюблённого космического медведя, по совместительству рассказчика [/spoiler], на злодеев Бегемоту воображения всегда хватало. Это же воображение породило хаотичный и безумный игровой мир, полный циклопов, фей, гномов, кишащий отсылками и авторским юмором, живущий по своим собственным необъяснимым законам...

Короче, вот какие положительные черты имеет Pit People:
- Яркий и запоминающийся визуальный стиль
- Непредсказуемое безумное развитие сюжета
- Дополнительные квесты, дополнительные сюжетные линии
- Заседающий в мозгу саундтрек (Wash my hands, ага)
- Широкая возможность кастомизации своего маленького войска мстителей 
- Наличие мультиплеера

Из отрицательных черт могу назвать лишь довольно однообразный геймплей, который начинает наскучивать к десятому часу прохождения. Но, как мне кажется, любителям пошаговых стратегий он зайдёт и не выйдет на очень долгое время. Также ощущается некая несбалансированность игровых рас. Гномы и духи, например, выходят совсем бесполезными, в то время как феи и роботы разносят вражеский строй наповал. 

Интересно и решение разработчиков выпустить игру в раннем доступе. Я считаю это правильным решением. Игра будет редактироваться, дополняться и изменяться, а отзывы игроков помогут направить работу в правильное русло. Тем более, что в раннем доступе обещали не засиживаться - Pit People будет в стадии разработки не больше года.

В общем-то, Pit People - это эдакий Heroes of Might and Magic, нашинкованный фирменым стилем The Behemoth. Никакого намёка на серьёзность, сплошная анархия и оры - это именно то, что давно не встречалось в таком количестве в выходящих в последнее время играх. Определённо рекомендую эту игру!

Ingredients

3/4
cup granulated sugar SAVE $

cup packed brown sugar SAVE $
1
cup butter or margarine, softened SAVE $
1
teaspoon vanilla
1
egg SAVE $
2 1/4
cups Gold Medal™ all-purpose flour
1
teaspoon baking soda

teaspoon salt
1
cup coarsely chopped nuts
1
package (12 ounces) semisweet chocolate chips (2 cups)
Steps
1
Heat oven to 375ºF.
2
Mix sugars, butter, vanilla and egg in large bowl. Stir in flour, baking soda and salt (dough will be stiff). Stir in nuts and chocolate chips.

Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheet.

Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until light brown (centers will be soft). Cool slightly; remove from cookie sheet. Cool on wire rack.

33055632.review:
Pit People, one of the games I was looking forward to for some time, is, at its core, a fun, inventive and hilarious game with some real depth to it's gameplay. The graphics are bright and appealing, the music, sound and voice acting (take a bow Stamper) are excellent, crisp and fitting and the atmosphere and humour is highly amusing, resulting in one of those rare instances where I find myself laughing out loud whilst I play

The negatives, few as they are, barely upset this high trend. The game can be a little confusing at times, lack of information or a tutorial outside of basic combat can be a tad frustrating and online battles tend to be extremely one sided as some players who are a higher level, and having farmed the best weapons and characters, will crush those that barely know anything about the game. The biggest offender of this was when I came up against someone three times my level with the best gear and enemies in his roster. Turned out, they had clocked in a couple hundred hours of the game where as I had clocked in a miserable five.

That point aside, this game is still highly enjoyable and fun and, a must for those of Stamper especially.
88/100

[h1]Pit People® is awesome ![/h1]

Wieder einmal eine gelungene, sehenswerte, absolut geniale Leistung von 'The Behemoth'. 

Wer BattleBlock Theater und/oder Castle Crasher gefeiert hat, wird dieses Spiel lieben. 
Selber abgedrehter Humor wie bei den andern Spielen. Schwachsinnige, situationsabhängige, lustige Sprüche. <3 
Diesmal statt Jump 'n' Run (BBT) oder Side-Scrolling Beat ’em up (CC) was ganz Neues - Ein Strategie Spiel der ganz besonderen Art. 

Die Liebe zum Detail in jedem Moment spürbar. 
Dieses rundenbasierte Strategie Spiel macht besonders in Co-op Modus (sowohl online als auch lokal) extrem viel Spaß. Man kann zwischen Story Modus, Neben Quest, Online 2 vs 2 und dem Arena Modus wählen. 
Alles schon getestet - sehr nice! 

[b]Positiv:[/b]
- knuffiges Art-Design 
- toller Humor
- abwechslungsreiche Waffen/Charaktere
- individuell einstellbar (gefarmte Waffen/Charaktere)
- Dailly Quests
- coole Abenteuerstory
- einfache Steuerung (Controller bevorzugt)
- gelungene Soundtracks

[b]Negativ:[/b]
- noch keine Steam Karten 
- leider der Zeit zu wenig Spieler für den 2 vs 2 Modus, man muss lange warten um was zu finden... 

Abschließend lässt sich von mir sagen: Absolute Kaufempfehlung. 
Trotz derzeitigem Early Access Status, spielenswert und lohnenswert. 
Würde es mir jeder Zeit wieder kaufen. 

[spoiler]Das Einhorn ist echt am Besten! xD[/spoiler]

(\ /)
( . .)   Hoffe ich konnte euch damit weiter helfen.

32962284.review:
Pit People no es el típico juego de estrategias por turno.

Se trata de un título traido de la mano por los chicos de The Behemoth con su magnífico arte y diseño, y su particular sentido del humor, el cual hará que te partas de risa desde el primer momento que empieces la aventura.

El juego se basa en casillas hexagonales y combates por turno, pero con un factor único a tener en cuenta: solo tendrás control sobre el movimiento de cada miembro de tu banda, nada más.
Esto que en principio puede parecer algo simplista, resulta en un modo de juego muy dínamico, rápido y emocionante, donde la estrategia vendrá en el posicionamiento, el equipamiento y el tipo de unidad que hayamos decidido que formará parte de nuestro equipo.

A todo esto hay que añadir una gran variedad de objetos, tipos de ataque, armaduras, habilidades, etc. los cuales crean una infinidad de posibilidades de personalización.

Además, trae consigo una muy buena campaña principal (aun sin acabar) con muchas horas de juego, al igual que  una gran cantidad de misiones secundarias que añaden ese toque de exploración que tanto gusta. Sistemas de PvP, cooperativo, daily missions, coleccionismo, etc.

En definitiva, con casi 100 horas de juego, aun sigo teniendo material por descubrir y por coleccionar. Por tanto, no me queda otra que recomendar este pequeño gran tesoro llamado Pit People.

Saludos. :)

32907971.review:
A brilliant start to a possibly brilliant game, ive heard a lot of bad things about this early access game such as it has no strategy and the gameplay is rather shallow but I think Pit People is on its way to be a great strategy game.

The story is humorous and interesting and I'm loving the direction its taking.

The units already in the game have great synergy with each other allowing for multiple team options. The controls while a little confusing at first are really simple and easy to get used to.

A few things it still needs
1) More people to play PVP (Although the PVP is still really good for Early Access)
2) More different units for more diversity, honestly the more you add the more strategy the game will have.
3) PVP should set the levels of all units to a certain level if it doesn't already. This would mean anyone can play PVP at any level and point in the game.
4) Some Units may need some balancing, such as the Units taking up 2 slots may need a very slight damage buff, mainly Hair Troll as Gorgons seemed balanced with their spawn ability.

Overall a great game and one im looking to being finished.

8/10 so far

32755552.review: I grew up at the tail end of what I'll call "the Newgrounds generation"-- that is, the adolescent boys (and, to a lesser degree, girls) who spent their youth on the website of Tom Fulp, engaging in the flash animations and games and becoming part of that underground internet subculture. I was always captivated by that which made Newgrounds, Newgrounds-- the fact that anyone could make anything and upload it, and anyone else could comment on it or rate it. And nothing stood out to my juvenille mind more than the works that made the website famous; the ultra-violent Madness Combat series; the absurdist humor of Eddsworld; the insane difficulty of early iterations of Super Meat Boy... The list of media that changed my budding self can go on and on. I retained all of it; I'll blame my entire personality and sense of humor on what I grew up watching and playing on my dad's old laptop. But the one export of Newgrounds that I always loved the absolute most was The Behemoth. I fell in love with their beat-em-up classic Castle Crashers at a Kid's Night Out party, as I played it on an Xbox 360 there. I was obsessed. Every waking moment I would think about, draw about, talk about the game. When I finally got my own Xbox 360, Castle Crashers was one of the first games I bought for it, back when you paid in Xbox points (where one dollar was equal to 80 or 160 points). I was a junkie for that game; I even brought my own Xbox to my friend's houses so we could play together locally. Years later, when I heard they made Battleblock Theatre, I bought it on the spot. It was everything I wished for-- The Behemoth's signature art style, sense of humor, and pefectly challenging gameplay, but on a platformer. I had a new drug, and I was hooked. I played that game whenever I could. Sadly, eventually, the burning passion I held in my youth died out. I would still play both games (Alien Homonid too, but to a lesser extent) from time to time, reminiscing on the bygone era of the post-Golden age of Newgrounds. Time passed, and I caught wind of a new Behemoth game from either Game Informer or PC Gamer in the magazine rack of a local supermarket. And this time, it was a turn-based RPG! I was amazed. I was excited. I spent as much time as I could researching it, trying to find out where, when, and how I could play it. That was years ago. Pit People was a cloudy fuzz of nostalgia and excitement in my mind until the day I opened up steam and what did I see on the front page-- Out now, Pit People. I was ecstatic. I couldn't wait to get it. What stopped me? My own wallet. In my youth my pocket changed flowed freely, and I splurged on whatever I felt like-- games, DLC, food, movies-- but in my teenage years I was not the same. I decided to myself, "ah, early access. I'll wait until it comes out for real". 4 updates passed, and I couldn't hold back. I whipped out my debit card on the first day of the Summer Sale and proceeded to buy it. And I must say, it's everything I hoped for and so, so much more. Where do I begin? Everything is exactly as I remember The Behemoth. The gameplay is challenging, in just the right level of fun. There's tons of options for how you want to play the game. There are cosmetics galore. The story is humorous but engaging, light but oh so rich. The announcer is the same from Battleblock Theatre and I love it as I did back then. This is the kind of game I would have made for the young version of myself growing up at my dad's overheating computer playing on Internet Explorer until I accidentally discovered Firefox. I give this game a perfect 10. If anyone at The Behemoth is reading this post, I want to tell you: Keep up the great work. The Behemoth quite literally shaped my mind as a child and it's just as good as I remember it.

32753384.review:
ゲームの概要は他のプレイヤーの記述通りなので、COOPとシステム周りについて

　まずCOOPをプレイするためには、それぞれシングルでチュートリアルをプレイしなければならず、おおよそ２０分程度の時間が必要である。初回は飛ばせないようなので、これは手っ取り早く協力プレイしたい人間にとってはマイナスである。

　チュートリアル後は、街でメインクエスト或いはサブクエストを選択してから、ワールドマップを移動して目的地を目指し、その目的地でクエストを完了する。クエストはだいたいは戦闘だが、単に荷物を届けるというようなものもある。また街で請け負えるクエストのほか、ワールドマップ移動中にフラッシュでクエストが発生しているようである。
　敵との通常戦闘はシンボルエンカウント制であり、ワールドマップ移動中に敵シンボルにミサイルを命中(弾無限、クールダウン有)させることで敵をスタンさせ戦闘を避けることができる。
COOPの場合ワールドマップの操作は、どちらかがキャラクターの移動を、どちらかがミサイルの発射を担当する。

　戦闘では、それぞれのプレイヤーのパーティをそれぞれのプレイヤーが操作をする。それぞれが操作完了キューを出せばターンが進行する。キャラクターの位置取りはプレイヤー次第だが、そのキャラの攻撃範囲内でどの敵を攻撃するかはランダムである。よって特定の敵だけを攻撃したい場合はその敵だけを攻撃する位置に移動する必要があるなど、キャラクターの位置取りは意外と重要になってくる。また武器、防具、属性などの相性があり、戦闘を有利に進めるためにはそれらを考慮しないとCOOPであろうとなかろうと序盤から大苦戦することになるだろう。見た目によらず戦闘は手ごたえがあり、いわゆる楽勝で終わることは少ないだろう。
　そして戦闘に勝利するとそれぞれのプレイヤーにいくつかのアイテムやお金が与えられる。クエストを完了して街に戻る。この繰り返しでゲームを進行することになる。

　で、目立った問題点は、UI、戦闘システム周りの説明が圧倒的に不十分ということである。
　多種にわたる武器や防具の性能を一目でわかるようにアイコンで簡略化しているようであるが、そのアイコンが何を意味するのか初見ではまず分からないし、ツールチップも簡略が過ぎる。新しい武器の性能や範囲などが分かりづらいため、いまいち自分のプレイスタイル、状況に合わない武器を持って行ってしまった場合、1戦闘あたり約10～20分前後の間、しっくりこない気持ちで苦戦することになる。各種状態異常も、アイコンは表示されるものの詳細説明がなく、具体的にどういう効果なのか、何ターン目にその効果が終わるのかなどまず初見では分からない。
　一応、F1でヘルプファイルが見られるものの、例えば「火のアイコン→燃焼」のような簡単な記述しかない。プレイヤーが知りたいのは燃焼がどういう効果なのかである。これらの不親切は、せっかくの戦闘の相性があるにも関わらず、その仕組みを活かしきれていないことにつながる。
　またキャラクターにレベルが存在するものの、レベルアップによってなんのステータスが上昇したのかもよく分からない。(恐らくHPのみであろうが、その上昇幅も表示されない)ので、強化が感じにくい。


　ワールドマップに点在する、ベヘモスのノリで進行するクエストやサブイベントなどは見ていて楽しいし、探索する楽しみがある。多くのシミュレーションRPGでありがちな、攻撃を外す、自ユニットがボコられる、というストレスポイントも、COOPであれば笑える状況になる。敵を味方にすることで戦略性も広がっていき、進行が進むにつれ楽しくなってくる。
　アーリーアクセスでありながらクライアントの安定性は高く、COOPでもエラーが起きたことはない。シミュレーションRPGゲームを移動、戦闘ともに上手くCOOPに対応させている、ユニークで数少ないゲームなのは間違いない。
　
　UI,戦闘システムの説明不足が改善されることを期待したい。

32710846.review:
The Chernobyl disaster, also referred to as the Chernobyl accident, was a catastrophic nuclear accident. It occurred on 26 April 1986 in the No.4 light water graphite moderated reactor at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant near Pripyat, in what was then part of the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic of the Soviet Union (USSR).

During a late-night safety test which simulated a station blackout power-failure and in which safety systems were deliberately turned off, a combination of inherent reactor design flaws, together with the reactor operators arranging the core in a manner contrary to the checklist for the test, eventually resulted in uncontrolled reaction conditions that flashed water into steam generating a destructive steam explosion and a subsequent open-air graphite fire.[note 1] This fire produced considerable updrafts for about 9 days, that lofted plumes of fission products into the atmosphere, with the estimated radioactive inventory that was released during this very hot fire phase, approximately equal in magnitude to the airborne fission products released in the initial destructive explosion.[1] Practically all of this radioactive material would then go on to fall-out/precipitate onto much of the surface of the western USSR and Europe.

The Chernobyl accident dominates the energy accidents sub-category, of most disastrous nuclear power plant accident in history, both in terms of cost and casualties. It is one of only two nuclear energy accidents classified as a level 7 event (the maximum classification) on the International Nuclear Event Scale, the other being the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster in Japan in 2011. The struggle to safeguard against scenarios which were, at many times falsely, perceived as having the potential for greater catastrophe and the later decontamination efforts of the surroundings, ultimately involved over 500,000 workers and cost an estimated 18 billion rubles. During the accident, blast effects caused 2 deaths within the facility and later 29 firemen and employees died in the days-to-months afterward from acute radiation syndrome, with the potential for long-term cancers still being investigated

The remains of the No.4 reactor building were enclosed in a large sarcophagus (radiation shield) by December 1986, at a time when what was left of the reactor was entering the cold shut-down phase; the enclosure was built quickly as occupational safety for the crews of the other undamaged reactors at the power station, with No.3 continuing to produce electricity into 2000.

The accident motivated safety upgrades on all remaining Soviet-designed reactors in the RBMK (Chernobyl No.4) family, of which eleven continued to power electric grids as of 2013.

Meaning if you're invested in the game and want to support its development while it comes out, sure go ahead pay now. However, if you want to enjoy the game in its full state and not just be stuck wanting to know what happens next. Well. Wait until the game is released.

The game has catchy (copyrighted) music. And its policy on uploading to youtube is fairly easy to abide to. If you want to avoid copyright mute the music, leave the narration on, and play and upload. EzPz

Now As for the game there's tons of weapons in variation and quality. IE There's Bows, Guns (guns aren't as good or OP as you may think) Light Swords, Heavy Swords, Maces, All that good stuff. And they all have their pros and cons.

For example the Mace is a good weapon however its heavy. Meaning if you have the mace you cant wear armor.
And if you wear armor, you're weakness is a mace. (Or club) and even then there's multiple and tons of races not limited to the Electrobots, Giants, and Spidaurs. Oh and a Troll mother. You know that giant bushmonster thing from Castle Crashers.

And again, each race has its own pros and cons. Electrobots cant heal through cupcake races, only through gnomes and do massive AOE and possible stun damage if aligned correctly (they can also float) Wraiths can do debuff damage an an AP (armor piercing) attack that ignores armor. However its melee only. However the Wraith has a Weakness to Rainbows, (and possibly pixies?)

But I'm not going to guide you through everything the game is lively but incomplete. You will yes have fun, some units have funny names. Game makes me want to play it but. Well. Doesn't have much for it right now. I'd recommend waiting until release to buy it, as at release you can at least get a taste for the game before refunding (if you choose to do so) But I certainly recommend it even so, It's worth the money (especially at release whenever that happens) and is done by the Behemoth, who can do no wrong in my eyes yet. That and the artwork is by Dan Paladin so. It's all just great.

But again, I suggest waiting until release before you fully judge the game.

Also this quote from the "Why Early access" question.

Will the game be priced differently during and after Early Access?
"Yep. When the game is completed, it will cost more than it does now. ORDER TODAY!"

Also, Also. The developers listen to community feedback and bug reports so once again. It's worth the pricepoint at the moment. There's just not much to do in the game currently. There is some. Just not a lot.

32280656.review:
So, having spent over a day on this game, completing the storyline, and multiple sidequests, I figured it was time to write a review. First off, keep in mind this game is in beta, and not nearly finished (at least I hope not.) 

[b]Concept[/b]
So this game is a turn-based rpg kind of deal. The main concept is that a giant space bear smashed into your planet and shattered it into hexagons. Throughout most of the story, there is a narrator who clearly dislikes Horatio, your character.
In essence, this game is you going around and fighting things, as well as capturing enemies and adding them to your party.

[b]Story[/b]
At this point, the main storyline is fairly short, with a grand total of two missions. That being said, this is the third update, so that's definitely going to change. There are also quite a few sidequests that you can complete, and lots of random encounters of varying difficulty. Lets also not forget what gives the game it's name; The Pit. This is a gladitorial style arena where your team of characters fights against three other groups with increasing difficulty. The Pit yields many rewards, and is a good way to level up and pass time when you're not playing a mission.

[b]Battles[/b]
In the battles, each character has a specific amount of hexagon tiles they can move per turn. You chose where they move, and they chose which enemy to attack (if you moved them so they can attack multiple enemies) Each party member can be customized to have different attacks. There are also different creatures that do different things, like healing cupcakes, mind-warping octopi, poison mushrooms, and massive cyclopses.

Anyways, I'm guessing there's gonna be alot more updates to come, so we'll see what the Behemoth has in store for us next.

[Edit] I almost forgot! This game is really funny, that's cool too.

In classic Behemoth true to form. Maintains its cult following art styles and humor, with Will Stamper keeping a voice you'll love for on the fact of it keeping a serious tone but with moments (if not most of the time) a immature yet humorous tone.

The gameplay seems rather simplistic based on the weapons and its counters. But that simplicity still allows you to create all sorts of arrangements. So get experimental at times and see what you can create. however, the game can have serious and very strategic moments at times depending what you have as a co-op partner or what you're facing. 

Get a friend and have some fun as you basically send all of your units to finally kill that one archer hiding in the back that finally cornered themselves after you killed everyone else.

All n' all this would be a good gateway to turn based games if you've never played one before and willing to try it out.

32152526.review:
Another favorite made by Behemoth. In its current state (Early Access update 3), it stands strong on an excellent foundation for what can be a masterpiece once finished. I'll list some pros and cons below for its current state.

PROS:

Artwork.
Voice acting.
Funny.
Turn-based made fun.
World exploration.
Co-op, both local and online!
Daily leader board with rewards (replay value).
World seems to have 'pick up or ignore' side quests.
Capturing new recruits to join your team is currently my favorite part.
The weapon and shield choices are great, and hilarious! Spatula for a sword, large piece of bacon for a shield, lol!

CONS:

Main storyline is limited to only one, really awesome btw, quest once the tutorial missions have been completed.
Sound track is VERY limited at this point, and music can get repetitive.
There needs to be about 20 more monster types added for capturing and battle variety.

CONCLUSION
Great game that's worth a buy already. Made by a team you can trust to see the project through to the end and finish with a great product. Highly recommended, worth it for the laughs alone.

31913543.review:
It's fun, and has that awesome 'The Behemoth' vibe. The art direction is perfect, the music is outstanding (just the best).

The turn-based gameplay is a blast. It makes sense after a bit, it doesn't take long.

The UI is a train-wreck at the moment. I'm having a hard time trying to figure out what the hell it is I need to do to... just DO things sometimes. It makes it very frustrating. I feel like this should be as effortless to understand as other Behemoth games, but sometimes when I thought I could do something, I end up pressing every key, controller, or mouse button to try to find out what it was.

Also, sometimes you can accidentally get trapped between conflicts you don't want to. Repeatedly. There is no "flee" command, or if there is, it's a real bitch to find. Your only option is to be trapped between fights until you kill off your party. Yes, there is a "stun" cannon on your wagon, fairly early on, but it's not great, and there is so much pomp involved with restarting after you accidentally got trapped between a couple of overpowered enemies. Yes, I know, you should avoid those situations, but when you do get into one, I'd rather not have to reload the game (I keep on fighting them to the bitter end, despite my knowing they will stomp me). In some ways, this is worse that random encounters. In games with random encounters, I usually can run away.

Overall, though, it's great so far. The basic, underlying game is amazing.  But, please, "The Behemoth," do a bit to help us understand how it works.

TL: DR- If you like turn-based gaming AND humor AND funky addictive music you can't go wrong!


 Anyone that has used the coveted Rivscore (TM) system for buying games will be perhaps shocked at the score I gave this game. I'm only 5 hours in but the time played ( as I have said to naysayers in the past ) is really irrelevant; the whole point of gaming for me is [i] does the game capture you from the start!??[/i]

Pit People is from developer Behemoth and I have not played any of thier other games; more's the pity it seems. Perhaps PP is their Opus?? Pit People, from the opening quirky scene, hooked me like no game has in perhaps 20+ years.

 - Quirky graphics that can run on a potato: check

 - Humor that is LOL'able: check

 - A combat system that is easy to learn / hard to master: check

 -Music ( now bear in mind i'm an 80's Metalhead) that is foot-swinging good-check

And......the game is still in early access. Amazing game that I can see myself playing at least 40+ hours.


 Rivscore- 100 / 100

31737764.review:
Another classic Behemoth game. Like the others, Pit People is an amazing co-op game and can also be played singleplayer. Will Stamper from Battleblock Theater returns as the narrator in this game again. The game is full of Behemoth humor, along with delivering a nice challenge. The strategy behind the game is what makes it so interesting. You don't choose who your units attack, so if a unit is in range of multiple enemies it'll select which one to attack randomly. Some units are more effective, and weaker against others. This makes the positioning of your units are important and is what makes the game fun. There's a ton of different customization options for different types of helmets and weapons as well. 

All in all, a great game. 10/10 - hard to pass up for $15.

Development team's commitment and enthusiasm is genuine. Just the other day I fired up Battle Block Theater around mid-morning expecting the lobby to be dead; however I hit a match almost immediately which included a developer (possibly The Behemoth himself) whom was awesome to play with and gifted (traded?) 30 balls of yarn along with nearly 1,000 Gems.

31694365.review:
Full of Behemoth humor, style and charm, this game is promising.... That being said:
The combat is very lackluster. You order your units around a hexgrid... and thats it...You cannot activate abilities or even choose a target to attack. The menu's for selecting party members and equiptment is archaic and a pain to navigate, unit information is not much more than a description of appearance. The units themselves are interesting, well designed, animated and varried: brutes to jukebox riding 'mascots', to cupcake people that heal others by flinging their own frosting around on spoon cataults. The two story missions in the game (as of writing) show great potential.

The games biggest issue for me is that the combat is far too simplistic. Strategies mostly involve sending frontline fighters to the front and keeping backline fighters to the back. Some changes that could make this system more enjoyable are: 
1. Ability to choose attacks (basic/speacial).
2. Be able to target units individually.

I highly recommend against buying this game in early access. The content is not plentiful or varried enough to warrant a purchase at the current time.

This game has...

- Enjoyable Music

- Very nice graphics
- Funny Jokes

What this game doesn't have (and why I'm downvoting this)

- a Completed story (seriously it takes like 1-2 hours to complete what little story this game has so far. Which is fine because it's early access but it's still to short)
- A active community, which is the main reason why I'm downvoting because once you complete the story and capture at least 3 of every creature in the game. You find out there is nothing left to do but fight in the pit. BUT THEN you realize no one is ever online or worse yet, there is no one online that wants to fight in the pit. There is a setting that allows you to fight people from other countries instead of just people in the same country as you, but still after 15 minutes of waiting still no one will join. The only time you're gonna find someone is if you either A.) Play with a friend. or B.) play on the weekend afternoon because that's the only time you're gonna find at least one other player to play against. 

Maybe once the game comes out of early access (which who knows how long that will take) more people will buy the game. Even then though it took only about a couple months after this game came into early access for the community to die so who is to say it won't happen again once it gets out of early access.

Honestly I actually do love this game but once you do mostly everything you can do in single player the game is pretty much done because no one wants to PvP in the pit.

31448877.review:
Should you buy this game right now? If you like strategy, good music, a genuinely funny narrative and don't mind keeping yourself entertained with online battles and side quests for now - yes.

I have played every single one of Behemoth's games and this one is my favourite.
It has the character, humour and art style you'd expect, along with added replayibility and deceptively simple strategic gameplay that's unlike any other they've made.

Just note however, that the story mode, which can be played co-op, is not yet complete (in case you didn't read the game summary) and I finished what currently exists of it in around 4-5 hours. There's a plethora of side quests though and when they eventually run dry for you there's always the fantastic PvP and 2v2 PvP to sink your teeth into and that alone (like other reviews have already stated) is worth the price tag. It has the potential to develop a meta-game where strategies are consistently developed and improved upon with age. 

If you need another reason to support the Early Access: 
Behemoth are actively working with, and listening to any community feedback they receive.

There you have it. 
See you in the pit.

31215117.review:
tactics rpg with some really interesting twists i haven't seen in the genre before and a pretty strong basis in collectable monsters. i sunk a pretty notable portion of my playtime so far just running around the open world and capturing opponents for their gear or to build new teams, and the gameplay surrounding the constant goal of collecting a lot of dudes is excellent. 

pit people puts the sorts of elements into the tactics rpg genre that you would expect from the behemoth (battles are super chaotic and shit explodes constantly, you can't directly influence every single thing your units do to the same degree that you can in other games, etc) and it works shockingly well. i didn't really feel the gameplay (worth noting that this has only been in early access for like 3 months as of this review) growing stagnant, largely because the tone and pace are preeetty casual and laid back most of the time, and battles are visually entertaining enough that things consistently feel interesting and new.

the only current downside is the actual story is super dang short, but again, early access, and i believe the next update is focused on story improvements so no big deal there. there's also enough side content to keep you entertained for at least a dozen or two hours, w/ sidequests being available both at your hub and scattered across the world, and the whole appeal of the "gotta catch em all" kinda gameplay. the humor can be a bit hit or miss if you aren't into poop jokes, i guess, so that's worth noting. also, i haven't tried the coop or multiplayer in general yet, so i can't weigh in on that.

pit people's a promising as hell title though, i rarely play an early access game and immediately feel like i got my money's worth. i'm really excited to see this thing completed.

Edit: I think i have played this quite a while now to write a fair review, while the game is very good considering how much of it we get to play, it becomes quite dull once you have completed all the missions and it becomes a game where you just farm until you get that cosmetic thing you wanted or capture that rare enemy on some mission, dont get me wrong, i like that but i wish that there was more to it, like ultra hard missions with unique equipment loot, the pit is also very easy to grind and that golden gear well i wish it was more of a challenge to get, the pvm pit side can be farmed really easy and the pvp side its empty 23hours a day, its almost impossible to get a match, i wish they would nerf the pvm rewards (pit points, money and loot) and add a little buff to the pvp maybe just like the pvm, win 3 in a row get a bigger reward or anything else i dont know just something that attracts more people to pvp rather than the endless farm.

Now my main issue with the game is combat, whiles theres many combinations and character you can choose from, combat gets quite repetitive and boring later on, i feel like theres not enough creatures to actually make combat diverse, also the little interactivity just makes it boring after playing it several hours i really hope a lot more creatures get added in the future as well as something that makes combat more interactive, maybe somekind of unique special ability depending of whos your team leader, this game need work but it isnt bad at all, i would have gladly payed twice the amount for it on its current state.

31045530.review:
С чего бы начать....
Ну например с того что это новая игра от создателей Castle Crashers и BB Theater ( последняя у меня есть и она тоже не разачаровала )
А теперь об игре:
Начало самое непредсказуемое, а именно, на Землю падает огромный медведь, тем самым вызвав страшные последствия, и один из главных героев Горацио вступает в схватку с бандитами на своей ферме. ВНИМАНИЕ СПОЙЛЕР!!!!! В результате битвы он теряет своего сына и отправляется МСТИТЬ. В конце концов он находит друзей и тп. Дальше рассказывать не буду т.к. уже сильные сюжетные спойлеры пойдут)))
Ну давайте что-ли оценки поставим:
1. Графика - как всегда Бегемот радует своей мультяшной графикой и оптимизацией ( игра на ультрах пойдет на любом ПК )
2. Боевка - в сравнении с BBT здесь есть время на размышление и продумывание стратегии боя. Но о боевке еще поговорим...
3. Саундтрек - он просто великолепен! Музыку нашел в ресурсе Вконтакте и слушаю постоянно)))
4. Диалоги - самые лучшие диалоги из всех стратегий. Герои постоянно подшучивают друг над другом и это пророй ну ТАК смешно, что я соскальзывал со стула))) ( Правда )
5. Юмор - опять возвращаясь к 4-му пункту сдесь все очень смешно и персонажи подобранны наилучшим оброзом для того, чтобы смешить)))
6. Сюжет - не могу не похвалить здешний сюжет. Заваруха такая что некоторые фильмы уступают Pit People.
7. Открытый мир - тут говорить много не буду. Тут есть открытый мир и можно воевать с любыми врагами.
Ну теперь и минусы:
1. Боевка - тут есть и минусы. Самый большой на мой взгляд это когда герой подходит к двум врагам, а у него в руках меч ( тут меч бьет сильнее тех, кто без шлемов ) а перед тобой чувак в шлеме и без него. Угадайте кого он будет бить?
Это будет часто вас бесить...
2. Сюжет - его КАТОСТРАФИЧЕСКИ МАЛО. За каких-то 98 минут я прошел сюжет. Я понимаю "Early access" и все такое, но разработчики могли бы хотя бы на 3-4 часа сделать вступительный сюжет...
3. А стоп.... Вроде все)))
Итого:
Игра на своей стадии выглядит хорошо хоть и мало сюжета.... Именно за него я и снижу оценку. А если смотреть на игру вцелом то она получилась лучше чем я себе представлял))))
9,99998 стрел/10 
Играйте красиво)

首先可以说，这是一款创意十足的战棋类游戏。
作为小鸡The Behemoth的新作，它延续了之前的搞怪风格，在战棋对战的核心玩法之外，加入了类似口袋妖怪的抓捕系统。
如果你对这三种类型的游戏感兴趣，我推荐入手这款游戏。
你喜欢这个角色吗？开车出去抓啊！！！
你喜欢这个装备吗？开车出去抓啊！！！
你喜欢这个服装吗？开车出去抓啊！！！
只要你能遇得到它，只要它能留到最后，只要你的抓捕人员活着，你就能得到你想要的。[spoiler]真的怀疑拿着网的自带嘲讽，明明怂在后排，还一直被人追着打。[/spoiler]
再提一下这个游戏现阶段的不足。由于是EA阶段，剧情内容确实有点少，角色不够多，地图还有未开发部分，汉化不全（个人不在意这点，实际影响也不大）。
这游戏说玩不腻是不可能的，毕竟还处在EA，玩法内容比较单一，虽然深坑的排名每天都有奖励，但应该还不足以让人沉迷吧。这游戏应该属于那种刚入手会让人爱不释手、休闲的时候上线玩两把的游戏。

最后，早买早享受，晚买享折扣，闲钱买支持，手紧等节日。[spoiler]推荐打折入，参考前两作。[/spoiler]

30825931.review:
OMG where do I start?  Okay first of all if you are a fan of turn based strategy and must play all of them stop reading this and buy the game now.  If you are new to the genre but are interested in tactical games I can truly recommend this for you.  If you are seasoned turn based strategy fan this is also for you.  For starters I want to say that the combat is very well streamlined.  In most TBS games you move your character, choose a direction and then choose a type of attack.  If you are a healer you choose your character,  move him into position, choose your spell and finally heal who you want to heal.  In Pit Poeple this ihs simplified.  The healer character will simply heal whoever it can within it's range while dealing damage to itself.  This may seem oversimplified but it tends to work and speed up the healing process. 

Combat is also streamlined and faced paced.  You simple move your character into postion and he will choose to attack whomever he wants.  It sounds dumb but it works well in the game.  There area good amount of weapons, armor and charactrer classes to keep you guys.

In terms of audio the music is just simply fantastic,  You can tell they had alot of fun coming up with great lively muslc that will tickle your funny bone.  Sounds effects and the narration is through the roof.  I did find some of the jokes totally lame but In the spirit of the game it was perfect.

To sum it up,  I'm an avid TBS gamer and this was a complete and total surprise!

+Excellent animation and graphics
+Psuedo open world gameplay
+Excellent memorable soundtrack and voice acting
+Simplified TBS controls that are streamlined and keeps it fast paced

-Main quest super short
-still in early access

Once this game is complete I can recommend it to anyone who has ever liked a TBS tacitcal game. Kudos to behemoth

It's a living hell. Unless you've been preparing for hours beforehand, prepare to fight to the last man in a fury of blood, rage, and Horatio's Blueberries. Nobody holds back, and if the shotgun butterflies don't kill you, the mortar unicorns will.

Final rating: 9/10, very difficult if you're a beginner. Co-op is very fun.

30685351.review:
[h1]Behemoth Games, una empresa desarrollada en 2003, creadora de títulos INDIE icónicos como Battleblock Theater o Castle Crashers, se embarca en su proyecto mas ambicioso hasta la fecha. Pit people![/h1]

Pit People es  un juego que actualmente se encuentra en Early Acces, y que, según sus desarrolladores podría seguir unos cuantos meses más hasta estar terminado. Un juego que ha día de hoy ofrece una escasa campaña principal, de  unas 2-3 misiones, que pueden llevarte 5 horas como mucho. Sin embargo el objetivo de Behemoth es el de construir un juego que te de infinitas horas, no solo con una campaña mucho mas amplia si no con contenido secundario practicamente infinito. Y es precisamente eso, lo que hace a este juego tan especial, tiene una cantidad de contenido increible, incluso a día de hoy en early acces puedes jugar muchísimas misiones secundarias y otros modos de juego que ahora vamos a comentar. 

Pero primero veremos que es Pit people, que tipo de juego y en que genero se le puede colocar. Pit people es un juego de estrategia rolera por turnos, juegos que últimamente están bastante de moda en la estrategía. Un juego que se basa en el movimiento por hexágonos que conforman un mapa distinto en cada combate, su sistema de lucha es bastante peculiar, tenemos unas mecánicas basícas de movimiento y acción que consisten en, colocar una unidad en la casilla adyacente a un enemigo y entrar en combate con él de forma automática, con la novedad de que nuestros personajes toman sus propias decisiones, si tienes que atacar a 2 enemigos cercanos, será el personaje el que decida a cual de ellos ataca, igual que si una unidad tiene que elegir entre 2 aliados a los que curar, será ella quien lo elija, aunque por supuesto puedes forzarlo tu, dandole solo una opción a tu unidad.
  
Un sistema de roles para nuestras unidades, unidades mas pesadas, otras unidades para capturar enemigos y unirlos a nuestro bando, otras para curar, algunas de rango etc.. ¿Y cómo le das a una unidad su rol?; pues con el equipamiento. Todas las unidades tienen una base pasiva, unas habilidades que no puedes cambiar por que son únicas de cada unidad, pero amén de eso puedes modificar una unidad y convertirla, en una unidad de ataque pesado, o de defensa etc... 
Y hay entra en juego otro apartado importante, que es el equipamiento y el rol en general. Nuestras unidades tendrán unas estadísticas base que serviran de orientación para saber como rinde nuestro personaje. Podremos tener un máximo de 6 unidades que podremos cambiar en cualquier momento en nuestra base para organizar cientos de estrategias y equipos posibles. El equipamiento le dará a la unidad personalidad, puedes equiparle un escudo pesado, ligero, medio etc... Con eso harás que la unidad tenga mas resistencia ante disparos a distancia, pero según el tipo de arma que eligas también afectará a su movimiento en la batalla, el juego te da una cantidad considerable de opciones para que vaya jugando a tu gusto. 

Pit People transcurre en un basto mapa por el que te vas moviendo con una caravana, un mapa lleno de sitios para explorar, misiones que hacer y enfrentamientos que te lo harán pasar realmente mal, pues la dificultad del juego es bastante amplia, además tanto el límite de inventario como el hecho de que si pierdes todas las unidades perderás todos los objetos que hayas obtenido en tu viaje, le dan al juego un toque survival muy interesante. Aunque solo tendrás que volver a la ciudad de vez en cuando para reponerte, a no ser, que pruebes el modo de dificultad mas alto, en el cual si pierdes un soldado, será para siempre!!. Por supuesto es un juego en el que, cuanto mas secundarias hagas mejor equipado irás y mas fácil será enfrentarte e los enemigos. 

Por otro lado a parte de todo lo que ofrece el juego por sí, su campaña, la exploración, las secundarias etc.. También tendrás otros modos de juegos con los que pasar el rato como la Arena. Un lugar donde puedes enfrentarte tanto PVP como PVE a oleadas de enemigos, un reto bastante grande y ademas competitivo, pues tendrás que mejorar tus puntuaciones para ascender en las listas clasificatorias. 

Pit People es un juego muy divertido, pero si algo puedes sacar a relucir es, sin duda, el sello Behemoth. Su diseño tanto artístico, su banda sonora, su estética gamberra, todo es MUY descabellado y muy loco. Es un juego en el que no puedes parar de reirte, por que tiene un humor adulto y bizarro a mas no poder que enamora. Sus personajes y su argumento son increibles, te hará pasar unas tardes cojonudas te lo aseguro. 

[b][u]En definitiva tenemos un juego terriblemente divertido, con el que te reiras, sudaras tinta, siempre tendrás cosas que hacer y que solo podría ponerle de pega el que no esté terminado aún!! Un juego que no podéis perderos, un juego altamente recomendado![/u]

30681368.review:
This is a review from playing a fair amount in Early Acces. Note that my experience is from update 2/3 era so if you are reading this at a later time it might not be matching what the game currently is.

The Feel:
This is a perfect game for people that like silly things. There is weird humor and references going on all over the place. The one story mission and the few side missions that are available for play at the moment are really fun. There is also enough going on the world map to keep you busy.

Gameplay:
As this is a sort of tactical positioning game mixed with random elements, it does pretty much what it says on the box. You set up your team of silly fighters, you place them where you want them to go and chaos happens. This is not a bad thing. Even when I am defeated I can sigh with a smile. Just the sheer amount of weaponised silly items (giant banana, crazy hats, throwing a gun at someone called "self defense") just makes me laugh every time i see a new item. At the time of writing there are about a 1000 items to collect in the game to customize your fighters with, and every time I run into a new pack of fighters with new hats/weapons I get excited. The fact that you can only take the last standing opponent with you makes it so you have to choose which of the shiny new things you want NOW :).

Regarding the price:
Worth every penny. You buy it once, and then you have hours worth of gameplay, especially when you consider there is a great amount of "gotta catch 'em all" involved.

Regarding replayability:
In update 3 they added some daily tasks to do co-op with a buddy. Also you get an "Emperor's order" to give you some extra items the moment you complete a specific task. As these orders are infinite its a fine extra reward for stuff you'd be doing anyway. I think the biggest thing going for this game is definitely the collection of custom appearances and items that you can acquire. 

Any cons?:
Like I said, it's still under developtment. I didn't notice anything that would interrupt the gameplay experience in terms of bugs or so. 
That being said I'd like to see less daily tournament points awarded for people using the auto battler (that's right, you can even play your own fights as a spectator, while the computer dukes it out). At the moment I believe the ratio in the unfair challenge is that  you get half points if auto battler was used during a fight. Since I use auto-battler a couple of times during the day for a few fights and still finished high up, I think the rate should be lower so that people that actually fight their own battles can feel more achievement. But then again I think this will be less of an issue when the player pool increases.

Final thoughts?
A great game for its price, especially when you are a completionist. As there is plenty of auto-save going on, it can also be played in short spans for when you only have a little time to relax. Everyone should have a 15 min. pit people break at work!

30649781.review:
Castle Crashers und Battleblock Theater vom Entwickler Behemoth waren schon wahnsinnig amüsante, charmante Koop Spiele.
Bei ihrem dritten, für den PC erhältlichen, Spiel nehmen sich die Entwickler abermals ein anderes Genre vor.

Vom Beat 'em Up zum Puzzle Platformer hin zur Hex-Feld Rundenstrategie, im gleichbleibenden Artstyle und mit der sympathischen Präsentation inklusive Nonsens-Sprache ;-)
Pit People erinnert an ein virtuelles Tabletop-Spiel bei dem man seine Figuren über die Hex-Felder möglichst taktisch an den Gegner heranführen muss.

Baust du dir einen Tank? Darf es ein sehr leichter Nahkämpfer mit hoher Dodgewahrscheinlichkeit sein?
Ein schwerer Fernkämpfer mit Sovietkanone?
Oder darf es ein dümmlich dreinblickendes Einhorn sein, Möglichkeiten gibt es viele.

Die Zahl an verschiedenen Gegnern ist enorm hoch. Vom Standardmensch über spinnenbeinige Frauenmonster und Trolle bis hin zu Angry Birds ähnlichen Vögeln, Robotern, riesenhafte Berserker-Nahkämpfer, Geister, Zombies, Einhörner, Kobolde und und und.
Das schöne an der Sache ist nämlich, dass der letzte verbleibende Gegner auf dem Feld mit Netz und Käfig gefangen werden kann, die Sammelwut macht mitunter süchtig.
Die Storymission ist im aktuellen Build noch lange nicht fertig, es gibt also bisher nur Nebenquests die sich auf Eskorten und Lieferungen inklusive Kampf beschränken.

Zusätzlich zu den kleineren Missionen gibt es natürlich noch die namensgebende Pit, eine Arena in der man 3 Gegnerrunden überstehen muss um fette Beute abzusahnen.
Wem das auch noch nicht reicht, sei der Onlinemodus ans Herz gelegt, internationales Kräftemessen ist angesagt!

In Sachen Items, Buffs, Mali etc ist das Spiel noch ausbaufähig, verschiedene Items sind häufig nur von kosmetischer Natur interessant, ob man nun mit einem Riesenlolli oder einem vergoldeten Streitkolben kämpft, ist aktuell fast egal aber ich denke die Behemoth-Leute nehmen sich dieser Sachen noch an, ihre Schmiede ist für Qualität bekannt! ;-)

Alle Fans der vorherigen Titel aus gleichem Hause können bedenkenlos zuschlagen. Ein tolles kleines Abenteuer, besonders im lokalen Koop.

30577092.review:
For an early access game I'm loving it so far.

The commentary from the announcer and the conversations between the pit people actually had me laughing, not just a huff of air though my nose but actually laughing.

The gameplay is simple yet fun, but I do think the characters can be a little buffed up when you get them around high levels. I have a team that are all around level 60 but they are still doing the same damage and taking the same damage from enemies I fought at level 1. Aside from the free health from leveling up there needs to be a little bif more of a reward there.

The map is nice and open, with the idea of constanly changing the area you're in makes it feel some what fresh each time. The enemy placement is nice and diverse and there are enemies where you'd expect them to be, like robots in the techno zones and monsters in the gloomy areas. A few things could be explained the how the turbo effects the enemies and also shooting the sparkly ground gives you plenty of coins. I have yet to figure out what pushing all the buttons around the world map does but I'm working on that.

The sound track so far is catchy, that's the best way to describe it. A few more tunes would be nice if those songs were given to specific battles. Like say you're fighting mainly humans you'd play X song, then if you go over to the undead area there would be a chance to play a uniqe undead song out of the main soundtrack for the rest of the world. But that's a personal idea.

Another thing I would like to see is a little more interaction with the speaker, like a in combat modifier so if you're doing well he suddenly feels like you should die, special units the narator summons spawns on the enemy's team, like wise if you're losing. Just something more than just a voice to spice things up.

Over all I really enjoy this game for what it is, and considering I can play this with a friend makes it that much better.

30482372.review:
A very entertaining game with a wide variety of units and items to play around with in an amusing setting.

The fact that you get to pick where your pieces go, but not what they do does make some scenarios a little more of a hassle than necessary - such as those where you have to destroy an item but the character in question is adjacent to one or more enemies and decides to attack them instead of the scenario-advancing widget.

There are also a few scenarios where additional enemies are rapidly  and repeatedly added to an already ugly situation that are a bit obnoxious, but perhaps those are intended for teams of very high level characters or co-op groups. I've only hit about three that give me that impression - and early access is probably a good enviroment for a company to work out how players manage the scenarious they have in mind.

But those are relatively quibbly issues. Aside from the story missions, there are a great many other missions scattered around the landscape - and it's easy enough to try out team ideas on wandering monsters in the countryside. Early access games can be a bit of a risk, but Pit People seems like a very entertaining game even in its early access state.

30478798.review:
I had little interest in a strategy game that didn't allow you to control WHAT your character does and to WHO. However, it's the streamlined movement and flow of this game that really started to make sense when you begin to macro-manage rather then expect to Micro-manage.

In XCOM you gamble on each unit's interaction with the enemy, with this game it's 100% all the time, but the gamble is confined to player positioning. The depth in this game is less conventional and prone to be overlooked based on it's hands off approach to it's combat, but it allows players to use their decision making skills in other interesting and meaningful ways rather than being bogged down by busy work.

Anyone can access this game, even players who are not fans of strategy games can hypethetically start doing well almost immediately... as the rules required to learn this game aren't clouded with trivialities and unecessary factors or UI elements. The better you are at making decisions, the better you'll stand playing this game.

30397342.review:
Well, I think it's time to give this game a solid review. 

Oh yeah, there's already 2.5 thousand of those. So I guess I've been beaten to the punch? 
Think again.

This game is one that is so absurd and bonkers, you probably won't know what's happening half the time, but amidst the screams of pixies popping like small balloons filled with blood, and the nuclear farts of the mushroom men, you'll probably find yourself enjoying this game. 

It's got a cutesy story, a HILARIOUS narrarator, lovable characters, and the most bizarre sense of toilet humor (Metaphorically AND literally, see "Tinkletown" for more)

It's basically fun for everyone, if you like strategy games, you'll like this game. If you like crude-as-heck humor, you'll like this game.

If you like watching a gigantic musclebound cyclops named "Fresh Meme" whack mushroom-men with a massive, probably still unstable warhead, while pixies use their jazz hands to blow up your healers who happen to be cupcake people, 

Well, 

You'll like this game.

9/10

30385338.review:
Imagine playing a game of chess where you could make up the rules for your pieces.

What makes the game interesting though, is that your enemy makes up their rules as well...

Now imagine having an oddly deep bond with each and every one of your pieces that aren't so much pieces on a board anymore... but actual characters. Chosen, equipped, clothed, and trained by you since the day you found them wandering in the wilderness with their original pack of heathens. 

Finally, imagine watching all of your beautiful pieces you love and treasure so dearly getting murdered one of one thousand ways, one at a time, right before your very eyes.

Now realize you cannot even begin to comrprehend what i'm talking about, unless you have played this game.

One of a kind gem, just like the other games that the Behemoth backs, and I will probably play this game casually for the rest of my life.

Great gameplay, a great experience, original content, and it's updated with new items and quests almost every month?

Worth every single penny.

30349174.review:
Just a little disclaimer, I was a beta tester for this game.

Sure, the game is in its Early Access state, and sure its $14.99, but Pit People proves itself worthy to be deemed a " full game. " 

Pros: 
+ Amazing optimization and port
+ Amazing controls
+ Charming gameplay, artstyle, characters, and dialogue
+ Behemoth's usual goofiness
+ Battleblock Theatre reference hidden in the sound options
+ Good price tag
+ Innovative
+ Satisfying and rewarding open world
+ Doesnt take long to install
+ Early Access game that feels like a full game
+ Battleblock Theatre and Castle Crashers owners get bonus items
+ It was made clear that Behemoth, just like every other game they make, spent so much time and effort making this game
+ Sadistic, dark-humored narrator
+ Actually requires a decent amount of skill

Now, since I love Behemoth-made games so much, I hate doing this, but...

Cons:
- Lack of Optimization settings

Overall, there is nothing I can actually diss about this game. It's only an Early Access title, but feels like a full, completed game nevertheless. I wish more Early Access games, no, games in general were like this! Well done like always, Behemoth! I will continue to support you guys by buying your games! :D

- 10000000000000000000/10 - " OOPS, BUTTERFINGERS! " >:D

30316810.review:
Did you ever feel, like your life was incomplete? Did you regret, not being able to shoot your enemies with a bow made from roses, while wearing a bow tie and a top hat?

In this case, Pit People might be your saviour. This colourful and humorous turn-based strategy-game is not only easily accessible for rookies, but offers an enjoyable experience for everyone with a taste for absurd humour. While it does offer you a Co-op-mode, it is equally as fun to play just by yourself. Quests and fights do not take a lot of time, allowing for a player to drop in or out, even if he has merely a few minutes time. That said, the customization-feature would let you spend hours, equipping your recruits with ridiculous outfits and weapons, if you so desire. Quests and storylines are filled with pop-cultural references and the soundtrack is certainly unique.
A minor point of criticism is the lack of information concerning status/wapon effects. For example, you can tell by purple bubbles surrounding them, that a character has been poisoned. However, it does not tell you, how long they are afflicted by it and how much damage they will suffer from it, in an easy way. This kind of information should be presented to the player in an unmistakable way. 

The game itself is nonetheless absolutely worthy of your attention and I can give a hearty recommendation to buy it, without the shadow of a doubt.
