30248241.review:
Pit People is an adventure/turn-based strategy combo with an emphasis on humorous storyline, excellent cartoon artwork and the epic voice of Will Stamper.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

You have a home village on a world map - it occasionally gets moved around by a giant purple six-legged teddy bear, but that's another story. You prepare your team of 6 fighters (selected from a growing pool of available fighters) with weapons and armour, then venture out in search of enemies to battle. You can either just go out and battle random enemies (they are all over the place) or else follow the quests. When you defeat an enemy, instead of wiping out all the fighters, you can capture the last one with a cage and recruit him into your squad. After a victorious battle you have to make it back to the village where all your loot is redeemed. If you're intercepted by another enemy on the journey back you risk having to battle them and lose your loot from the first encounter, but if you pay attention you can avoid this by using the cannons on the wagon to stun the enemies and slip past them, or use nitro to mow them down!

The battles are turn-based, played out on a hex board. The way I've played there's not really much thinking involved and it's quite fast-paced. You move each fighter into position one by one then hit the spacebar to proceed, and they each make their own decisions about which enemies to hit. As they inflict damage and defeat enemy fighters they gain XP, making them stronger for future battles. The different weapons/armour you give them also make a difference to the team dynamics, if you want to get down to the nitty gritty. My 4 melee, 1 ranged and one healer has served me well so far.

Inside the village you can buy new equipment in the market with the gold you've made on your excursions and play around with squad customisation, replacing members and switching equipment around. You can fight the AI in the Pit (within the home village) to gain some quick XP and gold, although I haven't had much success in there, I think I need to improve my team strength a bit more. You can use the big phone to dial up a PvP battle - I haven't managed to get a match yet but I haven't been too patient. This is a popular game so in general I don't anticipate any problems finding matches should I want to get involved with that later. At the moment I have more than enough to keep me busy with the singleplayer campaign.

The quests (which you can pick up in the village) advance the storyline as you defeat and rescue various characters along the way. The cutscenes are a highly anticipated treat.

Controller is supported but mouse is better.

[h1]Artwork[/h1]

When you look closely at the cartoony graphics you realise there's a great deal of detail here. Everywhere you go, the screen is packed with a seemingly endless array of funny looking enemies, absurd weapons and fabulous cutscenes. You never know what delightful thing you're going to discover next and it keeps you motivated to continue.

[h1]Sound[/h1]

The first thing I want to talk about is the theme tune. In my reviews I always comment on the quality of the music, but I'm always judging it as game-music, I would never dream of adding it to my actual music collection. Here is the first exception I've ever encountered. It's an awesome, rocking beat that belongs in the real music charts. The down side is that I have trouble starting the game. I sit at the main menu with my mouse hovering over the start icon, my neck jerking like a strutting pigeon. When I finally manage to tear myself away from that tune and log in to the game there are more great tunes to enjoy - selectable on the gramophone in the village - it's all very original, memorable and suits the game down to a tee.

Will Stamper's voice acting has reached legendary status in the game world, his narration alone is worth the price of admission. There is no other voice like it. The absurd silliness and the way he yells "shut up!" is something I could listen to all day long. There is a lot of his voice in the game, but there is also a lot of content so naturally it's rather spread out, in the cutscenes and the odd impatient comment during battles telling you to get a move on. For me it's the main highlight of the game.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]

On normal setting the singleplayer campaign and quests are fairly easy. I've won nearly all battles by just pushing my melee fighters towards the enemy and keeping my ranged and healer further away. In the home village there's an 'insane difficulty' switch that I dare not touch. I assume that you'd need to pay far more attention to the strengths and weaknesses of your team and your weapons in that mode.

The Pit is difficult even on normal setting - you have to win 2 out of 3. I can usually win the first round but my team's health stays depleted for the next battle and I always lose. Perhaps I'll have better luck later on when my team has levelled up more.

In conclusion, for me the enjoyment of the game is in the content so I'm glad that the battling is nice and easy and allows me to progress and discover it all without any hold-ups or frustration.

[h1]Performance[/h1]

The game is in Early Access but if you weren't aware of that fact you would never guess. There is still more content to come for the single player campaign, that's why it's in EA, but it already feels like a full game. Totally bug-free as far as I can tell, tons of content and it just generally feels finished and polished.

Windows only, but there is a firm promise of Mac/Linux on release.

[h1]Value[/h1]

After 10 hours of gameplay I've barely scratched the surface. My overall progress bar currently sits at 10% so that should give you an idea of the amount of content here, not to mention online PvP multiplayer battling. It's not only the amount of content that's impressive, but the general quality of every aspect of it. The price right now is a steal and you should grab it right away - there will be a price increase after final release.

[h1]Steam[/h1]

Achievements, cloud support, local/online co-op, local/online multiplayer. No trading cards but in this case it really doesn't matter. If you're going to let that influence your decision to buy then you're crazy.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

The battling gameplay isn't exactly ground breaking or unique but it's very well implemented and satisfying. Everything else about the game - storyline, humour, voice acting, music, artwork, animation is absolutely outstanding. If you don't normally go for turn-based strategy, this is still a game you will love just for the bonkers fun of it all.

The Behemoth: "We Make Games". Yes, they most certainly do.

30228498.review:
[h1]This Game Rocks![/h1]

I have never been a fan of any sort of turn based games, but this one is a true gem. My skepticism was snuffed out by the humor and large amount of working content already available. The turn based combat can be rather amusing and I've even been on the edge of my seat in some of the battles, too. 

The co-op is incredibly fun with good friends. Hours have been lost trying to build the right tag team combo with, of course, the coolest looking apparel for my troops. 

I understand if you're not a fan of turn based games, but give this one a shot. It's way better with friends and the mindless exploring isn't [i]too[/i] bad. 

My one and only con for this game is the story block. At the moment, the story is a work in progress and seems to be releasing in increments. That's not entirely bad, but I'd really love to dig into it all at once and see where Horatio ends up.

Other than that, this game is great and would recommend to anyone!

30192319.review:
[EARLY ACCESS REVIEW, 12 HOURS IN, SUBJECT TO CHANGE]

After doing some research, I finally decided to buy Pit People while it was in Early Access. To be clear the game is cheaper now than it will be at full launch price according to the Early Access description. I must say, I seriously think it's worth considering. This is easily the most fun I've had with an Early Access title ever and it has enough staying power to the point where I think one could get their money's worth in its current state if they are interested in its concepts.

Pit People is an easy to play/learn strategy RPG, with complicated customisable units and simple execution. You control up to six units (although some units allow you to break this rule) in a match by simply moving them in the general vicinity of their target. Potential targets/enemies on the map are highlighted and your selected unit automatically chooses how, depending on the distance between itself and its target, and who to attack. You can play the entire game smoothly on a controller and the AI is pretty decent, ensuring both allies and enemies offer some unique and interesting tactics. Your units can only heal outside of battle via campfires or the central hub, by levelling up during battle, or by a healing unit which sacrifices some of its own life, like a selfless and sweet prince. Battles are paced in such a way where you can finish a match easily in under half an hour (in some cases much less than that even) or marathon a chain of battles for several hours. The rewards for victory get extremely funky and allow you to try out new strategies or run different parties the next time you battle. They can range from equipment, to swords, to bows, to funny hats and hairstyles, to records, to memes, and... JUST GOOD STUFF WORTH HAVING AROUND OKAY?!

You are capable of capturing additional units, which can live peacefully outside of battle in the barracks. The satisfaction of meeting the capturing requirement, leave the wanted unit the last thing standing and utilize a capture unit with a cage, is a fun twist on the regular battle and can leave some interesting results during and after each encounter. Wanting to capture a stronger unit means you have to keep them alive on the battlefield, a threat to your team, same goes for a unit that may walk straight into your sword to protect a friend. This DOES include story driven bosses, which is quite satisfying alongside their COOL NAMES and COOL EQUIPMENT. Oh, and I guess the fact that you have the strength of someone relevant to the story, or something...

Speaking of story, what's there is pretty good! Admittedly the main story seems to be restrained prior to the full release, but it's still worth playing it through! There are many sidequests, scattered amongst the easy to traverse and diverse overworld as well as inside the castle hub thingamajig with a variety of objectives and peculiar battle scenarios. As someone who has played most, if not all of Behemoth's games, this is by far the funniest and my favorite in terms of story. You also get loyalty loot you might actually like for owning their past games! Stamper is in FULL FORCE as a narrator* and the dialogue between characters and the names of wondrous locales, is charming and delightful! Also pretty messed up sometimes! It doesn't overstay its welcome and is amiable in itself!

The game features some appealing multiplayer modes as well! You can compete with others on a leaderboard for daily special loot dependant on your ranking in THE PIT (filled with people), it's something which I've been extremely enjoying quite A BIT (not with people). Unfortunately I have been unable to test out the PVP and local/online co-op modes with others at the time of this review. That said THE PIT RULES (vs. AI) and the game is still fun, even running solo. Pit People is compatible with two players for the every mode, local and online, same goes for the four player battle mode. I do dream of the day I can try these modes. Hopefully I will...

Pit People as far as I can tell, is a game definitely worth playing, even in Early Access. With a lot of interesting and varied characters, a bundle of laughs, low pc spec requirements, multiple multiplayer modes, a new easy to learn/difficult to master spin on the SRPG genre, flexible play sessions, player driven initiative, policeman cupcakes called copcakes and MORE, I can, at this time, wholeheartedly recommend this game. It's by far my favorite Behemoth game. I do hope you consider playing it at some point. It's pretty good. There's a lot of stuff to do in it. It's a good time. Either way, Love & Respect!

TL;DR - Good Early Access, easy to play SRPG game with new ideas and intriguing charm. A great entry point for the genre as well. If you think you're interested now, yeah, buying it is a good idea. It's supposedly cheaper for the time being too. Also CUTE CUPCAKES WITH POLICE HATS CALLED COPCAKES, 10/10!!! TEN OUT OF FLIPPING TEN!!!!!

30148131.review:
Нетерплячим одразу висновок: чудова гра для поцінювачів покрокових боїв, дотепного гумору і насправді цікавого супротивника у вигляді штучного інтелекту самої гри.

Тепер уявіть собі що на ваш світ впав космічних розмірів ведмідь. Так, це нове слово у жанрі апокаліпсису. Наслідки теж незвичайні, але не буду розкривати всі карти. Вам доведеться зібрати собі компанію з дивніх істот (наприклад напівциклоп, або капкейк з промовистим іменем Глютен) і виконувати дивні прохання і доручення мешканців цього світу. Одним словом - після пафосних, в більшості випадків, сюжетів про порятунок світу і постапокаліпсис тут можна відпочити як від порятунку світу так і від пафосу. Натомість, для компенсації, творці щедро приправили життя після ведмедопаду гумором як вищоі так і всих інших проб. Але все у рамках розумного. Одним словом, атмосфера і цілісність світу, вкупі с дивною внутрішньою логікою тут неперевершені.

Також я просто у захваті від бойової системи. По перше - вона відрізняється від звичайних. Вона така ж унікальна як і в The Banner Saga. Зверніть увагу - не схожа, а унікальна. Задяки цьому покрокові бої, виявляється, можуть бути в певній мірі динамічними. А ще тут дійсно сильний і кмітливий штучний інтелект. В чому ви переконаєтесь через годину гри. Коли почнете розуміти всі тонкощі битв. 

Тепер трошки навіть не мінусів, а зауважень. Гра ще в розробці, тому основний сюжет зараз представлений лише тільки зав'язкою. Але можете звернути увагу на кількість часу який я тут провів - побічних квестів і занять тут вже вистачає. Так що навіть у такому вигляді тут контенту більше ніж у деяких GOTY едішн.

І, родзинкою - просто шикарні саундтреки.

PRO: The first 10 hours are GREAT. I loved it.
Lots of fun. Unique writing, entertaining, fun to learn the mechanics. 

CONS: After the first 10 hours, things start to feel repetitive and grindy.
You are battling for rep and to unlock cosmetic changes to your characters.
Every once in awhile you might unlock something that makes your character stronger.

OBSERVATIONS: The cosmetic content unlocks, purchasing quests, and posting REP for all to see feel like necessary add-ons to keep people returning to the game once the original content and new discovery feeling wears off. I haven't tried out the multiplayer, but its not a draw for me. 

Although I love the game , Behemoth, and I'm happy to support them with my purchase, my 9 year old who LOVES all of the other Behemoth games doesn't even want to try the game out. I fear they missed the biggest consumer age group that drives their sales with this game. Here's hoping they are working on Castle Crashers 2 or Battle Block Theater 2 because this title might cause a huge problem for the studio if they don't come up with some way to draw in the younger players.

I don't feel drawn to play the game repeatedly like I was with Castle Crashers or Battle Block Theater. Most of the replay value of those games were the easter eggs, leveling, and my son pushing me to play with him. The fact that he doesn't want to play this game at all means it won't get much use, which bothers me because I REALLY want this studio to succeed.

30104070.review:
I bought this game based on the fact that it had an incredible 97% positive score from over 2300 reviews and Stamper voice acting. For the first hour or so I was very entertained by Stamper, but I noticed the combat felt extremely simplistic. By the last couple of hours I played it for I was half-convinced I was just not understanding the greatness that clearly must be there based on the reviews. After reading the negative reviews I think maybe I'm not crazy and the gameplay in general is very shallow.

I get that some people probably really like the collectathon aspect of the game where you capture all these different creatures, but when it comes right down to it all you're really doing is moving characters to appropriate hexes and ending your turn while hoping they crit with their one attack which you don't even get to decide who it's used on in many cases. 
Even the gear you equip your characters with has no real effect besides a few preset options like sword with shield or sword with bigger shield. The sword might be a candy cane or a golf club and the shield might be a cake or a playing card, but that has absolutely no effect other than cosmetic customization.

It seems like a lot of people are very loyal to Behemoth and I get that maybe they're also investing in the potential greatness of the game down the road, but as it stands this game is absolutely not one of the Best games on Steam in my opinion like the ratings would have you believe. I hardly ever review anything unless I think the reviews are very skewed in a way I don't agree with and this is one of those cases. I do not at all believe this game is worth $15 in its current state, but I understand why some people might buy it in good faith that it will be in the future and then some. To anyone else reading this please do more research on this game rather than relying on the review system if that $15 matters to you.

Edit: Just a recommendation. I found a game called Battle Brothers that is a turn based tactics game somewhat similar to this one that I would highly recommend you save your money for over this game. The actual replay value of this other game is much higher than this one. There are far more options to customize your team beyond aesthetics and that game is highly recommended without the need for fanboys to automatically give it a positive review since it's by a studio I haven't heard of and I don't know if they even have any other games. 

I tried to play Pit People a few weeks ago to see if anything had improved, but the mind numbing repetitive nature of the gameplay instantly turned me off. I again highly recommend you do more research through gameplay videos rather than listen to reviews on Steam. This game can be summed up as kind of a silly chess with very little player agency. The style and vo is again very good, but the actual gameplay is garbage in my opinion.

30095973.review:
Pit People is a fun isometric turn-based combat-strategy game made by the lovely folks who created Battleblock Theatre and Castle Crashers. Pit People features many recruitable characters, including (but not limited to) Pixies, Spiderpeople, Unicorns, Cannibals, Zombies, Gnomes, Cupcakes, Mushrooms, Robots, and a pesky moustachioed man named Horatio.

In Pit People, William Andrew Stamper is the incredibly charismatic and not-at-all-psychotic Narrator, just as he was in Battleblock Theatre.

[h1] Now, onto the gameplay itself. [/h1]

While it is early access, the combat is still quite sound, and I've yet to encounter any bugs. One of the only issues that I've encountered is the fact that the main storyline is incredibly short (which is understandable, given the fact that the game is still in Early Access). Despite this, there are still dozens of side-quests to occupy your time, as well as multi-player combat in The Pit.

Just like Battleblock Theatre and Castles Crashers, you can play the majority of the game with another player, in Co-Op Mode. Unlike BT and CC, you can only play multiplayer Co-Op with ONE other player (which is understandable, it would be rather difficult to balance a four-player Co-Op combat system, unless every player was restricted to 3 fighters instead of the usual 6.)


[b] I highly recommend this game for people who enjoy turn-based combat and comedy similar to Battleblock Theatre and Castle Crashers. [/b]

30047905.review:
I'm happy to add another positive review to the thousands of already existing ones. Let me explain why.

Pit People is a great game and yet another instant hit, like Castle Crashers and Battleblock Theater before it. It might seem like youtuber bait at first glance, with all the "memes" and (literaly) toilet humor, but it's got depth, it's got great customisation and it's got humor that is gonna appeal to all ages. The Behemoth team delivered again (might I mention, they are the only devs with multiple games that all have 95% on steam I know) and I'm looking forward to watching the game evolve and grow.

Now let's get started for the actual review. As you might have already noticed, the aesthetic is very similiar to the previous games. The similarities don't end there either. You will often encounter creatures from the previous games and all kind of other references. These apear mostly in a huge variety of costumes and already mentioned creatures. 

So how is Pit People different? Well, almost everything else is new. The combat system is turn based, kind of simplistic but very well implemented. Each creature has its own (mostly passive) abilities and stats, which can further be modified by items and weapons. Latter stands mostly for humans. There are four different types of elemental damage (fire, explosion, poison and ice), but there are also helmets and shields, armor, dodge and many more mechanics, that make fighting interesting (hint - stay AWAY from the farting mushrooms).

Your base of operation is a town where you pick quests, equip items, fight in a pit or simply buy new items and fighters (there is no need for that really, as you frequently get them during wandering anyway). Once you set foot on the huge map, you encounter various groups of enemies, which you can avoid or fight. You can also pick up new quests on the fly, ranging from quite a selection. I've heard there are more than 100 avaliable.

Another big thing I've yet to mention - co-op. It's not 100% required in order to have fun, but it helps to have a partner. You both plan out your turn at the same time and due to much larger number of fighters, it can really get quite chaotic (which suits the theme of the game). However a thing that has been bothering is the camera, which is quite wonky during co-op battles, expecialy on larger maps. But hey, that's why early access exists. 

The last thing I'd like to cover is the look, sound and narration. I've already stated the cartoonish look suits the game perfectly and I stand by it. Naration is done by Will Stamper, same old cynical guy you've had to put up with in Battleblock Theater. He does a fantastic job in being both annoying and funny at the same time, pestering your heroes and making smug remarks. The soundtrack is great as well and I haven't gotten bored by it even after 10 hours of play. 

Conclusion
Would I recommend Pit People? You bet your ass I would. It might not be 100% finished, expecialy the main story is lacking at the moment and I hope more creatures get introduced during development. Still, the game is well worth its price and has made me chuckle many times (expecialy some of the names). It's just as silly as it is serious and the combination simply works. BIg thumbs up from me!

Rating: It's early access you silly, I can't give a rating.

30018908.review:
[b] Pit People[/b] is another great turn-based charming strategy game on Steam. I didn't finish the main story line yet because I don't usually do that during Early Access phase or I wouldn't play the main story after its full release. But despite that, I've finished necessary main quests to enjoy the game's full aspect and some few sub-quests.

[h1]STORY[/h1]
 So having played only intro missions, so far the story is funny yet very random! So far, I have no desire to finish the main story during early access phase, I cannot say much about it at this moment. Sub-quests are also great as situations often go hilariously unexpected. So far people are saying main story is quite short so I hope main story becomes longer than it is and maybe more sub-quests!

[h1]GAMEPLAY[/h1]
 There are huge customization options in Pit People. Every units can fit into different roles depending on which weapons, shields and helmet you desire to put them on. As you explore the overworld, there are different unit types you can "recruit" by capturing them like Pokemon. Many of these units carry different avatars of item types, so capturing them becomes addictive. Although there are currently 19 types of units in this game, I wish for more types of units to capture.
Having to level them up during progression makes your units personally attached. Unlike XCOM, there is no permadeath so it's okay for them to die. Permadeath would be another good addition if there will be a sandbox mode.

 As turn-based strategy game, the positioning is extremely important. Unlike other games, you only command your units to move in specific positions while they will do anything on their own to their possible attackable enemies. But don't worry, they will do their best to win the battle.

 The overworld is huge! There are 125 POIs you can explore and features many different biomes to sink your foot in. [strike]While it's very fun to explore these places, I wish for randomized sandbox mode, which would increase higher replayability in exploring, randomized quests.[/strike]
Overworld is procedurally randomized, so hopefully there will be more than 125 POIs on full release as I am already reaching near 100%

 Co-op campaign and pvp are great options to enjoy with friends and strangers over Internet. These make perfect reason why capturing units outside of the city is more enjoyable. Seriously, Pit People needs more interesting unit types to "recruit"! There are many different things to try like Insane mode, the pit with AI vs Players and etc which increases replayability.

[h1]AESTHETICS[/h1]
Art style is very consistent across Behemoth games. Having played their older games back in Newgrounds, they still retains that funny and funky art style. Avatars for each units are usually random and hilarious, having 1357 of them are excellent! Only thing I would point out is that some vector graphics are pixelated when zoomed in, maybe this should be eradicated when leaving Early Access. Excellent sound design, love the vicious narrator, overall very good!

[h1]OVERALL[/h1]
Even though this is early access title, it's well polished, very fun, highly replayable. Pokemon aspect truly shines as well as team-building aspect of this game. The game is very well balanced and it is the wonderful game to collect in your collection!

29990029.review:
ОБЗОР НА РАННИЙ ДОСТУП! Когда будет полный релиз - будет вам полный отчет.

Итак, от создателей Уничтожителей Замков и Театра Боевых Блоков мы получаем это несказанное сокровище в виде пошаговой стратегии. Игра проста как камень, который находится на скале гордости из мультфильма "Король Лев". Почему? Да потому что она сумашественно проста и необычайно разнообразна! Кстати насчет сумасшествий, игру я получил еще на стадии закрытого бета-тестирования, чего не ожидал в принципе. Давайте же перейдем к плюсам и минусам данной плюшки.

Плюсы:
Простой геймплей и система боя
Поддержка мультиплеера, которым так славится Бегемот.
Великолепный саундтрек и озвучка (Огромное спасибо Стамперу за это)
Фирменный юмор с какахами, мортирой на повозке, городом в виде унитаза. Блекджеков и куртизанок не видел.
Разнообразие врагов, включая свой бестиарий, в который записываются все рекрутеры
Поддержка русского языка и субтитров. Конечно, пока не весь, но ведь ранний доступ

Минусы:
Карта. Их блджад 3 штуки, и все они разнообразны.
Перемещение по карте. Хоть мортира на повозке и помогает по дороге, но перезаряжается ой как долго.
Однообразие. Взял квест - убил - вернулся и скинул лут - поменял снаряжение - повторяем. Это однообразие немного подзадалбывает со временем, ибо езжать туда-обратно по карте не особо-то и хочется.

Финальная оценка - Повозка с мортирой из 10.

29959618.review:
Pit People isn't even completed yet, and it fills me with all kinds of happy!  And blueberries.  

I normally avoid Early Access and just wait for a finished product where I can plainly see if it's reliable and entertaining or not, but I have a lot of confidence in The Behemoth, and watching TotalBiscuit & Jesse Cox's co-op playthrough footage convinced me that the game is indeed in a good enough state for Early Access.  

It is absolutely my kind of humor, especially with Stamper's quality narration, but I am also adoring the game on a mechanical level.  It's simple enough to where you're not bogged down with tons of tedious information, but still challenging enough to where you need to be aware of positioning and planning (before and during battle), or a Pixie may just burn off the faces of your entire team.

Conducting battles is mentally stimulating, WINNING battles is often deeply satisfying, and the humor is the sweet, delicious frosting on the cupcake that just makes it that much better in the end!  

I can't imagine a world without The Bear....

29935168.review:
Game is awesome! The story and humor are what you would expect from a The Behemoth game (only played Battleblock, not Castle Crashers). Game play is relatively simplistic on the surface but there's a lot of potential for thought and optimisation during play and I assume especially for PvP.

I likened the game to friends as Final Fantasy Tactics mashed with Pokemon with the art and humor of Battleblock.

Worth a try even during early access as the game is very polished. If you can appreciate The Behemoth storytelling, this is for you, and if you like the idea of turn-based strategy games, this will be right up your alley as well.

Also, the music is just great and so fitting in the game. If that's something that you like in a game, then the music just adds another reason to give it a go!

29934243.review:
This game! Oh boy!
Behemoth has done it again, this time they hit what could quite possibly be one of their most engrossing ands fluid experiences. I've owned and played all of their games (excluding Alien Hominid) and have to say, this is easily tied for my favorite of their games.
Strategic, fast-paced fun, that's all there is to it. Behemoth's signature quirky style and humor gives this game an edge on other TRPG wannabes on the steam store.

A few notes for the Devs though, if they're reading!
As of Home Improvement 1, there is no skip turn button in combat. While it's nothing major, it does severely effect the flow of the game for TRPG veterans, or people who understand how the turn will play out. Since movement is fairly.. Slow, due to low movement ranges and large maps, this makes a very tedious experience during overworld encounters, and while most will be fine with it, it'd definitely be a welcome change.

29932091.review: While the story (main) as of right now is currently 2 missions, this game is still an incredibly enjoyable experience all around.  The music is great, the visuals are great, and it's all very fluid. If you like turn based strategy games, and love a dash of weird and wacky, you'll love this game.

29931264.review: This is one of the best turn based games I've played in a very long time.  Behemoth has brought along their typical humor (Castle Crashers and BattleBlock Theater style) and has really improved on their storytelling (albiet extremely short story currently in game).  I'm not typically a huge fan of turn based games, but this feels a lot like a board game when playing with very large risk/rewards with every move you make that make the game exciting to play for hours on end.  All hours that I have played currently have been co-op and everything seems fairly balanced and challenging as far as story missions go.  Have not attempted PVP yet.  Overall I would highly recommend this game. It's very addicting right from the start, and hard to put down each session.  Devs seem to be updating this which is nice to see, however it is still very early in it's life.  I look forward to continuing to play this game and any future updates Behemoth adds to it.  Well worth the $15 asking price, and a must buy if it ever ends up on sale.

29929765.review:
Como era de esperarse y vaya que se hizo esperar "Game 4" o el ya con nombre "Pit People" es un juego que no decepciona, mas alla del humor caracteristico de su creador "The behemoth" que hemos podido apreciar en sus previas obras pit people se destaca de ellos por su modalidad estrategica con un sistema de combate "piedra, papel y tijera" con un giro. 
 Las peleas en Pit people pueden durar entre 5 y 10 minutos dependiendo de la estrategia que escogas y a que enemigos quieran atacar tus propios personajes (Ya que deciden por si mismos si tienen la opcion!) aveces puede frustrarte pero a medida que le tomes la mano no sera un problema para nada.
 En cuanto a personalizacion el juego no se queda atras: Atrapar personajes nuevos, ganar armamento y armaduras ridiculas (y glaseados para sus pastelillos vivientes tambien), discos de musica para escuchar en la ciudad son algunas de las tareas que realizamos a medida vamos avanzando en el juego.
 En cuanto historia ,y como ya esperaran si han jugado BBT, el narrador es un regalo de dios esta vez con forma de oso mutante cosmico y asimismo el villano principal de la misma. Al ser early access la historia principal se encuentra mayormente incompleta pero lo que juegues de ella lo disfrutaras bastante! Luego de que termines con ella aun quedan varias misiones secundarias que completar que te mantendran entretenido por horas.
  Pit people cuenta tambien con un modo de pelea online en el que puedes enfrentarte contra oponentes en linea que cuenta con un scoreboard o marcador en el que vas subiendo a medida que ganas peleas con tu ejercito unico y totalmente personalizado a tu manera.
 Sin mucho mas que agregar y para mantener el review corto, recomiendo totalmente el juego incluso estando en early access. Sin duda vale el dinero que te cobran por el!

29917947.review:
什么？有人手动挂稽？我们还有[spoiler]吉祥物[/spoiler]+[spoiler]吉祥物[/spoiler]+[spoiler]吉祥物[/spoiler]+[spoiler]吉祥物[/spoiler]+[spoiler]吉祥物[/spoiler]+[spoiler]吉祥物[/spoiler]的,[spoiler]清真无比[/spoiler]的[spoiler]自爆[/spoiler]攻击

+翻译不是机翻，肯定是人工翻译
+由于随缘的加入，淡化了战术使得回合制战棋更容易上手
+继承了一贯的风格：贱（比如一个人头用了DOGE脸,还有WOW的特效）
+音乐也是十分的带劲，非常符合游戏的风格。特殊任务（比如 免费软件镇保卫战）有特殊的音乐
+猫守卫乱入（与他们公司的游戏有联动，已知的是如果你有BBT，你会收到猫守卫和hatty hattion的头）
+多样的搭配：弓箭手骑在重甲半人蜘蛛上对着后方蛋糕人暴打
————————————————————————————————————————————————————
-战斗过程中随缘成分稍微有点过，哪怕稳了的局也有被翻盘的可能
-使用的中文字体包不完整：正常游戏中部分字会以？显示
-联机游戏死活没人，不知道服务器是如何架构的
-更新后原本有汉化的地方反而被覆盖了（虽然不影响游戏）
-武器种类虽然繁多，但是区别实在是太少了
-各职业平衡性有待调整
-使用宽屏显示器无法覆盖全屏（推荐使用方屏）
-电脑托管你他喵的智商敢再低一点？5打2你居然输了？？？

总的来说这款游戏真的值得这个价格，虽然完成进度只有少得可怜的30%左右。
而且在这个战棋游戏基本看不到的年代还能做出这样的一款让人惊艳的游戏实在是少见。
[spoiler]来个人陪我2V2啊 我彩虹马贼6[/spoiler]

29903996.review:
[h1]The TL;DR Version:[/h1] 
I'm only a couple of hours into this game and I've already discovered a Unicorn that doubles as artillery and a pair of gnomes in flying toilets as well as beaten numerous people to a pulp with a giant lollipop. Nuff said.

[h1]The Actual Review[/h1]
The humor is crude in the most wonderful way and it suits the art style perfectly. Speaking of art style, it's the most adorable looking game I've seen in awhile, it's really dorky in all the right ways and it contrasts beautifully with the over the top violence that is the game. The overworld aspect is a weird mixture of the really old school Final Fantasy and Legend of Zelda games with Pokemon, a lot of people have compared this to pokemon on account of how you recruit new members for your roster.

The main villain is one of the best I've seen so far, and right on Par with Dusan from Watchdogs 2 (perhaps a controversial opinion but I really liked him as a villain) and his near constant interference in your affairs will keep you on your toes without being a pain. Not to mention his voice overs. I want to give special mention to the actor who voiced him because he is just wonderful.

The music is the other feature of this game that's absolutely stunning, it's an interesting line up of electroblends, from swing to funk and a few others in between, and if you get sick of the music in the city (which is pretty hard to do) you can always find records and unlock new songs to change it too. One of the best features is that the song will remain changed until you change it again, even if you leave the city and come back.

Pit People lures you in with it's charming villain, humorous story and adorable art style but make no mistake, it will not be an easy experience. The game is forgiving enough, as death only has consequences up until you return to the town, but the battles can quickly overwhelm you if you're not paying attention and often times you'll find yourself losing fighters without immediately realising why. This game is incredibly fun though and I don't think I could recommend it enough.

29896133.review:
Lets just start with pros. It's funny. And it's pokemon of sorts. It also is a tactical turn-based game, where you need to position your squad well, or face the consequences.
Lets get to cons. It should be a game. But as of now, this is just a humor collection (and not the finest one either, let's be honest). This "game" horribly lacks one thing, and one thing only: GAMEPLAY. If you pick a character "A" and a character "B" of the same race, the only difference it will have is their level (and i actually doubt that it even has any significance). You can wear same gear as your other character, so what's the point? And most of the gear has no difference exept the looks. You wanna crush your enemies with golden scepter? Sure. You wanna do it with a lolipop instead? Fine, it matters not. You can even pick the giant ice-cream cone and it will be still as good for crushing your enemies, as the sax or some actual mace (this is somewhat untrue, since really rarely you get the gear with additional effects, like fire resistance, poinsoned attacks and stuff. But still). My biggest porblem as of now is that on the Xth battle you get bored. You probably have same characters as you had X-1 battles before, so you just do the very same thing you did for X-1 battles before, and kill your enemies the very same way you killed them for X-1 battles before. WHY? I had 30 level ups already, can't i be somewhat stronger? Can't i have some new skills to test? The best way to describe this game would be "like heroes of might and magic, but without heroes, and all you have is your army - which is forever limited to N units per squad". But if, one day, having 2 cupcakes will mean more than x2 healing. If, one day, having hummie "A" will mean something different from having hummie "B". If, one day, Horatio will actually DIE. That day will be the day when this game becomes much better than it is now.

TBH, i cant say that this game is bad, or good. It is neutral. If you want some funnies, you will find this game better than neutral; If you want to play a game, you will find this game worse than neutral. But i will press the "not recommended" button, just for the sake of keeping balance with all those "recommended" reviews this game already has. Besides, this is Early Access. The game still has more room for improvement. So lets hope for the best, and watch events unfold.

29868929.review:
本评测献给那些想要入正或者正在观摩的玩家，亦或者是那些被工作室所吸引的玩家，还是评测党，无所谓啦。
本游戏完美承接了工作室上两部的世界观，（没错你没看错，完美承接，我都不知道怎么吐槽好）本游戏还处于未完成（废话）虽然是未完成，但是已经可以初步看出剧情的大概样子（真的？），根据系统来看可能才完成五成吧？（不甚至可能才四成）
本游戏的肝点结合了上两部作品，大量的奇葩装备（无法直视）未来大量的的皮肤（还在完成），但是很抱歉，这个版本大量武器尚未有特殊效果与差异，皮肤仍然不多（仅限其他兵种）。
同时本作的兵种收集系统算是本作的一大亮点，（而且各种奇葩兵种（恶魔，吸血鬼，仙子，僵尸，前几个也就算了给我彩虹小马几个意思？）让你的世界观爆炸）各种趣味的站位（简直坑爹（游戏本来就是坑吧）的策略）算是本作的特别亮点。
优点
------有趣疯狂的世界观
------完美承接世界观的剧情
------各路彩蛋
------熟悉搞怪的剧情（这作应该是最疯狂搞怪的一作）（这剧情也看不出啥吧！）
------趣味的策略系统
缺点
------大量只有外衣没有内容的装备
------过少量的兵种（仍在完成）
------剧情过于稀少（毕竟还在完成）
------完成度不高（废话）

剧情：4/10 尚未完成的剧情
音乐：6.5/10 音乐虽然动听，但是还是单调
游戏性：7/10 无话可说，从现在的样子来看游戏性不缺，但是要着重加强战斗方面的策略系统
画面：8.5/10 一如既往的搞怪风格画风
总体评分：6.5/10
本游戏完成度虽然不高，但是也可以享受到很好的体验，剧情的配音也是一如既往地搞怪（那段神奇配音应该是特意为之）。
爱好策略（非硬式）和卡通画风的玩家可以入手，剧情党可能要再详细考虑一下，本游戏虽然是打着策略游戏，实际上很多RPG成分，如果单纯地是情怀粉（或者死粉）可以毫不犹豫的入手了，本作的质量还是一如既往的硬。
手头不宽裕的人可以选择观摩一阵再考虑入手，未来游戏应该会不只是这个价钱了（虽然按照这个完成度不值得当前这个价格）
期待官方会推出更多有意思的系统和装备，并且把剧情完善（真女主西班牙妹子，还有男主必须死！（误），原来你们的招募就是把人（包括巨人，仙子，幽灵，僵尸）全部绑回去，这网是捆仙绳做的吧！）
这个游戏只有一个槽点，那就是这整个游戏就是个槽点！
------冒失玩家夜魇
2017.2.12

29850127.review:
[h1]"I SAID HORATIO DIES" - По праву самая эпичная фраза января.[/h1]

Итак, господа, вышла новая игра от [b]Behemoth[/b]. И опять же в новом для студии жанре. Не знаю как для вас, но для меня эта новость была лучше, чем анонс почти любого из AAA-проектов с момента выхода другой их игры в 2013, а именно Battleblock theater. Со вступлением покончено, поэтому можно переходить к самой игре:

[h1]Pit People - ролевая пошаговая стратегия.[/h1]

В игре представлено немалое количество разнообразных рас, начиная от циклопов, заканчивая кексиками. Каждые из имеют свои особенности и роли в команде. Самыми мобильными в этом плане являются люди, которых можно хоть тяжелыми воинами сделать, хоть легкими лучниками. Круг способностей остальных снижается, например, кексики могут только лечить, а маскоты - давать бафф к чему-либо. Но это вовсе не делает их бесполезными, а только придает геймплею разнообразие и большое количество комбинаций. Доступна довольно большая кастомизация персонажей, что не может не радовать. Присутствует мультиплеер

[h1]Основной геймплей[/h1]

Состоит он из 2 частей. Первая из них - изучение местности в стиле японских ролевых игр, где игрок открывает для себя новые и разнообразные участки локации, а также чудные достопримечательности, за нахождение которых дают опыт. По карте бегают противники, столкнувшись с которыми вы автоматически начинаете сражаться. Арена для боя генерируется автоматически, что является плюсом. 

[h1]Битвы[/h1]

Вторая часть основного геймплея. Баталии в Pit People сделаны просто, но хорошо. Игрок хоть и управляет до 6 своих подчиненных, но не совсем напрямую. Он лишь волен контролировать их пути перемещения, а атакуют болванчики уже сами, но при этом видно кого. Например, если перед бойцом 1 противник, то ударит он именно его. А вот если же 2, то шанс атаки нужного игроку противника падает. Здесь как раз таки и играет роль того, насколько хорошо вы подобрали состав команды и оружие к ним. Бои длятся недолго, если рассматривать их относительно жанра пошаговых стратегий, но большинство разных миссий не дадут вам соскучиться, ведь и в битвах присутствуют довольно забавные диалоги. По завершению боя выводится статистика с лучшими героями обеих сторон и кол-вом лута и денег.

[h1]Сюжет[/h1]

Он хоть и недопилен, но также крут, комичен и непредсказуем, как и во всех играх Behemoth. За 4 года они не растратили ни капли юмора. Комментатор в исполнении Уилла Стэмпера великолепен. Музыкальное сопровождение классное и довольно часто хочется послушать его отдельно. Рисовку видно по скриншотам, кому как, а мне она приятна.

Но напоследок всё-таки хотелось бы рассказать о минусах, ведь далеко не каждая игра идеальна. 
[*]Новичкам довольно долго придется разбираться в механике игры
[*]Хотелось бы внести побольше пояснений насчёт дальности оружия
[*]Эта игра хоть и хороша, но как никак ранний доступ.

[h1]Итог[/h1]

Итак, после всей написанной мной тирады, рекомедную ли я эту игру? Определенно!

29844181.review: The Behemoth's new game, Pit People is a silly, fantastic and fun game about killing other people on a chess like grid with a small, yet growing variety of units. This game has a shit ton of collectible items to keep you going if you're planning on completing the entire game and different types of quests - Being story quests, town quests and map quests - all to keep you busy throughout the game. The visuals are improving and the music & sound effects are better than ever. Overall I think this game is great in its current state although it's in Early Access. 29842840.review:
So to cut it short, I love Behemoth's titles, & bought every one for Xbox. I had my qualms about them moving into strategy with game 4 (Pit People), despite the first 3 games all being different genres to each other & all being pretty good, especially the latter 2 (Castle Crashers & Battleblock Theatre).

I ended up buying it yesterday, even with the Early Access tag & only a couple story missions currently... And boy, I love it already, this game has the funniest voice acting I've ever heard in a game, Will Stamper who did the voiceover for Battleblock Theatre smashes it out of the park this time, so, so funny.

The game plays a bit like a blend between XCOM & Pokemon with a shit ton of loot. a strategy game where you can capture the last monster in each fight & recruit them to your mismatched group of heroes. Despite the game only having a couple story missions at the minute, it's rammed with content currently, I suggest you all check it out, even if you have no intention of buying, just Youtube the first 15 minutes. I can't wait to see what happens next but I'm off to recruit some new madness!

The big difference between this and other hex based strategy games are that you don't pick actions for your characters, you simply move them & they do the rest. This adds depth that you wouldn't think of beforehand, & brings a whole heap of strategies to the table that you wouldn't think of in other hex games.

The graphics and music are what you expect from a Behemoth title, sharp & colourful, with the music being a highlight, I think this may be the best Behemoth soundtrack yet & that's saying a lot. Behemoth aren't done with adding music yet & will be releasing an OST for the soundtrack. I think this may be the first game soundtrack I ever buy, the music is that good.

- I'm not funny or creative enough to write a review that would fully give the game the appreciation it's worth, but I couln't recommend this game enough for people with a sense of humour, or even slightly enjoy strategy, loot, Pokemon, wierdness, or if you like to smile while playing.

TL;DR - Youtube the first 15-20 minutes of Pit People, funniest game I've played in 25+ years of gaming.

I'd rate this game at 8/10 for the moment, as people who don't enjoy grinding or "catching them all", may get somewhat bored without the story being there. I'm sure this will be higher when the full release comes around.

-----------------------------------

- You, joking, I love you all.

------------------------------------

If you're a fan of Behemoth games, this doesn't dissapoint in the least.

29817489.review:
Pit People is a one of those 'Easy to play, hard to master' types. It's fast to finish your turn just a few clicks, that's right, there's no special type of attacks your characters can use. It's more about type type of charcters and types of equipment that just leveling up.

This game also features pvp, very fun and easy to start playing, there was not once i felt like i was under leveled or overleveled in pvp, but like i was outplayed or someone with more knowleage than me. You get rewarded with gold and points by completing these pvp (you can also play with the AI but you have to go though extra rounds) The points are your rank, there are three stages. Bronze, Siver and Gold. The higher the better the rewards are.

Not going to give out spoliers but i'll say this game has pretty good comedy with the story, it's not fully finished but it's getting there!

The charcters you get are fun and different to use, like humans,  they can use different types of swords, clubs, bows and some throwable stuff. The Cyclops who can gaint weapons, clubs and send people flying! There is even cupcakes, wraths and other scary and funny allys (or foes)

I'll give this game a 9.0 A bit hard to get into, but theres is so many laughs and adventures to be had in this game! Have Fun!

29804721.review:
If you want a chess like strategy game that has a natural feeling of progression along with weight for losing and joy for getting that lucky hit, then this game is for you. It has a booming soundtrack, with colorful graphics and they both play along side each other very well, if the style is for you. Weapons and armor are both neat and enjoyable to collect from random enemies and quests. Quests are also fun, and out in the world map the side quests that exist are repeatable after a move for extra gold and loot.

Probably, the best part about this game, aside from the developers just being neat people from newgrounds, is the lack of pressure from doing "wrong stuff". Want to play the game, sure it's single player, don't have internet, don't worry. Want to fight a random troll momma and lose possibly, don't worry you just get sent back to town if you die with full hp so you can try again. Don't want to login to get "daily rewards" don't have to, they don't exist.

This game reminds me of a game that came out back in the N64 or PS1-2 era. You want to play the game, sure, play it, no pressure or incentives other than a good game. Want to play with your friends, sure go for it. It's a game that wants to be played, it's not a "triple A" game that wants to show you how to use a god dam store to purchase microtransactions.

A good game like this only comes around every blue moon when you have developers who want to make a game that is legit fun.

+1 Devs.

29793007.review:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding cheese cake recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients: 
1 cup digestive plain sweet biscuit crumbs
3 tablespoons sugar
3 tablespoons melted butter
40 ounces softened cream cheese
1 cup sugar
3 tablespoons flour
1 tablespoon vanilla
1 cup sour cream
4 eggs

Directions:
For The base:.
If you're using a dark pan, preheat the oven to 350. If you are using a shiny pan, 375.
Combine the crumbs, melted butter and 3 tbsp sugar well and pat onto the bottom of a 9 inch springform pan. I also like to very very lightly butter the sides of the pan so that the cheesecake will not stick later on.
Bake for 10 mins in your preheated oven and remove. Let it cool while you prepare your batter.
For the batter:.
Make sure everything is at room temperature.
Combine sugar, cheese, flour and vanilla in a big bowl and mix on medium speed till well combined. Don't forget to scrape the bowl as you're doing this.
Mix in the sour cream till its incorporated well. Then, add the eggs one by one, mixing well after each addition.
Pour the batter into the springform and let it bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes After the baking time, turn off the oven and leave the door ajar. Let the cake cool in there for about 1 1/2 hours.
Remove the cake and let it cool thoroughly. Refrigerate overnight.
Release the sides of the springform.
Eat.

游戏内部机制，世界地图够大，兵种设计也比较全面，而且人类几乎可以白搭，各种变换。
还有与传统战旗游戏不同的随机攻击机制，和捕捉机制使得游戏更好玩。

兵种虽然不少但希望增加兵种，达到风格多样化。
升级不光可以提升攻击和血量，应该也同时提升防御力（希望升级对攻击的加成更大，感觉一级0.24%还是略低），或者增加一些别的属性值。

29765917.review:
First of all: I rarely ever buy into Early access games these days, to many times have I been burnt by games that were pretty much abandonned before they were finished. Therefore I was a little hesitant to buy this one, but ultimatily decided to do so, because the Behemoth is a studio that made 2 really good games already(battleblock theater beeing one of my favourit plattformers of all time).

I went in, expecting a casual strategie game, but I got was so much more!

The humor just makes me smile, which few games manage to do these days, but there is just so much detail and intersting stuff everywhere in the world, that I just can't help but aimlessly wander around, looking forward to what kind of adventure is gonna happen next!

The gameplay itself is a simpel, but solid strategiegame, with a unique approch to local and online multiplayer.

My personal favourit though, is the "Pokemon"-aspect of the game, letting you capture pretty much anything you encounter in battle. More often then not, I find myself doing quests in very difficult ways, just so I can save the "boss" of said quest till last, so I will be able to capture it and put it in my team(I especially like having Lady Ladylegs and Yosef in the same team), after outfitting it with a shitton of cosmetics first!

You can blast through the 2 mainstoryquests that are already in quite fast, most of my playtime was seeking out sidestorys(which I love to do, because all of them are hillarious) and capturing whatever boss is at the very end, although I still haven't found all of them.

Of course, since this is an early access review, things might change drasticly at any point of the development process, but I see an insane potential, that just increases with every new capturable creature you put in this awesome world!

Unlike most tile based games you cannot choose your attacks and instead have to place your gladiators strategically to get them to do certain attacks. 29748923.review:
As a foreword this review was posted on the 6/2/17 and is with regards to the early access version of the game.

Pit people is a delightful little strategy game by The Behemoth with narration by Will Stamper. In other words if you enjoyed the zany comedy of Battleblock Theatre, Castle Crashers or Alien Hominid then you will probably enjoy the style of humour found here. Whether it is the main 'story', multipart quests or the shorter sidequests the dialogue is constistently funny without getting too repetitive.

The gameplay is a simplistic turn based combat system that takes place over a hexagonal grid. You assemble a team via collecting new units by defeating enemy armies and then customising them with various collectible items, mostly cosmetics but with some offering varied stats or attack styles. While the player's control over their units is limited (you pick where they move but not who they attack) your ability to customise the contents of your team adds a lot of depth to what you can do. Fans of games such as X-Com or Fire Emblem will likely enjoy what the game has to offer but it is also accessible enough for players new to the genre.

Multiplayer operates smoothly with no real connection problems and offers both local and online co-op and versus. While some units may currently be considered suboptimal and others might be considered above average there is no feeling of there being a single perfect team composition in multiplayer, versus matches often featuring relatively varied teams.

At present the main concern to be had with the game is that it is incomplete. Considering the low price I'd say even in it's unfinished state you will likely get your monies worth, especially as it seems bug free (in my experience at least) but if you are only planning to play the single player content you might want to wait for the full release. At present the storyline  consists of the tutorial content and a single mission, with numerous subquests and 4 quest chains also available. Hopefully the full release will expand upon this considerably, ideally with additional unit types being added as well.

29742316.review:
There's a giant bear form space that crashes into the planet, where a farmer with a dead kid and a princess with daddy issues go after a band of gladiators on a shuttle, meet a hardcore Demi-clops, a cupcake (named Gluten), who heals you (with its' own frosting), and a strange Spanish lady with a fetish for netting people, help a guy poop in a town shaped like a giant toilet where pooping is banned, take part in the revolutionary war against the damned R3D C04T robots, save a burning town from the dreaded Fire Men so that it can keep on burning, find an orphaned baby leopard and return it to Dave, the Leopard Master, who doesn't like leopards, and generally enjoy a wondrous romp around a weird world full of nonsensical creatures and characters.

Made by The Behemoth. Yes, THE Behemoth, not just a Behemoth... THE!!! Behemoth, capital E! 
From the same guys that brought you the co-op, cat-ertainment and spectacle-puzzle platformer BattleBlock Theatre and ridiculous side-scrolling adventures of CastleCrashers, comes Pit People, a "baby's first tactical game" with enough character and humour to finally fill that empty void inside!
But what do I mean by "baby's first tactical game"? Well, Pit People is a tactical arena fighter wherein you have several pawns with different abilities, strengths and weaknesses, which you move around on a hex grid in a turn-based fashion. Think XCOM.
But unlike XCOM you don't really have absolute control over your pawns. You can't really tell them what to do, only move them around (hopefully) "strategically". 
This makes the game somewhat more straightforward and easier than your average, XCOM-like turn-based tactical game. It does however present some difficulties XCOM veterans won't be used to.
For one, since you can't tell your pawns what ability to use or which target to attack, you're pretty much left to the mercy of whatever Nuffle-worshiping algorithm decides that. More on that later however.

In general, the game is pretty easy to grasp, the RPG aspects are limited to mainly just customisation options. While there is a ton of crazy loot, there's no plethora of uniquely different items with different stats- a tall shield is a tall shield, whether a garden fence or a giant beetle. However, within each item category there's the odd "special item" that sacrifices some of the normal stats of that category for a particular bonus. Want a shield with some fire resistance? Well, that comes with less blocking power, though not enough to make too much of a difference.
Different character types (Cupcake, Cyclops, Demi-Clops, Human, Pixie etc.) have different proficiencies and characteristics, making them more or less potent with different items and loadouts and in different roles.
There's no skill tree or talents (currently, as of Update 1, though that may also be planned), so every level your pawns gain is just a straightforward increase to all their stats, though not a major one. So there's no need to worry whether a 3% crit chance is better than a 1.5% increase to rate of fire. A level 10 character will always be objectively better than a level 9 one from the same type. 
In fact, the game (again, currently, Update 1 did make some stats clearer) makes very little effort to let you know what the exact stats of your pawns are. There's a bunch of nicely stylised bars - LBS (how much equipment a pawn can carry, since, as you can imagine, a tall shield is heavier than a buckler, which affects their movement and agility), DMG (how much total, maximum damage a pawn does, based on pawn type and equipment), RNG (range, for ranged pawns or ranged abilities like cage-throwing, each level on the bar represents a hex), DEF (defence against melee attacks, usually determined by helmets), BLK (ability to block arrows and other projectiles, usually determined by shields) and DODG (dodge chance, the lighter the equipment a pawn carries, the higher their dodge chance, based on pawn type), that give you some information on how powerful a pawn in a particular loadout is, though, save from the damage value, it's not particularly clear.
There's also a range of icons for the different abilities and resistances pawns can inherit based on their type and equipment, though those provide little identification for what they actually stand for (since Update 1, the percentage chance of a particular ability to take effect is displayed below the relative icon, though that doesn't help much). Unfortunately, there's really no indication of a pawn's weaknesses, except maybe a vague footnote in your Recruitment Book (written and kept by the aforementioned Spanish lady).
This may be a deal breaker for min-maxing nuts who care only for the most optimal approach to things, but in the spirit of this game, it's a well implemented system that takes little effort to get used to and navigate. Also, if you're one of those nuts, get out of here! This is a casual game, go back to your XCOMs! 
It also works well with the games' combat mechanics, or really lack thereof. Combat is determined on a rock-paper-scissors basis. A helmet blocks a sword but a mallet trumps a helmet. The UI is quite clear in this regard - if your pawn has an advantage against an enemy, there's a Facebookish "thumbs up" over that target, if it's weak or less effective, it's a "thumbs down".
Attacks and order of operations is somewhat weird however. As I said above, the action and target a pawn picks is pretty much random. To a point. You can, and in fact have to, in order to make the most of every encounter, position your pawns in such ways so as to "guide" their algorithm.
For instance, if there's two or more targets your pawn can reach, it will most likely spread its' attacks between all of them (or several of them, depending on how many attacks the pawn can make). If it has an advantage against one of them, it may favour that target with more attacks, or it may not. Moving your pawn to a hex where it makes contact with only one target makes it attack only that target however, giving it all its' got.
Ranged combat is somewhat trickier however. Pawns with ranged weapons will always attack all enemies within their range for as many attacks they can make. They also attack in melee however and in fact prefer melee if they're "threatened" (have an adjacent enemy). They also usually have a "dead zone", a range of hexes below which they won't be able to fire at range.
All of this makes combat both straightforward and engaging. Yes, all you're doing is moving chess pieces around, but much like actual chess pieces, your pawns have certain rules they follow when attacking/performing actions and you need to think about their order of operations and placement. Movement time is something you also need to consider as pawns that don't move/finish their movement first will attack/do their action while those still moving are still... moving, making for some unexpected results of potential targets getting flung out of reach of that perfect surround you had planned, just because that Hair Troll attacked first. And you can't simply overwhelm your enemies with numbers and brute power. Sure, larger pawns are more powerful, but they also usually take up an extra space on your team, so there's also that to consider. It is in fact you who would most often be outnumbered, since you'll often be engaging groups with more enemies than your team (even in co-op, the game adjusts accordingly).
There's also no permanent death in this game, unlike other games of the kind, like XCOM, Darkest Dungeon etc. When a pawn dies in combat, it remains unavailable in your team until you return to town, after which it's as good as new! (scars and PTSD notwithstanding) 

As for the world and story... Oh boy, are you in for one wicked whirl!

游戏中画面色彩鲜艳丰富，不时还有扯淡的旁白，就像呓语（剧情之后我们就会知道是谁在旁白了XD）。其中的BGM特别欢快耐听，是那种能单曲循环一晚上的音乐！
主线任务只有一段，毕竟是earlyacess，但是地图上还分部着五花八门的支线任务，并且提供各式的奖励。
游戏中还有上千种物品可供收集。玩家还能与基友2人组队[spoiler]嬉戏[/spoiler]玩耍。一起参加PVP、PVE都不成问题。

29734972.review:
[spoiler]话说你们仙子个个都是三星note7吗，除了这游戏仙子攻击方式为爆炸以外，还有另一个游戏的仙子不打还好，打中就爆炸……[/spoiler]

感谢我的好友送的Pit People，让我知道了：原来 可以制作好的动作游戏的厂商也可以制作好的策略类游戏，原来2017.1.13是世界末日……

[h1]在战斗中带领自己的人物取得荣耀吧~[/h1]
这款是个比较正宗的战旗游戏，就是你需要指挥你的人物在一个大面板上如何打到敌人获得胜利。不过你还得注意一下：这游戏，你只能指挥你的人物移动，攻击要他们自己来。
虽然看上去比其他战旗类简单了，但实际上还是有点难：攻击要人物自己来的话可能会让你抓狂，因为你移动人物到对敌方来说重要的人或者丝血的敌人想要打他，奈何旁边还有敌人在那人的攻击范围内，他可能会去打另一个人而不是“指定目标”，为了不要出现这样的情况，我们尽量只让人物能攻击到“指定目标”；同时，不是纯近战人物还会有友军伤害，范围攻击的人物更要注意这点，有的范围攻击人物攻击力极高，打歪了还好，打中友军就惨了，比如说……
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=857634063
[b]真的是“坑人”啊[/b]

[h1]装备可是决定你的队伍如何打倒敌人的~[/h1]
在战斗外，你可以在城镇里换各种人物的各种装备，这里只说人类的装备：武器的话，有属性攻击的就比无属性攻击的要低一些，其他无属性的装备就只有造型的区别，锤子可以对重甲人物很有效；帽子越重给的防御力越高；副手武器的盾牌可以抵挡远程武器的攻击，越重抵挡机会越高，小盾虽然不能抵挡远程武器但比较轻并且可以给些闪避；副手武器的投掷品可以让人物可近战可远程，网可以束缚敌人（让他无法移动一回合）并且允许此角色捕获敌人；远程武器的迫击炮可以攻击距离很远的敌人，但不能攻击靠近的敌人，并且近战能力极弱；负重越低伤害越高，负重超额了就会对人物有各种负面影响。
其他种族的装备除了帽子就只有造型区别，DIY各种造型的人物也是可以的。[b]（DIY？要有铃铛头盔！对吧！要有敲钟锤！对吧！）[/b]
同时，你也可以对自己的队伍进行编辑，就是换人，各个种族的人物都有自己的攻击方式，就看你怎么用了。

[h1]在这里挑战一下自己吧？[/h1]
在城镇里还有深坑（天梯）竞技场，你可以根据自己的能力选择是pve还是pvp，pvp比pve的分数高2倍但要面对的是真实玩家（自己很方不敢打），pve是电脑操控的就好点，轻松打就可以了，而且获得的金币比世界地图多（目标是击破疯狂难度pve！）。每天15:00（东8区）还会根据本日全球分数排名来发深坑特有的装备，可以对其他人装13。

[h1]逛逛世界地图可以收获很多的~[/h1]
在离开城镇去往世界地图前，你可以去买地图用品（回复篝火 牢笼 复活药水 氮气加速），一个地图用品要占马车一个格子；在商店里还可以接受主线任务和支线任务（大支线）。
在世界地图里有很多游走在地图上的敌人，碰到他们会触发战斗，打败他们会获得奖励存放在马车上，等接近城镇时会统一放到你家里去，当然你也可以发射流弹把他们炸晕；在世界地图上也有地图任务（小支线or日常），虽然多但只能同时有两个任务，而且任务可能会带你去一些未探索的地方。
世界地图同样是招募人员的好地方，所有种族的人员都在世界地图上有一只两只的，每个种族至少捉一只回去吧~

[h1]开黑吗？我想和你一起打深坑~[/h1]
这游戏同时还可以和其他人联机：在城镇的电话亭里可以加入其他人的房间，也可以自己建一个（私人房间只能和steam好友联机）。
和好友联机，在世界地图上，一个人负重开车，一个人负责发射流弹；在战斗中好友的队伍也会加入到战斗中去，增加了策略性，降低了难度，我之前和送我这游戏的好友一起玩过几次，他玩的挺好的，我的队伍只能眼看着他打倒敌人。
和好友一起打pve深坑的金币比单人打要多出2倍，找个和你队伍能力差不多或比你厉害的好友来刷深坑可以快速拿到19,999金币。和好友玩不仅欢乐多，而且奖励也比单人游戏多。

偏向休闲的游戏，肝其他游戏累了可以在这里歇一会（没错就是你，COTN……）

29734164.review:
Once again a hit by The Behemoth. They make games. And right now it's 3/3 (4/4 if you include Alien Hominid, who hasn't played that on a school computer?).

I fell in love with the music of Castle Crashers, and I can tell you, this music will not disappoint. Neither will the dialogue or the voice over. And even with the, currently, rather short story, in this early access period it has so much potential. With the side quests there might even be an unlimited potential. The gameplay is simple, but immensely versatile. Controlling your characters is one click per character. You tell them where to go, and they do what they do. If you program a key on your mouse to be the space-key (or if there is a mouse-function in-game that I haven't discovered just yet) you can play this solely with the mouse, or keyboard, or controller, whatever you prefer.

The game already has an amazing amount of cusomization. I am constantly checking which swords/mallets/shields/helmets/special items to give to which characters. And then we have the amount of different characters. When I tell a friend about which recruit I got this time, or just recently about how I captured a Gorgon and how she is now my Hero, just because of her abilities, he asked me what a Gorgon was. He didn't encounter one just yet. We are still early game, but the range of different characters to capture is already well on its way to become huge.

I understand that this is still Early Access. Some might be thinking "What if this is all that there is to it?" Don't. This develepor is known for quality products. I can't tell you how much fun I've had in Castle Crashers. Just on my own, laughing at some moment during some quest, just because of the dialogue or visual representations. This game already has the comedy down. In the first 30 minutes of the "tutorial" there were definitely 3 good jokes.

Overall, this game has already proven its worth. Smooth gameplay, smooth dialogue, smooth transitions. You start the game, the game explains you how to play, while you are playing. Then it wishes you good luck, and you are off while some being who doesn't like order narrates your story.

Well worth the 15 euros.

Can't say I know how things are going internally though, and you've got lots of stuff to play with besides. Some map to explore, side-quests to do, units and items to find, and both co-op and competitive multiplayer, as they are wont to do. 29726079.review:
8 космических медведей из 10

Pit People - это очередной шедев от Behemoth. В игре присутствует шикарное музыкальное сопровождение, море смешных и "тонких" шуток. Особенно радует обилие игровых персонажей. Хоть основной сюжет мал, но второстепенные мисии не дадут заскучать. 
Из  плюсов хочется отметить:
1)Разнообразие рас, что позволяет создавать разнообразные комбинации.
2)Отличные саундтреки
3)Юмор
4)Рандомизация карты
Из минусов:
1)Очень неудобный выбор команды. Слишком долко щёлкать от команды A до комады H.
2)За некоторых персонажей очень не понятно играть. Я так и не разобрался в механике единорога. Хочется, чтоб в дневнике объяснялись механики на анимациях, как у кексика.
3)Больше пояснений и подсказок для игроков. К примеру, не понятны выколотые шестигранники в статистике лучников и т.д.
4)Некоторые пометки в опасностях мисий не соответствуют их настоящей опасности. Попадались лёгкие мисии в 5 баллов, которые тянут на 3-4 и мисии в 4 которые были действительно сложные, посложнее 5ти бальных.

Хотелось бы  в релизе или в последующих обновлениях видеть побольше рас. Перевод в некоторых местах корявенький, но всё же не плохой. Радует то что не перевели имена монстров, так как они тоже бывают шуточные и при переводе на русский они будут звучать корявенько.
Советую всем эту игру даже в раннем доступе, потому что обилие миссий отнимет не мало времени, так что в игре есть чем заняться.

29724244.review:
Behemoth又回来啦，每次玩《战斗方块剧场》都会为它萌蠢的画风和充满吐槽的旁白而不能自已，这次的[i]Pit People[/i]继承了前者的这一优点。由于处于EA阶段，无论是剧情还是角色设定都还比较基础（剧情甚至还没有完成），但不妨碍其玩法的优秀——在传统回合制战棋游戏的基础上，增加了抓怪收集的元素，由于各角色都是自动选择目标进行攻击/治疗，且角色每回合移动的距离不同，角色在不同位置、不同阵型受到的伤害不同，不同职业之间存在相互克制，因此放位尤其重要；又由于角色的装备会影响攻击/防御数值，装备重量又会影响移动距离，因此装备配置也非常重要。无论是任务、剧情、巡逻世界还有两种模式的“深坑”（也就是天梯，分为两个玩家对抗的PVP和对抗三波电脑的PVE），都旨在丰富游戏内容。总而言之，这是Behemoth的诚意之作，希望能尽快完成并早日脱离EA。还有，OST什么时候出呢？

+ 在原有战棋游戏的基础上增加了多种元素，丰富其玩法
+ Behemoth一贯萌萌哒的画风和旁白
+ EA阶段就有简中界面和字幕

- EA，剧情内容还未制作完全
- 可能是脑子太笨，每次人物堆在一起的时候，安排下一步的走位会让人感到混乱

Score: 8/10

29698574.review:
Folks this game, in it's current state, does not deserve the mindless praise. I'd say its not worth the money quite yet.

The combat is shallow because you only command movement each turn.

The loot is shallow because items within the same category (skinny sword, medium sword, fat sword) are all the same stats.

There aren't a large variety of enemies or possible pokemon allies (19?) which comprises everything you will see or fight in the game).

One could argue the gear is what brings variety to enemies and allies but as I've said, the gear is largely cosmetic.

Theres lovely art and lovely humor. Maps are (edit: feel) procedurally generated and change (edit: relocate you) every few outings. But the game is simply too shallow to warrant the money right now. Hopefully they have more units in the pipeline, and are going to change the stats of items.

Right now: 5/10

29664023.review:
Fun and challenging, without being punishing. A lighthearted glee is evident in every aspect of this turn based, hex-map strategy and collection game. Music is some of the best, and the Narrator is great. 

Unfortunately there seems to be very little of said Narrator. With his the only voice of the game, other than gibberish played over text, Pit People can rely too heavily on its otherwise excellent sound design. I found that with no actual dialogue to draw me in I just skipped past more and more of the admittedly  clever and funny story as soon as I read it. 

Plays well with a good strategic options base. Tons of mostly cosmetic items to collect. Wide and shallow with equipped items dictating character class for humans while creatures you recruit can only use their default skills. Since you can't predict the type of fight you'll face this specialization limits their utility and use.

Too much fun with co-op, can't wait for more.

29636328.review:
Pit people is a really great game. The teams are varied and very customizable, and the strategy is easy to pick up/surprisingly complicated.

The main strategy (since targeting is random) relies on 

1. Picking off their weak characters
2. Keeping your low hp characters in the center of formations where it is hard to target them.
The placement of ones units becomes increasingly complex when regarding for robots, mushrooms, and mortars, which promote certain spacing and clumping restrictions accordingly.

If you enjoy strategy games, and are very into PVP I can recommend this. However, because the PVE gets droll very fast, You should probably  have a friend to play with before you buy if you don't like PVP.

29636246.review: This is an amazing game it is really fun and the writing for the characters are so good this is such a funny game I could not recommend this game enough.

29636049.review:
Pit people is a hilarious, turn based strategy game. It WILL have you laughing the whole damn time. What the game offers so far is a few hours of highly enjoyable gameplay co-op or solo. 

I would recommend getting a friend to play with though. As far as the "main" story goes I completed it in less than 2 hours and that was with some messing around and exploring. There are tons of side quests though and the Pit where you can do 2v2's or face the AI. You will gain daily rewards for winning in the Pit. 

The best part about Pit People is that it is genuinely funny and has the biggest dick of a narrator that I have ever had the pleasure of listening to. The narrator is a giant bear that tries to ruin your characters lives in the funniest, worst kind of ways. Every third or so time you return to your city, the bear will pick it up and move it somewhere else. Which isn't all bad because it keeps things fresh, but the nerve of some people, am I right? Just know that he will be intervening and "helping" you out in any way he can.
 
PROS
Actual Humour
"Easy To Learn Hard To Master Combat"
Great Teambuilder
Co-op
Tons of Loot and Cosmetics to Collect
Great SoundTrack

CONS
Sort of Annoying Inventory Selection (I only used a mouse)
Took Me Around 2ish Hours to Complete the Main Story Quests (EARLY ACCESS)
RNG (not terrible xD)


Overall Pit People definitely isn't a finished product hence the EARLY ACCESS, but there are still hours of fun to be had and plenty of laughs to well....laugh. If you are wanting a great game and are willing to wait a little while for more content then I would suggest picking it up. If you are into solo gamplay and want a story driven experience, I would probably wait until a few more patches or the full release some time this year.

剧情延续上一款作品BBT，最后帽子射出的激光射了宇宙熊一脸，到了的宇宙熊就到了这里，就开始了故事这里的故事.

这里给出8分是因为无厘头的一贯风格，出了正式版的话剧情应该很棒的，因为游戏剧情没有太多，不做评论.

因为是测试版，一个剧情和3个主线过完就没了，剩下的时间就能抓宠物和打深坑，不过有几个小伙伴的话打2V2话还是很有趣的.

The Behemoth的游戏BGM哪个不魔性，妈的玩个游戏又抖腿又晃头，家里人以为我吸了毒.
新闻：（某大学生抖腿导致骨折........）

[h1] 操作7/10	[/h1]
操作很快可以上手，游戏中的人物只受你控制移动，攻击可是不受控制哦，如果旁边有两个敌人，会随机攻击的.
玩久了会厌烦操作，不过可以打开ESC中的自动战斗哦.
抓NPC的话还是比较麻烦的，需要带上那个什么女王，然后要把抓的NPC留到最后一个，就不能开自动了，要不然失手打死就比较恶心了.
[h1] 装备武器5/10	[/h1]
这里我单独挑出来说，游戏物品繁多，但是很多就是换了个样子，只有一些带着属性的武器比较特殊（不如说火属性，冰属性，毒属性）但是这些武器的负重和攻击会减少一些，希望正式版多优化一下武器方面。




[h1] 综合7/10	[/h1]

Pit People (beta)...я в альфу не играл :c

плюсы:
1 - ламповая атмосфера игр Behemoth (все игры выглядят приятно,и не поливают кислотой ваши глаза)
2 - Сюжет (хороший сюжет, связан с прошлой игрой Behemoth - Battleblock Theater)
3 - В игре куча предметов, героев, отсылок, шуток....КРОВИ, ОРГАНОВ, КОМБО, ИСПАНИИ, ЖОПОБОЛИ - ХАХА...ой..извините.

29596399.review:
So, what does this game have going for it?

Behemoth's sense of humor. Anyone who has played any of their games will recognize and appreciate it immediately.

The turn-based combat system is well done.

The level of unit and squad customization is quite impressive, even though not every unit has the same level of customization.

Cooperative and competitive play is solid. I've yet to have any issue either joining, hosting or finding games.


But are there any concerns?

While the combat system is well done, the player has very basic options available to them. 
It seemingly comes down to three things; 
1) Place unit next to one enemy and attack, 
2) Place unit next to 2+ enemies and attack with AoE or rng single target, or
3) Keep unit x tiles away from hostile units and rng range attack single target.

You, the player, have no further imput into the units actions, so apart from testing out team comps and looking for synergetic pairings, the game practically plays itself. There's even an autopilot mode that you can enable in combat to allow the computer to play on your behalf.

I would like to stress, however, that the "autonomous" nature of the game doesn't necessarily make the game less fun.

If you are looking for a game in which you have really indepth control over every action that your units take (ex. X-COM) then this game probably shouldn't be at the top of your list. Should you still consider it though, of course.

If, however, you are looking for a fun, quirky, simple, co-op, turn-based tile adventure/strategy game, then you can't really go wrong with this title.
