29576629.review:
Бодрая гексагональная тактическая арена с надоедливыми путешествиями и фирменным юмором. Сеттинг описывать нет смысла, он непередаваем, как и все предыдущие творения Behemoth. Сюжет пока завезли только в виде завязки и сонма дополнительных квестов. Музыка прекрасна.

Игровой процесс состоит из двух частей - тактической и стратегической. Происходит всё следующим образом: берём в домашнем замке квест, выезжаем на карту, шарашим по ней до пункта назначения по стрелочке, бьёмся, возвращаемся домой скидывать лут, повторяем. Ездить по местным прериям интересно первые минут 15, пока рассматриваешь замысловатый ландшафт и врубаешься в суть дела. Потом путешествия начинают тяготить - окружающая живность норовит перейти с тобой в более тесные отношения и задержать на 5-10 минут в бою. Конечно, первое время займёт местная система рекрутинга - можно захватить последнего оставшегося на тактической карте врага. 

Но дальше случайные столкновения будут только бесить. И приданная нашему фургону оглушающая пушка не помогает, потому что, ведя мышкой по стрелочке, легко можно уснуть. По пути нам, конечно, могут попасться побочные квесты. И их относительно много. Но больше двух за раз (включая тот, с которым выехал из города) выполнять нельзя. Да и повозка наша может увезти только 10 предметов. А за один квест могут дать до 5 штук. И кроме того, каждый раз возвращаясь в город, мы кидаем кубик на перемещение. Суть в том, что существует 3 разные карты этого мира. На них всё одинаковое, только расположено по-разному. И с каждым заездом домой есть шанс, что наш замок вместе с нами перенесёт в случайное место случайно выбранной из 2х остальных карты. И снова открывать туман войны... Это не очень располагает к "эксплорейшену", знаете ли. Но довольно о минусах. Кроме неудачной попытки покосплеить jRPG, в Pit People есть и то, за что её стоит купить.

Это тактические сражения. Они сделаны просто, но настолько хорошо, насколько это умеет делать Behemoth. У нас есть 6 мест под героев, 18 разных существ и бесклассовая ролевая система, основанная на шмоте. 8 боевых параметров, 4 типа надеваемых предметов, 4 класса для каждого типа и несколько эффектов статуса. Например. мы оставляем нашего героя без брони ради дальности движения, даём огромный щит для отражения стрел и огненную булаву для урона по бронированным целям. Получаем мобильного "оффтанка", защищающего наш отряд от стрел с любой стороны. Или даём тому же персонажу тяжёлую броню и пару гранат - выходит неплохой танк-камикадзе. Учитывая, что каждый вид существ ещё и имеет собственные способности (например, феи наносят массовый огненный урон, а паукентавры возят на своей спине лучников или бафферов), вариантов команд вырисовывается масса. И, конечно, не обошлось без фирменной кастомизации - разных на вид, но одинаковых по параметрам предметов в игре натурально сотни. 

Всё это богатство прекрасно себя чувствует на местных гексагональных аренах. Управление упрощено до предела: мышью ходим, пробелом завершаем ход, противников наши подопечные лупасят сами, выбирая случайным образом из доступных. ИИ умеет обходить с фланга и охотиться за тощими лучниками вместо подставляемого танка. Хороший, в общем. Работают все техники контроля пространства, обычно применяемые в восьмигранных войнах. Сами бои радуют разнообразием - от простого "убейвсех" до осад и защит цитаделей с участием специальных мортир. Сражения насыщенные - в 5-10 минут укладывается целый калейдоскоп разных боевых ситуаций и соответствующих эмоций. Каждая битва, даже бесполезная со случайно "пойманным" на карте отрядом, воспринимается цельной и неплохо вознаграждается. Правда, на арене в городе можно заработать куда больше. И, к слову, если перемещение по карте таки навевает скуку, из города можно вообще не выходить - арена утолит жажду сражений. В том числе, онлайновых.

И, конечно же, всё это сдобрено кооперативом. Я не фанат, но огромное сообщество, собранное вокруг игр этих разработчиков, говорит о том, что уж в коопе-то они разбираются.

Подытожу. Для раннего доступа - прекрасно. Технических проблем я лично не испытывал. Плюсы: разнообразие игрового процесса при простоте управления, онлайн-составляющая, музыка, озвучка Уилла Стампера. Вопросы вызывает только перемещение по глобальной карте. Ну, и юмор у авторов на любителя. Рекомендую к покупке. Можно даже сейчас, если нет настроя именно на сюжет. Часов 3-5 веселья гарантировано точно.

29566383.review:
[h1]Einblick und Video für Pit People[/h1]

Hallo und Willkommen.
Ich habe mich mal 10 Stunden mit Pit People auseinandergesetzt und muss sagen! WOW!
Ein kleines fast-paced, turn-based, co-op adventure was mit ganz viel liebe gemacht wird.
Gemacht wird? Ja es ist noch in der Early Access Phase, aber jetzt schon wirklich schön.
In Pit People geht es darum eine Welt und seine Lebewesen zu entdecken.
Während man so durchs Land streift, lernt man immer neue Freunde kennen und rekrutiert immer mehr Figuren für das eigene Team.
In einer kleinen Hauptstadt hat man die Möglichkeit sein Team dann aufzustellen und auszurüsten.
Es gibt wahrscheinlich später Hunderte Waffen, Schilde, Kostüme und andere Gimmicks. 
In der Stadt kann man auch in einer kleinen Arena gegen NPC`s oder andere Spieler antreten.
Am Ausgang bekommt man dann immer neue Missionen und Zubehör für die so gefährliche Welt da draußen.
Pit People hat ein ganz wundervollen Humor, der selbst in Deutsch, wirklich gut rüber gebracht wurde. Wichtig zu wissen ist aber, das der Humor finster, gemein und dreckig ist.

Das erlernen oder mehr das Tutorial wurde ins Spiel eingepflegt und verknüpft sich so in das Spielgeschehen.
Vom Grundgerüst steht das Spiel schon, nur die Story ist noch nicht fertig.
Die Story ist aber super humorvoll und macht jetzt schon Lust auf mehr.
Für mich wird das ein typisches Frühstücksspiel um den Tag gemütlich zu starten.

Da die Story noch nicht fertig ist kann man in meine Videos, einen kleinen Einblick ins Spiel bekommen, ohne sorge zu haben das es gespoilert wird.
Weiter Videos werden in den nächsten Tagen kommen..

Ich freue mich auf das nächste Spiel euer Kajo Zockt.

29560438.review:
这是我在steam上买的第一款游戏。
　　这款游戏我一开始进的时候还是发现了不少bug的，现在给大家解答一下：首先这款游戏贴图有点问题，有时候桥与城堡是显示不出来的，这时最好重新进入或重启电脑；还有pit people尽管是声称steam云实时存档，但其实存档必须回城堡才能存档（新手不知道的话就一直往前玩十多分钟后退出就知道了）；最后，这个游戏不支持XP系统，想购买的用户注意一下。
　　说说游戏吧！这款游戏我刚打过在城堡深坑的竞争赛，剧情不是很了解，但作为战棋游戏是不错的了。这游戏节奏不像一般的战棋游戏那样慢，剧情很简单但也很有趣。游戏尽管是战棋游戏，操作简单，但误操作的概率还是很大，我经常就为角色选择了错误的路线，不过这一般不会造成严重后果。
　　这游戏尽管是属于战斗冒险类的，但所谓的“战斗”也都是动漫画风的，没有任何血腥内容，所以少儿也可以玩（话说这公司的打斗游戏全是动漫画风的）。另外pit people在旁白方面也的确很“pit people”因为貌似故事的讲述者是支持敌人的——至少不是支持玩家的——这多少呼应了这个主题。其实这并不出人意外，因为配音的人在《神探夏洛克》中饰演莫里亚蒂……
　　最后一句话总结一下吧：如果你想买一款耐玩的游戏，那么最好不要选择这个。但如果你只是想体验一下策略战棋类游戏的魅力，那么pit people50块钱的价格绝对公道！

29559265.review: this game has the same funny story and narration as battle block thearter but is a completely diffrent game and is really run to play

29558631.review:
[h1]看哪,我这些失职的臣民!双核王来了!
你们是被我的优雅惊呆了么! [/h1]

感受到这种接地气的感觉了么?诸君?

  Pit People就是一个这样充满了喜感的游戏,将SLG战棋引入至合作和对战的一款优秀的小游戏!同时完全保障了优秀的策略性要素,在还没有完整剧情的现在,依靠深坑(天梯?)的PVP要素也完全能够独当一面!

[h1]剧情方面5/10[/h1]
  不得不说,Pit People的剧情很普通但是却十分的有趣,充满了不按套路出牌的感觉与满满的美式幽默!奇怪却又新奇的世界背景设定,以及一个普通的小人物和公主的故事;在试玩的剧情中,可以看出剧情走向大概分为两个方面.

  1.穷酸又普通的主角大叔拯救自己儿子的故事.
  2.亡国公主为报灭国之辱与弑父之仇的故事.

  当前的剧情内容不得不说还是比较短的,短短数小时便可以玩到试玩版的结局,当然所有事情依旧没有解决,给玩家留下了悬念,我也希望在未来完整版的剧情中,能够给我带来更多的惊喜,和人物关系的补足.比如说来自西班牙的宠物小精灵训练师妹妹(误),究竟和男女主人公有什么联系?是否会有属于她自己的故事线?这些我都是很期待的.

  [b]虽然游戏目前只有很短的主线,但是在游戏现有的支线任务上来看,可是一点也不含糊的![/b]
首先是支线任务,目前提供了3个主要的支线任务来丰富游戏的剧情内容,分别是:

  1.消防员和企鹅狼狈为奸的故事.
  2.因为太美味总会被其他人想吃掉的蛋糕的故事.
  3.沉迷养老无法自拔的蛋奶将军拯救城镇的故事.

  这3种支线可以在城镇接取,每个任务拥有完整的任务线,需要分几次完成直到结局,可以看出,在这些任务中,拥有依然有趣而且独立的剧情,通过这些剧情,会让游戏中本身只存在战略意义的那些角色的性格丰富起来,让你更加的喜爱这些为你作战的角色,同时也能让你在主线之余的时间内,找到一些有趣的事情做.

  除了支线任务之外,游戏还提供了许多地图任务
  在大地图的探索过程中,我发现游戏有很多很多的地名(探索点),在这些地方,或是地图的其他一些小角落,总是会有一些NPC,拥有自己的烦恼,你可以选择帮助他们来获取一定的奖励;这些任务几乎都是单线的,它们属于比较快餐的任务线,剧情也相对简单,不具有太多的深度,但是它们为你闲逛地图提供了不错的理由和目标.

  [b]总体来说,虽然剧情比较短,但是游戏中提供的剧情方面内容,至少可以提供2-3个小时的体验,但是对于一个完整的游戏来说,它还是不够的,我期待完整版在剧情方面的表现. [/b]

[h1]操作与玩法7/10[/h1]
  几个小时的体验之后,基本可以对游戏的操作和玩法进行一个简单的叙述,作为传统战棋的爱好者,在刚接触这个游戏的时候,其实还是有些蒙,为啥呢?
  [b]因为你不再能指定角色的攻击目标,角色攻击范围内有多个敌人时,它会按照自己的”喜好”去攻击[/b].

  乍一看似乎在操作上变得简单了,实际去玩的时候发现完全不是这么一回事,为了让角色的输出最大化或者攻击到你想让它攻击的角色,你需要了解角色的攻击习性,并且按照需要强制的让角色进行走位以避开多个目标,所以从策略层面上来说,我觉得需要思考的内容更多了

  游戏中几乎只要你能见到的角色/怪物,你都可以捕捉回来进行培养为自己战斗! 每种角色都有自己的攻击方式以及特殊效果,这一点是非常有意思的,也让组合战斗充满了随机性和乐趣.点赞!同时你可以为你的队伍设立一个领袖,来大幅强化该角色单位的属性,似乎又多出了一些选择?

  关于道具装备方面,同种类的道具,如果不是有特殊属性的加成(毒/爆炸/冰/眩晕等),则基本只有外形DIY上的区别,人类(角色单位),是DIY部件最多的单位,它们甚至可以通过选择不同种类的道具装备来达成所谓的”兵种变换”,这是这个游戏中比较独特的一点;不得不说,这些DIY部件的实在是很多很丰富,你可以解锁超过1000个DIY部件,足够你花些时间去搞了,当然你只能通过刷怪,或者做任务打深坑来获取这些部件,顺便一提…好想要幽灵的猫耳女仆装=w=,就是刷不出来,嘤嘤嘤~

  最后说说操作,游戏简化了传统RTS的选单式操作,该做你唯一需要做的操作就是”移动”,这是一个掌握移动就掌握了全场的游戏…看上去简单了,但是我个人觉得,实际在操作”移动”的时候,给我带来的体验并不是非常好,尤其是我刚接触这个游戏的时候,想跳过该人物,总是要点1下角色;跳过了的角色,当其他角色设定好移动路径之后,依然会自动回到该角色,很不爽!还有一点就是当人物和敌方扎堆的时候,有时候总是容易点错,两个角色的移动路径重合也需要倒退回去,重新设定路线,有时候真的让我很迷惑,希望以后能够改进.

[h1]美术与音乐9/10[/h1]
   关于这部分我想说的并不是很多,对我来说,刚接触这个游戏10分钟的体验,完全是[b]”FXXking awesome!” [/b]这种感觉也一直持续到我现在撰写这篇评测,制作商Bemehoth之前出过狂扁小朋友,城堡破坏者,外星原人以及战斗方块剧场,我一直对他们的美术和音乐水平十分赞赏=w=!

  美术方面采用了浓浓的手绘漫画风格,搭配夸张的场景动画,整个美术设计都能感受到制作者的游戏态度:),相信他们也是一群无厘头搞怪的真正热爱游戏的人=w=,我特别喜欢城门上的那个”=-=”表情,真是萌到爆炸好不好,角色以及怪物们的动画也是十分的用心和充满特色,吼啊!

  音乐也很棒,懂的不多,但是整个游戏过程中很好的烘托了游戏的风格和气氛,比起音乐,更值得一提的是那带着拖尾的配音,真是戳中我G点好不好,让我对整个游戏的感觉一下子就上来了,一听到那种配音,就想笑有木有=w=.

  总的来说,[b]对于音乐和美术,我得重申我是兹瓷的,大加赞赏的,绝对是这个游戏的成功不可或缺的要素![/b]

[h1]联机要素 8/10[/h1]
在当前这个版本下,联机要素似乎大于单人要素不少,[b]游戏中主推了”深坑”的战斗模式,我想应该是想恶搞1下”天梯”吧=w=[/b],而深坑中其实也分为两种模式,一个是PVE的合作模式,你可以通过组队,和好友或是网络上的其他玩家一起连续对抗3轮小怪,还有一种是PVP的对战模式,最多可以支持4人参加,进行2V2的战斗,通过PVP可以获得2倍于PVE的战斗点数!这些点数最终会生成一个排名,根据每天的历史最高排名,在第二天会为玩家发放一些独特的(深坑专属)DIY饰品奖励.

   [b]不得不说作为一个可以合作的战棋,还是耳目一新的感觉[/b],整个联机成分,做的中规中矩,没有任何不适,同时因为玩家的加入,战斗更加的富有挑战性和策略性,这也是为什么这个游戏在目前仅有短短流程的情况下还有辣么多人愿意去体验!当然无论是在联机合作还是联机PVP中,游戏的难度都是有保证的,因为战斗的不确定要素太多,导致策略的更替会更快!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

  最后总结一下,Pit People绝对是SLG爱好者的必选游戏,在保障游戏的策略性以及难度的情况下,还能够让你轻松愉快会心一笑!现在入手体验也是一个不错的选择,当然我们还是更加期待游戏完整发售之后的表现

[h1]推荐8/10[/h1]

29552118.review:
So a friend of mine wanted to play a game together with me, and having exhausted many options already he caught sight of Pit People while Strippin was playing it.  Excited he picked it up and chucked me a free copy, and then we tackled the game at the same time.

To put it simply as the game stands now I definitely recommend it.  When it's a finished product I can only expect it to be significantly more fulfilling than the current rendition, which is already a good time to be had.  Now for a bit more detail...

First and foremost this game is in Early Access and as of this review it has very little story missions to progress through.  There are plentiful sidequests on the maps, and a few side missions attached to the Quest Board in town, but Story Missions?  Almost none.  So if you're looking for the full game...wait a bit?

Technically speaking this game is solid.  I've had zero crashes and almost no glitches to speak of.  I'm currently running Update 1(Beta) and that hasn't even generated any instability.  All in all a good bunch of programming.
That isn't to say that the game is without bugs.  I've seen a few others complain about some that have popped up here and there. However...

Behemoth seems to actually pay attention to the players.  I've seen an actual attempt by the staff to try and help those who are having problems with the game.  That's quite refreshing compared to what feels like cold, mechanical assistance from most bigger named and bigger budgeted companies.

So the game is pretty good overall in terms of stability.  But how is it as a GAME?
It's a turn-based strategy game with a plethora of various units and equipments for said units.  Each type of unit you can use has a weakness you can exploit, but you won't always face off against what you might want to which means you need flexibility in your loadout and playstyle.

In terms of actual difficulty you'll find it to be sitting close to that sweet spot.  You can beat the opponents but they can get quite hard to handle if you're not paying attention.  My favorite thing, however, is that even if you're against something that is designed to beat you you won't automatically lose.  This isn't Rock/Paper/Scissors, and so weaknesses don't cripple you so much as merely hurt you.

If you like turn-based stategy games you'll probably get a kick out of this.  If you hate them because they're too slow Pit People has a slightly faster pace than you might expect, so maybe check a video of a fight from the game.  If you simply hate strategy games even then this game might interest you due to the humor and art style.

Also, yes, the music is awesome.

29551296.review:
I'll start this off with saying that I'm normally not into games like Pit People; It's not generally a type of game I look to play. However, Pit People is definitely an exeption! So after "beating" the early access version, here are my Pro's and Con's:

Pros:
+ Great, colorful artstyle.
+ Exceptional writing and voice acting.
+ Very funny dialog and cutscenes.
+ Fast-paced gameplay.
+ Working online arena mode.
+ Expansive world map.
+ Large amount of character upgrades (armor, weapons, etc).

Cons: 
- The game is in early access, so as of now it's lacking in terms of content.
- While the game stays interesting the entire way though, if you're not open-minded or a fan of this genre, I don't think you'll enjoy it.

Notes:
* Lack of explaination / tutorial in worldmap and town area. I'm assuming this is due to early access.
* After finishing the early access story, it seems the only things to do are grind for gear and play arena. 

---

While Pit People is in early access, I could definitely see myself paying full price for it if I had found it post full release. It's a cute, well-written, adventure that makes me very impatient for the full release.

If you're unsure about buying this, I would very much say to do so if you're okay with an incomplete story as of now. If you're not okay with that, I'd say to wait untill full release and pick it up then.

When this game is fully released, I'll make sure to write an updated review on my [url=https://medium.com/@kyotoshift]Medium[/url] or [url=http://kyotoshift.com/] Blog.[/url]

29542774.review:
Bon et bien voila le nouveau jeu de The Behemoth et il est temps de l’évaluer.

Donc comment résumer Pit People :

Vous prenez un univers random, vous y intégrez un semblant de logique vous combinez le tout à du tour par tour pour les combats et vous avez Pit People.

C’est parti pour les + et – en version résumer :

[h1][b]les + : [/b] [/h1]

[b]Un univers déjanté[/b] 
[b]Un gameplay uniques[/b] 
[b]un jeu complet[/b]

[h1][b]les - :[/b] [/h1]

[b]L’histoire principale[/b]

ensuite le pavé explicatif pour les courageux.


[h1][b]Les + :[/b] [/h1]

[h1]Un univers déjanté :[/h1] la recette classique des jeux de ces développeurs, mais ça fait toujours autant le café, on peut combiner des tas d’accessoires plus ou moins loufoques sur nos personnages, les dialogues sont hilarants. (mention spécial à l’espèce des cupcakes qui m’a juste fait plier de rire)

[h1]Un gameplay uniques :[/h1] je m’explique après avoir fini le tuto on est lâcher dans ce jeu et c’est là que commencent les chose sérieuse, on peut combiner plein d’unité avec des points fort et faible suivant leur race et/ou équipements mais cela n’est que la phase d’équipement après il faut appliquer ce principe lors des combats ou là on place nos unités sur le terrain pour optimiser leur dégât. Au début on pense que simplement attaquer les unités les une après les autres va fonctionner sauf que si celle-ci n’a pas l’avantage sur l’unité attaquée les dégâts vont être minime et on est jamais a l’abri d’une petite contre attaque qui va faire dégâts qui aurait pu être évite, bref le jeu parait simple quand on regarde mais quand on y jouer celui-ci dévoile une grande complexité.

[h1]un jeu complet :[/h1] On est pour ce jeu sur un accès anticipé qui va dans le meilleur sens du terme car même s’il est toujours en développement il est pour moi très complet, énormément d’unités, encore plus de stuff pour les équiper, un stock considérable de quête secondaire.Et il y a aussi l’arène qui donne son nom au jeu le Pit, le Pit est le hub PVP/PVE competitif du jeu, on peut soit affronter l’IA pour monter dans un classement journalier en ligne dans une suite de trois combats on l’on ne récupère pas entre chaque et ou l’IA est au moins équipé du double d’unité sur vous. Le but aller le plus loin en faisant le plus de point à coup de multi kill. Sinon il y a des affrontements PVP en solo 1VS1 ou en équipe 2VS2. Et point a souligné que je n’ai pas précisé le jeu est entièrement jouable en coop local ou via internet avec un  ami steam.

 Bref il y a largement de quoi s’occuper.

[h1][b]Le - :[/b] [/h1]

[h1]L’histoire principale :[/h1] Voilà pour moi le seule point négatif mais accès anticipé oblige il y a forcement quelque chose en retrait sur le jeu et voila le point noir de celui-ci, dans l’état actuel du jeu il n’a que le tutoriel et ensuite une séquence de la quête principale de disponible cela fait peut (environ 4 combats) mais bien entendu et les dev ont déjà communiqué la dessus c’est cela qui va être changé dans le jeu au fur et a mesure des patchs cette quête va être augmenté en taille.

[h1][b]Conclusion[/b] [/h1]

Un must have si vous avez apprécié l’ambiance et l’humour de leurs autres jeux :[url= http://store.steampowered.com/app/204360/] Castle Crashers [/url] et [url= http://store.steampowered.com/app/238460/] BattleBlock Theater [/url] et que vous êtes fan de jeu en de tour par tour surtout que actuellement dû à l’accès anticipé celui-ci ne coûte que 15 € à la place de 20 € quand celui-ci sera fini. Bref je ne peut que le recommander et vous dire à bientôt dans le Pit.

Absolutely fantastic game.
Despite being in Early Access, all the key elements and ideas the game wants to use are there and they work very well together. 
This mad mix of Fire Emblem, XCOM and Pokemon works exceptionally well, and serves as a nice introduction to strategy/turn based games.
The game comes with traditional Behemoth humor where anything can happen, and Stamper returning as the narrator makes for a very enjoyable experience!

29525072.review:
This developer would:
-	Delete Their own posts from Community Discussion topics. (witnessed by me and others in The particular thread)
-	Set Their profile to private state, when being accused on review injection (witnessed by me and,  supposedly the guy who actually accused Them)
-	Flag your review for being abusive and then send you a friend-request. (I’m not really into bitchslaps)
-	Allegedly, remove the flag, after you would create a separate topic at the Steam Community Discussion
-	To put it yet again.
-	And engage you in ~ 1 hour bullfight, when They’re trying to post their response in the comment section, but some miserable author of review would delete them outright (My Spirits of alcohol reminded me, that They had 3 other takes previously, containing “let’s talk privately” explicitly, and I totally agree with them), until either Steam moderator action took an effect or They grew bore of it. Nyaaaah. Me won.
-	Would either change the flag tag, or instantly reflag your review upon lifting (it was “Off-topic”, which suddenly became “Abusive” yet again in more than a week locked review)
-	To be [not] continued

And now, Me start.

Minnasan, ogenki desu ka? Your supper-popular reviewer Yuu-sama is back on the line! Rejo-o.. ah, mind it.

So, I took up on a good advice and actually tried out the game. There was a good opportunity, because I’d gifted it to a friend who actually wanted it. Soooo~. 

It’s King Bounty. With customizeable characters instead of just stacks. I mean, the big part of the game is King’s Bounty rewinded on a 1.5 game hours-length map (yet, it’s EA, I know) . Pretty casual in comparison. No, absolutely casual in comparison. Even with 90’s original. 

What Pokemon are you talking about? I’ve never played it. But, you know, you can capture monsters in the latest KB games, and some of them a predefined on generation to join you anyway. There is no “Gonna catch them all” spirit? I guess it is. So, Pit People is just a casual 9€ TBS, like Adventure Manager and others with a sketchy mechanics and things.

What about the other, even bigger part? It’s hum-or. And first things first - bleeeh. I can’t start to talk about it without that premise. It’s really sends me back to the phrase that began everything for this review: “It’s a Behemoth’s game!”. Jokes are passable, generally. But there are pits (in Pit People, yes, *ba dum-tss*). The closest example is Forest scene of Castle Crashers. They didn’t got rid of those funny feces detonations. Meanwhile, the man who anticipated this game and actually enjoyed it for 1.5hrs of the 1st act said, that the only thing bad in this game, currently, is “the degenerative sense of humor”. And for this part, he is right. But I would suggest there is a reason behind it’s presence. By the way, we never finished CC because of that.

Stage change. With the review being locked, my life turned grey. I’ve got no wife, no kids, no warm touch from anyone, but General Vochka himself. That being said, I jumped into another abyss of my useless existence. Aaahh, ok, it was their discord server. I found here two moderator guys joking around about how 2 unicorns could create a Mobius and feces, more of them, of course (strongly reminded me this South Park’s episode, that I did not intend to watch; like the whole title). When I was left alone with one of them, I’ve started to provoke him (I wasn’t picky in the means, why should I?). Silenced, re-entering, watch him playing for a time, They came, me ban. Yes, I was kicked at the end, got yet another invite from Them and one more, too, which I’ve decided to took up. The other side was really irritated, plainly rude, so I’ve got no choice but to report it. Properly, through the ticket. I am an adult and strong-willed male, but there could have been woman, kid, or an elderly person in my place. And yesterday I got a response. This person would be restricted in their ability to communicate with other people through the Steam for some time. And I got 6 downvotes on my long-drown reviews this very Friday. It seems they are downvoting every.

So, yes, my point is that some part of the “older” community, grown on the best pieces of Behemoth humor is acting, to put it mildly, strange. But yet, they got a special treatment, like “Sure, I’ll go and ban that digger”. This very part of community is expecting for Daniel to act in some generally known way (related to this very sense of humor). For example, They would delete Their own posts, setting Their profile to “Private” only to anger those, who would dare to doubt them. Childish? It is. But look at the beginning and the list what They already did.

No, the man this stupid couldn’t possibly create games. I suspect, he do understand he can’t effectively fight some guy with “?” on avatar. It’s like fighting a faceless mob. And I am positive on that he knows it. 

But still, people expecting him to act in this way. Those very people he attracted with his first games, filled with iconic for the Behemoth sense of humor. Of course, it’s just my vision. But if you saw at least a bit of this whole process: wouldn’t you think it seems weird, if 7\10 of most useful reviews are “Behemoth game, so is good”? Wouldn’t you think it’s weird when some of the negative reviews got very ‘special’ attention? I guess, there is a reason for that.

Said, Dan is a businessman. It’s just his model of advertising the games. He got reliable community core, which could beat him some of the tips, like write some positive reviews, for example. No, not injections. He didn’t pay them for that.


And here we are: this game is in Early Access. It got a single playable act. Apparently, you can participate in the development with your ideas, but I suppose, some of the ‘closer’ people’s opinions would get priority over yours. If you hope that jokes in future acts would be more of “straight sense”, your expectations is likely to be futile.

What’s left of this game? PvP? It’s casual TBS, any competitive one would beat it. No direct control on units? Dominions, Legion series is better by no means. Instant turns? Oh, boy, you made me remember this one from 2001 - Laser Squad Nemesis.
The only reason to grab it is Co-Op. I guess, it’s a good reason. If you are able to withstand the “o-ha-ha” part. Or if you want to see a Casual TBS in your hands . Or you’ve already watched complete series of South Park.

I was meant to compare this community with the one Klei’s got, but I’ve decided it would be malicious to compare 2 indie games by their “feel” (actually, I’ve asked them on occasion when their Barbie House is going to get build).

No hard feelings, Dan. I’m not a developer and I can’t possibly judge you on the way you’re advertising your game. I know you’re going to lock this review, I’m going to see your waiting Tail in the comments soon (he’s such a coward in a real-time chat), but that is my opinion about your game. I’m not aiming to win this, I just wanted to understand the cause, the matter of why did it even start. By the way, I though you were panicking first, so this accusations of the guy, who likely laughed his guts off from the whole situation, must had been true. It seems like a total misunderstanding. I should thank those minions for letting me know. From now on, I’m going to go easy on my reviews (anyway, they are about to get downvoted to the Mariana Trench soon).

29522831.review:
Still in early access, but quite a fair price as these things go, especially from a dev with a good rep.

The game may or may not be close to the finished article, I don't know, but there are a few obvious gaps in gamplay styles. I'm not sure what their plans are, but i hope they don't mess it up by trying to be too clever or add nonsense.

Basically, leave the city, capture monsters/heroes, use them in battle. There are no paid perks and after a short time of yomping around the map I'd picked up a few characters to play with. I'm not sure the balancing is quite right, and the leaderboard is very basic and does nothing to encourage participation.

But the real strength of Pit People is in the actual battle gameplay, which is very straightforward and easy to get to grips with. I'm not sure if the game is designed for tablets too, but it has that vibe. You command your troop movements, but they decide what to do when they get there. Sometimes that's a joy, other times a pain.

I liked the game, and I have definately had a great time with it and got my money's worth. But I will wait now for the launch version and take it up again then.

In the meantime I'd have no hesitation in recommending this game to anyone who likes turn based strategy. It isn't Advance Wars, but it's still pretty good.

A friend and I recently purchased the game for eachover as we are both big Behometh fans. We were not dissapointed. After playing it for almost 6 hours straight these are my impressions:

The level of customisable aspects for characters seems equally as vast as in previous titles.

There is also a plethora of completely different characters, with even the weirder characters seeming to fit well into the world that they have made (e.g the cupcake that heals others by flinging little bits of themselves at allies)

The main story that is currently in the games has very funny and well made cutscences and dialogue if a little short (But that is to be expected with an early access game and is more than made up for with things like the Pit or Insane Difficulty Mode)

Their appears to be a wide number of sidequests and random things to do.

My only complaint is the weight system for equipping weapons and armor makes choosing some of the cooler weapons annoying as it involves having to reshuffle the rest of the equipment.

Definitely worth the purchase and I look forward to further content being added!

29520972.review:
Like Pokemon, only more horrifying, and otherwise superior in every way.

If you enjoyed the classic gameboy Pokemon games for any reason other than the connected TV series, you will love this. You've gotta catch all the fighters, level them up, and complete the story mode.

It's superior because it's both simpler to learn and harder to master. Instead of choosing from a menu of options, you just decide where your fighters stand. Next turn, you can have them stand somewhere else. Then somewhere else. Then somewhere else. Then, depending on how good your choice of location for them, you'll either win or lose.

The spatial aspect of it means you cannot memorise and execute a standard strategy like you can in Pokemon. Here, you must react to whatever situation you're put in, so even the exact same battle won't play exactly the same twice. This adds so much depth to the strategy, as you need a contingency for everything.

However, it's much quicker to pick up, as your options are "stand here" or "stand somewhere else". You don't have to learn what a list of items or attack types do. Although a detailed working understanding of the game is a big help, it's not essential to gain the experience of actually playing it.

My biggest gripe with the game (though Pokemon and most other games are equally guilty) is that it provides no detailed guide or wiki to help me fully understand what I'm looking at. What does it mean if a tile is on fire? What does it mean if my fighter is glowing purple? What does and does not count as a helmet? How is damage calculated? How big a buff is a singular level up?

I wouldn't mind so much if the game were terrible, because I could just set everything to easy and play through for the story. However the game is so good that having to learn the details through trial and error is frustrating, because I genuinely want to learn the details.

If there were a very detailed guide or wiki that gave enough information for a FULL understanding of the mechanics, I could see this as an e-sport, and I could also see myself spending more time reading that guide than actually playing. That said, as it is, I still enjoy perhaps one battle per day, though I still can't figure out what it means when fighters glow purple, and this annoys me.

Pit People. Pit People is a Strategy RPG type of game. I'm not that into strategy or RPG games (i'm still not) but when this game came out i immediately wanted it. Mainly because its by Behemoth. Despite me not liking strategy or RPG this is probably one of my favourite games to come out 2016 (even though it came out 2017 im going to make it 2016 because its january) 

The combat is very fun even though you cant control who they attack.
Its in early access even though it dosnt feel like it, no bugs, (that iv seen) no crashes no nothing it just has a lack of things to do once you've completed basically everything, but it only has 1 story mission available in early access and i dont think all the side quest are in the game yet either and they may or may not add more characters to recruit. Still there is easily 10+hours worth of gameplay (it will increase when full game is out of course)
 
The only problem is the lack of gameplay (for now.)

I will rate this gamea solid 9/10
(but maybe wait until more gameplay is released)

29515847.review:
This is an amazing game!


When I saw what type of game this was it was an automatic turn off. I don't like the turn based genre. After seeing YouTubers playing it, I decided to give it a try. I fell in LOVE! Behemoth turned the genre into a more simpler, less complicated game (which I love). This game is another masterpiece from Behemoth. The quests are fun, the narrator (I'm so happy they brought him into this game) is hilariously dark, and 'The Pit' is the cherry on top. Battleing 2v2 is so much fun! I'm so glad they made it 2v2 instead of just 1v1 because then I can blame my failures on my team mate. But seriously, it is much better working together than grinding on your own. The last game I played (in the pit), I was going to keep one of my characters where they were and didn't realize there was a way better spot, but my teammate shook his cursor in the direction of where I should move my character and I avoided a careless mistake. I can't wait to tell my friends to buy this game and play 2v2 with them!

Another feature I like is the "pokemon" feel when I recruit an enemy that looks super cool and then being able to customize them. I LOVE the ability to customize my team. I LOVE even more the crazy weapons and hats you can equip to make your characters look like whatever you want them to look like! I made my cyclops have Sofia's head. (looks so weird).

Behemoth, my hat's off to you for making another amazing, extremely customizable, and simple/fast to play. I spent only 28 minutes each doing two games in the pit and managed to get up to the top of the leaderboard. (I'm not trying to brag BTW). People are probably passing me right now :(. Anyways, I can't express how much joy this game has brought me! The gameplay is fun, interesting, and does require skill. (and good characters. obviously).

VERDICT:

Totally worth the $15! Buy right now! Even if you don't like the genre, you will like it after playing this game! Behemoth always turns an ordinary genre of games into an amazing, totally wacky, and hilarious one! Castle Crashers, Battleblock Theater, and especially Pit People are all examples of the genius of Behemoth! MUST BUY!

29513291.review:
[b]Another Great Behemoth game...[/b]

After finishing Castle Crashers and collecting all the weapons that i don't have to grind like hell for and playing some Battle Block Theater but not being able to continue because i have no real friends to play it ( Such a shame, really. ) , i think that this game was a great addition to the small set of overwhelmingly positive games that Behemoth has made over the years. Anyway, heres the review :

[b]Pros:[/b]

  +Very strategic team building. If you're into that kinda strategy games, then you will like this game for sure. You have a whole lot of weapons to choose from, a lot of races ( Cyclopses, robots, zombies etc. ) that each have different abilities or bonusses to stuff.

 +A lot of customisation. This is pretty much the base of the game. There are over 1300 collectibles, ranging from bows to hats for your cute but at the same time terrifying hair troll.

 +Balanced Difficulty. If you don't suck a lot at strategy games or if you don't accept a 5 skull difficulty quest ( You won't be seeing those at the start anyways but still. ) right away with only 4 members, you won't be overwhelmed or underwhelmed by the difficulty. If you somehow feel underwhelmed then there is an insane mode in the town.

 +Co-Op. Now, i won't get into this much because i have not been able to try it yet but from my experiences with co-op on other Behemoth games, i am sure that this game has a really fun co-op too. Also there is online co-op too so yeah, that is cool.

 +Cool soundtrack. The soundtrack of the game feels really in place, in fights, in menu, in town... You would know if you played other Behemoth games, that funky but catchy music.

 +Big World. Although the biomes are not that diverse, i found it quite entertaining to explore the world and find new races ( You won't keep seeing new ones, you will probably find them all after a few hours of gameplay if you explore around the map. ) . There are also over 100 biomes. Honestly i wouldn't really call them ''biomes''. They are more like places, ranging from a robot city to a grasslands filled with fruits and sweets.

 +Pokemon. If you like catching pokemon, then you will like this aspect of the game. As long as you buy cages from the shop at the town before you leave, you will be able to catch anything or anyone you can fight. After you catch them you can use their equipment, you can use them for fighting, or you can just keep them with other 127 fighters that have lost to you and you have either caught them because you liked their clothing or your catcher just had to be next to it and you caught it by a mistake.

 +Overall great srategy game. The team building aspect combined with the soundtrack, the funky graphics, the funny voices and the dope turn-based combat, the game becomes fun to play but strategic and sometimes hard at the same time.

 +Also gives you cool stuff if you own Battle Block Theater and Castle Crashers.

[b]Cons:[/b]

 - Progressing feels so... [b]dull[/b]. While playing the game, it will start to feel like you are stuck in a loop, go to town, look through your loot ( Which generally isn't anything more or stronger than cosmetics. ) , buy more cages just in case you see something cool, choose a quest, get out of the town, kill stuff, catch stuff, do your quest or just return to town without doing it because either your inventory is full or your party has a few people dead and a few people low on health, go back to town anyways, check your loot, and repeat. Yes, a lot of stuff you can get - but after a while that also starts to feel boring, because most of the time you will just find stuff either you don't use or don't look good enough. Also they could be weaker, nobody knows because there is not really a place where you could get better loot, you just revolve around the same place and kill the same enemies with different clothing. Yes, there is levelling - but levelling... Oh boy, you don't get [b]anything[/b] for levelling, well you do get that sometimes really helpful boost to full health, but other than that you don't get anything other than numbers that show you your level. No health boost, no damage boost... No nothin' . Well you do have the main storyline quests but meh...

 - UI. It feels like the UI is kind of hard to use. At the start it will be hard to understand what does what while you work through your team. But that is a really small con because you get used to it quickly.

 - How limited you are. This is the second biggest con after progressing, you want to carry more loot before going back near the town to empty your wagon? Too bad! You can't upgrade it! You just got a reaaally cool looking weapon but it's too heavy? Yeah, sorry but you can't change how much you carry. You want to have a cyclops in your team to carry that? Cyclopses take 2 places in your team so it is not worth it. To clear some misunderstandings, i am not saying that cyclopses taking 2 spaces is bad, i think that is completely balanced because they are pretty strong and tanky compared to humans.

 -Body armor. Although this might not matter much, in my opinion it does for a game that heavly depends on customisation. You can't change what your team wears. You can only change their helmets. This kind of sucks. I don't like having a giant cyclops with a Dat Boi head ( Yup, there is a Dat Boi head, and also a lot of other memes and references so that's cool. ) but with a white body. I don't want a human with a badass knight helmet but with only a gray casual shirt on.

I know I listed too many cons, but honestly, the pros overwhelm them. 

[b]TL;DR:[/b] The game is fun and challenging at the same time. You got over 1300 collectibles. Over 100 places to see - I wouldn't suggest getting too excited over this as those places are just different looking squares that you will get from side to side in only 30 seconds but it's still cool seeing new stuff. A lot of detail into team building. Although the progressing feels kinda dull it is still really fun to collect stuff. Overall great game that is fun but srategical, i would suggest buying it.

Another great game by Behemoth.

8/10

29513165.review:
Juego: Pit People
Objetivos, Conflictos: Vencer a todos los contrincantes bajo estrategias por turno, explorar, cumplir con las Quests adicionales (opcional) acabar la historia y aventura que el creador tiene preparada para el jugador. Entretener al jugador con una historia y aventura llena de chistes malos, pero muy buen trama.

Reglas: Es un juego de estrategia, que te da la libertad de poder personalizar como gustes a tus personajes, pero te restringe pues tienes que conseguir cada pieza personalizable, cada vez que sales de aventura. El juego usa un modo de turnos, donde tienes que pensar estratégicamente donde vas a poder mover a tus personajes, pero estos personajes tienen mente propia por lo tanto ellos eligen a quien atacar y tu solo debes pensar en el siguiente movimiento.

Conflictos/obstáculos: Los conflictos del juego, son un mundo de caos, donde un oso gigante lo único que quiere es entretenerse de tu sufrimiento, pues el mundo entero está luchando entre si gracias a que otro oso gigante se estrelló en el planeta y su sangre a echo que todos sean muy agresivos, el conflicto principal aparte de todos los monstruos y las side quest del juego es poder derrotar al oso gigante que secuestro a tu hijo. Esto es lo que tengo entendido pues el juego está en early Access.

Procedimientos: debes empezar siguiendo la historia y tutoriales, que se te van ofreciendo al paso del juego, cada personaje sube de nivel para poder lograr nuevos poderes y objetivos, debes superar todos los obstáculos para poder ganar y acabar el juego, depende de ti las estrategias que tomes durante las peleas.
Recursos: Te dan monedas de oro cada vez que logras una misión, asi puedes comprar nuevas armas, y armaduras, necesitas una consola o una Pc que pueda correr el juego, tiempo y ganas de divertirse. Un mundo abierto con diversos consumibles.

Límites: Mundo temporal, personajes débiles que no te dejan hacer misiones difícil por falta de experiencia, mayores de 13 años por lo tanto si eres menor no puede jugarlo, un límite de 6 save slots, solamente puedes tener 6 personajes para luchar. 

Resultados: Victorias de peleas te dan nuevas herramientas para poder mejorar a tus personajes, acabar el juego, pelear en línea te da una satisfactoria victoria y un sentimiento sin igual mas un nuevo drop. 

Jugadores: Mayores de 13 años, para personas que les guste los juegos de estrategias por turnos y que les agrade una buena historia.
9/10
Dávila Torres José Carlos

29498552.review:
This is a review for an Early Access Game. Opinions herein are subject to change upon advancements in the games development. This review will be updated as each new patch rolls out for the game.

Pit People.. Pit People.. This game is absolutely bonkers, and I adore it so for such. Whilst the storyline is nowhere near finished (Early Access) there are a plethora of missions and so on to embark on, as well as countless enemies to "Recruit" (Kidnap) into your party. My current party is a Hairball which regenerates health per turn, and hits for massive damage, a cupcake which heals my party members by slowly killing itself, your typical knightly party member but with an Elvis haircut, a Unicorn that fires exploding rainbow artillery horns, and a recruitment person. Party diversity is key.

Pros:

- Fantastic Soundtrack, which I've listened to outside of the game for hours.

- Easy to understand movement system, as well as targetting.

- Diverse enemies available to be recruited. From Mushrooms that fart on you and flip you off, to frogs that explode.

- Hilarious questlines, which take an hour or so to complete if focused on completing the entire quest line.

- Difficulty scaling is quite fair, with the ability to set the difficulty to "Insane" at any point.

- Easily organized co-op, as well as split screen co-op using Mouse+KB and a controller.

- Humorous "language" spoken by the characters within the game.

- Exploration where you can ignore any/all enemies if you like.


Cons:

- Minor Framerate issues whilst exploring (Though, once more as stated above, it is an Early Access title, and this is subject to change).

- Rather boring equipment system, where each weapon is generally cosmetic depending on their grouping.

- Lack of Micromanagement aside from moving characters to an area, without the ability to designate specific targets, though this is most likely intentional.


Overall: I'd rate the game an 8, however relatively close to being a 9. It lacks polish, as it is an Early Access game, however I am extremely excited to see what the future holds in regards to this game.

This is my first review, and this game deserves it! Ok, if your reading this and debating to buy this game, I have a couple things to tell you that will explain the beauty of this game. Gameplay:
This game plays like Fire Emblem, but much more fun. I'm not that good at Fire Emblem (Im terrible at it) When I was going to buy this game, I was debating on if it was worth it because of the gameplay, and it was. I enjoy playing this and can feel myself improving! The gameplay is polished and clean. There are side quests and the main story line. Sence this is early access, the story line isn't complete yet, but there are 1000s of sidequests while you wait for the game to update!


~SUMMERY~
Pit People® is worth buying. If your a fan of the Fire Emblem series and love the humor in Battleblock Theater or Castle Crashers, this is perfect for you. If your like me and isn't the best at this type of gameplay, give it a try, If you don't enjoy it, you can get a refund, but I strongly recommend trying to get to the part where you have a full team. Pit People no inventa nada, si te gustaron Final Fantasy Tactics, Disgaea o similares vais a encontrar mas de lo mismo, esto significa juego estrategico por turnos con toques de rol, pero con una gran personalizacion en cuanto al tema de armas y equipo a cada cual mas loca y unas ideas muy buenas de cara al futuro, aunque no permite el personalizar nombres por ahora de las tropas, ademas el equipo sera importante ya que una maza sera la mejor arma para pelear contra gente con casco y una espada para gente que no lo lleve, algunos seran inmunes a la electricidad, otras armas nos congelaran o envenenaran, etc...

[img]https://i.gyazo.com/66559a8cc0b2a819e0ca953c91a2c7c6.jpg[/img]

Por ahora la alpha es bastante basica, solo tenemos un par de historias de aventura principal y unas cantas secundarias y un monton de enemigos para capturar para que se unan a nuestras filas como si de un pokemon se tratase.

[img]https://i.gyazo.com/ae3df8086942798577d0e0a2ec84a922.jpg[/img]

Los enemigos los capturaremos si llevamos algun personaje con una red equipada y ademas tenemos una jaula libre que habremos comprado en la ciudad antes de salir de aventuras con nuestro grupo de aventureros, una vez en la lucha solo tenemos que pensar en que personaje queremos capturar y dejarlo para el ultimo, para lanzarle la red y que se una a nosotros.

[img]https://i.gyazo.com/c37a7590aa4b4a664c9a13ef946106ba.jpg[/img]

Pero eso no es lo unico que podemos hacer ahora mismo en la alpha, tambien podemos disputar peleas en un coliseo tanto contra la maquina como contra otros jugadores e incluso se puede jugar en modo 2 jugadores tanto offline como online, pudiendo disfrutar de toda la aventura con un amigo.

Como final dire que si no sois fans de ese tipo de juegos quizas no os guste, ahora si os volvio loco los Tactics o Disgaea y ademas adorais el humor de los chicos de Behemoth os dara horas de diversion mientras siguen completando el juego y la historia.

29477914.review:
Behemoth never disappoints. A new refreshing game with great art and fun gameplay, Pit People is just like Behemoth's other classic games with the humor, voice acting, and ridiculous weapons and cosemetics to match. :) I usually don't get into strategy and turn based games, but Pit People makes those who aren't interested in that genre love it. Such a weird combination of genres comes together in Pit People, and it's great. There is so much to do in Pit People, and I can't wait to see what Behemoth has in store for the full release of this game. Since it is still in development, some things are not complete(like the story), but there is much to explore. They are very attentive to the community as many major improvements from Beta recommended from the community and I love that. Tutorial is much better now and so are the animations since beta. Current early access price of $15 is a good deal, considering how well developed and different this game is from other mainstream games. (After early access the price will go up to $20). 

Some cons to the game are the controls for mouse+keyboard. The game was designed for Xbox, and is best played on a controller. It's still ok though, but if you don't have a controller, you may find it annoying. There is also no world map, and the screen makes it hard to see sometimes while traveling. It is different and a cool idea, but can be frustrating.

P.S there is a LOT of grinding(it is part RPG). If that's not your thing, then don't get this game.

Thank you for another wonderful game, Behemoth <3

29469937.review:
After loving the other games of Behemoth and my girlfriend showing me this game, I immediately bought it. 
Since I love turn-based strategy games & play them a lot, I feel that I can give a proper review for what this game offered so far. 

The game itself is punny as Behemoth tends to do, which I hope they never quit doing. The offered missions & stories are good enough at the moment to already play the game for several hours. Although it felt to me like a demo that they could've given out for free to promote the game when it's finished.
The gameplay is fun with the RNG implemented, as you only control their movement, not their actions. Which gives it a fun luck-factor where you could have a fun rage-moment when they hit the wrong target for the 5th time.

The local co-op is really clunky atm unfortunately, the camera moves too much since it tries to focus on 2 moving cursors at the same time, which sortof forces you to do your movements 1 person at a time. Basically you could play for 2 people on your own, if you have 2 seperate controllers that is. 

I wasn't able to test the online co-op yet & will propably update my review after I tested that.

Something negative I noticed is that currently, being in Early Access, it feels like the characters their stats don't go up after a while anymore, having a lvl 30 character feels the same as having a level 10. The damage seems to lock at a certain point, even if the game assured that the stats would keep going up.
This does give an advantage on enjoying the 'demo' to its full extend, since else the level 5 missions would become too easy, thus ruining the gameplay.

I strongly suggest this 'demo' to everyone who enjoyed Behemoth's previous games & people who like comedic strategy games. The full game probably won't dissappoint.

29454680.review:
Highly recommended, especially for fans of The Behemoth.

At the time of this review the game is in early access and only contains about 1-2 hours of campaign, but there is much more to do after you've finished what's been released so far.

Pit People is an easily accessible, turn-based, tactical/strategy game. 

In the campaign you start out with a small party of weird-o heroes who traverse an open world searching for quests, loot, revenge, and fighters. As you progress you are able to capture enemies and collect gear to add to your armory, giving you the chance to fine tune your party into a ruthless quad-killing machine.

After completing what's available of the main story line you and your party are given free reign of the world. As you grab more fighters and gear you're encouraged to put them to the test in the pit where your party is pitted against "unfair AI" or other players online.

The campaign and side quests are brimming with moxie. This whole game is just full of it, even the environment dances to the upbeat soundtrack.

PROS:
-Local and online CO-OP
-Online multiplayer VS
-Fantastic hex turn-based combat
-AI brawling
-Easy to access, difficult to master
-HIlarious
-RPG-ish elements that get the "ooo! numbers going up!" part of your brain tingling
-Lots of stuff to collect
-Lots of stuff to explore
-Insane difficult mode
-Ability to refuse space-bear's commands and not die

CONS:
-It's in early access, but some minor UI issues.
-At this point in time the campaign is very short, but you're getting it for cheap and there is so much more to do than the campaign.

In conclusion:

If you love Behemoth games and want to play it now, get it, it's worth it and in a completely playable state. If you don't like the idea of a short campaign maybe purchase it now at the lowered price and leave it in your backlog until the whole game is released.

29453298.review:
Empezando por Alíen Hominid The Behemont nunca ha decepcionado con sus juegos.
Pit people, un juego de Estrategia por turnos, con un toque de Pokemon y como no, el humor característico de siempre.
Si, lo sé, el juego está en Early Access, aun así es un gran juego, con una excelente banda sonora y una historia muy buena, y graciosa, como no.
Dos horas es lo que dura este Early Access, pero no hay que desanimarse, estas dos horas de juego son apenas un 4% de este, además de que hay un porrón de misiones secundarias para hacer.
Empezamos con Horatio, persona quien emprenderá una gran aventura, reclutando y capturando a guerreros para que se unan a él, guerreros que pueden ser, humanos, ciclopes, elfos, hasta robots. Además de que el equipamiento que llevan importa, mientras más armadura, menos se podrán mover en un turno, si es que tienen un casco, las espadas serán menos efectivas, vas a tener que atacarlos con mazos, un montón de cosas que tendrás que pensar dentro de una batalla.
En el mapa hay desde váteres gigantes hasta un mundo de dulces, además de misiones extras muy absurdas y lo mejor, puedes hacer caca en el mapa para tener un rastro de donde es la ciudad...
No puedo esperar a que salga el juego completo, espero que no nos decepcionen, aunque nunca lo han hecho...

29452052.review: Pit People is the newest nugget of raw charm from our friends at The Behemoth. It plays like a sort of manager-slash-isometric strategy game, with various units dressed in silly attire. The game doesn't by any means feel "Complete" but it's still in early access, so the amount of story that's out can be forgiven. However, I do have a few gripes, such as levelling up, aside from filling your health bar at a critical moment, feels inconsequential. However, such a gripe can be overlooked for me. Given Pit People's current price I will cautiously reccomend it, you'll love this game if you come to Behemoth for the charm and cartoony gore, however if you're looking for a strategy game, maybe look at a video first, instead of my poorly-written review.

29451993.review:
[b]What could I say - I fall in Love. I feel unconditional, pure, raw Love for [i]Pit People[/i][/b]

This game was on my radar since fellow named [i]TotalBiscuit[/i] made a first impression video on it from PAX. Since then I was patiently waiting for time to come so I could play another game from [i]The Behemoth[/i] - studio so different with their vision, with exciting and ridiculous sense of humor.

Day of release has come, but I wasn't entirely sure to dip my toes into this fun loving, colourful water from get go, and I wanted to wait for full/finished product.
Everything changed when I watched video by another fellow named [i]Jesse Cox[/i]. Him and gentleman I already mentioned few sentences before, started series together. Watching them play, and having fun encourage me to jump right in without any hesitation.

Oh boy! Oh boy! This game delivered.
Five hours in so far and I'm having so much fun. Too much fun. Insane amount of fun; and what I say now, might be a stretch, but I feel [i]Pit People[/i] is fun loving cousin of [i][url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/262060/]Darkest Dungeon[/url][/i] and [i][url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/200510/] XCOM[/url][/i] in terms of excitement that I have in me while playing.

Gameplay is just too damn addictive.
Writing and humor so ridiculously charming. 
Possibilities with customisation are endless, same as number of different characters or creatures. 
Music is absolutely awesome, I can't wait for official soundtrack to come out.
Visuals as always nice to look at, with many, many, many, many, many, many bits and pieces that makes the world feel vibrant and alive. 
Everything this shows how much though was put into this game, and you can see it from start thru multiple playthroughs.

Besides unfinished story mode this game is polished to perfection ... well, I guess not perfection because inventory management bugs me quite a bit, more then I would like - but with this exception it is perfection in my eyes in terms of gaming experience.

Well done oh mighty [i]The Behemoth[/i]. You guys delivered another instant classic.

I know, I know I'm just gushing no much saying praises, but it is just because I am filled with satisfaction and overwhelmed by how good this game actually is, and I need to get out of my system and spread it around. 
If you liked previous efforts from this devs, I don't know what are you waiting for; don't be like me and just do it! - BUY IT!!!

[i]Grade:[/i][b] A+[/b]

I don't write many reviews, because I really don't have the time or desire to be a part-time games journalist (for free).  But, this is one of the most objectively FUN games I've played in a long time.  Combat is a blast, the narrator is great and interjects at just the right time to add flavor to a kill ("That's fair.....I guess."), and there are so many combinations to make battlegroups out of.  While the loot varies mostly as cosmetic alterations of core types, you still get a feeling that you're constantly winning something.  The locations and character names are hilarious, and I've already gotten a warning from my wife that I have to make sure my son isn't around when I'm playing (apparently she doesn't want him saying "Rumptrumpet" at school).

I'm not great at adding funny things to reviews, but I'd give this game a solid 10/10, would recommend friends buy it again.

29434173.review:
Just what you'd expect from The Behemoth. This game is amazing! Despite it being early access and in reality there is very little to it right now, I've had a lot of fun with it.

IF YOU BUY THIS EARLY, DO KNOW THAT THERE IS ONLY THE GENERAL SET OF TUTORIAL QUESTS AND WHAT FEELS LIKE ONLY 1 REAL STORY QUEST. 

Most of my time playing has been spent just grinding out battles in order to level up my team, otherwise there really isn't much else to do other than the Unfair Pit and repeatable bonus missions. The Unfair Pit seems quite fun, but even with a full team of above level 20's I barely made it past round 1 and it could also be noted that I'm probably not amazing at the game anyway. 

As far as random encounters go, I feel like it would be nice to see even more variety in some of the enemies. There are a few different races you encounter throughout the game, but the only difference between characters of the same race are there helmets mostly and even then it really isn't all that crazy. Each race of character has their own style of attacking and special attributes, and there are actually quite a few different races, but after playing for awhile I would either get a lack of variety in the enemies I was facing or cool races just wouldn't show up at all. 

This game is early access so I wasn't expecting it to be all together or anywhere near a complete game. I've had a lot of fun with the game so far, but until its full releases I don't think I'll be playing too much now. 

I absolutely recommend getting this game now while it's cheaper though. It is an insane amount of fun and it's only in early access so it can only get better from here.

29431071.review:
I'm not one for many turn-based combat games. Xcom and Civ are my only exceptions honestly, and I'm not very good at either of them. I do enjoy them nonethless. Pit People was hanging on the edge for me; I love Behemoth and their games and humour, but the whole turn-taking thing was a bit of a step away from their usual slash-fest style. However, I had some money and time to spare so I thought I'd give their new game a real chance, and man, am I thankful I did. Pit People is a wonder (even in early access) to play. The usual from Behemoth can be expected: a crazy and cartoonish art style, over-the-top humour and stupidity, but the new direction this game takes is suprisingly well done and very simple yet fun to play. It doesn't require a whole lot of planning and thought like other turn-based games do. Simply move your characters to where you want them to go and they will attack who they think is the best, provided that they can. You can't target specific enemies, which I thought was awful at first, until I realised that all-in-all, it works very well. Depending on your weapon depends on how you attack. For example, melee weapons such as swords will be just one tile away for an attack to occur, but if a character say throws axes, you need to position them two tiles away instead so they can throw the axes towards an enemy. If they can target multiple enemies at once, they may split the damage if the AI deems it necessary to, or just attack one enemy for more damage. I like this simple formula that avoids the player themselves setting up positioning as well as attacks, and it's very easy once you get the hang of it. The combat isn't the most in-depth ever seen in a turn-based game, but in my opinion, it succeeds because of this. It creates a fast-paced action game where good positioning will win you the game, sort of like chess in a way. The other section is a pokemon styled run-around a map and find things game. You can seek out enemies that then take you into a more focused battle, and the best part is the quests, which allow for a lot of freedom to do what you want to do instead of sectioned levels. The story is crazy just like all of Behemoth's games, and I won't spoil it (even though there is only a certain amount of these story quests available currently) but there's a giant teddy bear that has crashed into the Earth. The narrator as always is ridiculous and funny. Customisation is plentiful and once again, outrageous. The hub town holds a market place for new fighters and weapons, an arena named the pit sort of like a colosseum as well as a home for you to mess with your characters and team. 

Overall, awesome game and a real treat to play. Simple, elegant, funny and over-the-top turn-based action with what seems to be a mind-boggling but intriguing story that never lets up on quick remarks, twists and plot. Support this game and Behemoth! They deserve it :D

29430273.review:
Pit People is a game that's basically a mix of a little bit of chess, a little bit of Pokemon, and some questionable humor. Overall, it's pretty good, but it doesn't really excel compared to its competition.

PROS:
- Very solid turn-based combat system.
- Good jokes here and there.
- 18 different customizable fighters, some more so than others.
- Better art than Battleblock Theater and Castle Crashers, though it's still stuck in the cesspool that is the Newgrounds flash animation style.
- Lots and lots of collectable items to equip your team with.
- 6 team slots allows for a lot of customization and experimenting.
- World is visually and conceptually interesting.

CONS:
- A bit too many jokes are only funny to people who haven't hit puberty yet, see: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=842617351
- The soundtrack is pretty iffy. Some times it's good, other times it's like "what am I even listening to?"
- If there's more than one target that your character can hit, you can't choose who you're going to hit. This can be extremely irritating in scenarios where you can either hit someone who's weak to your attacks or someone who's strong to it.
- Aforementioned Newgrounds artstyle. It's alright, but comes off as a little... unprofessional?

In short, Pit People is worth your time if you're looking for a creative, albeit somewhat generic turn-based combat game. I give it a 7/10.

29428482.review:
[b][i]Pit People[/i] is great fun![/b] A few things definately need to be worked on and tweaked, but hey - for an Early Access game from a well-trusted developer, this is looking real good.

[i]Essentially, this plays like a modernized quirky version of [/i]Final Fantasy Tactics. Everything you want from a tactical turn-based party battle management game is pretty much here. Lots of collectibles, both functional and cosmetic. Definately has a good chunk of different kinds of units (the deep customization really helps here in making it feel even more extensive). The online play is off to a great start - they are doing it right.

One thing I'll say right up front is that I'm thoroughly confused about people complaining about the short 'main story line' right now. First off, that's the tutorial folks - there is more coming. Secondly, there are over 100 missions WITH storyline dialogue that will certainly take you over a dozen hours to complete. Thats a conservative estimate, too.

[b]You can read about all the good stuff in, well, like every other review. What are the negative points?[/b]

First off, the camera desperately needs work with local co-op. They already said they would fix this as a high priority, so fine. Secondly, while the map is [i]huge[/i], it sort of, well, lacks a strong flavor. I think it feels very flat, and simply uniformly dotted with either small buildings or landscape chunks. While the map artwork is good and that is set, I'd like to see a bit of TLC go into making the terrain feel better in general. I hear keyboard and mouse controls are abismal, so be warned (I didn't try them because of this warning). Lastly, I think the music is fantastic, although it is not very artistically cohesive. One minute it is high fantasy classical-esque, then it's western cowboy music, and yet another it is techno-ish. Don't get me wrong, it is all [i]very[/i] good, but sometimes this difference made me wonder about how it was all chosen and put together.

Another thing I'd like to mention is the difficulty. In five hours, I had never lost. Mind you, I didn't play on 'insane' difficulty, but still. I finished the 'main story', which is just a tutorial or prequal to the actual story (this version ends where it appears the real story begins). I finished 11 quests and a few other things. [b]After a while, I got lazy and stopped really strategizing and just kept throwing units in haphazardly - and I still won.[/b] With only a few hours in, I'm going to chalk this up to early game build-up. Plus, I think online play will likely be a different story. I did play online, but only very briefly.

Lastly, I felt that single player mode felt much better than local co-op. Local co-op was fun, but the screen was almost too busy, and I felt there was even less strategy. It was like 'just send the units wherever they are next to an enemy' kind of thing. It worked, which is the questionable part.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Fantastically addictive combat; everything is done really really right
+Although I didn't like [i]Battle Block[/i] or [i]Castle Crashers[/i] as much as everyone else (I felt they were shallow), this game has really hit the mark with the depth it brings, respectively
+Controller support is great
+Don't be fooled - there is a ton of content right now; yes the 'main story' (ie. tutorial) is less than 2 hours - I assure you this will change; further, there are over 100 side quests and some 1,300 collectibles [i]right now[/i] (I could see 15-20 hours easy - as an estimate)
+There are various parts of this game to enjoy, and it smartly lets you choose - you can turn on AI to actually do all the battling for you, which is great if you just like the larger aspects of the game

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Difficulty is questionable - I can't seem to ever lose
-Local co-op is just too busy to be enjoyable; it hardly felt strategic, either
-While the music is great, there is no artistic cohesion; this may be fine, albeit weird
-Overall, I'd like it to feel like there is more strategy involved than what I've felt so far

[b]I think this title is great, and definately worth full price.[/b]

29427028.review:
If you're here reading my review you must be wondering if this game is worth buying or not. Well, I'll go ahead and let you sort out your own opinion and you can decide for yourself. PLEASE NOTE: This game is in Early Access, so don't let this review effect your views on the actual game when it comes out. Thanks!

Pros:

Great Team-Builder type game. If you love the type of game where it's critical to build your own team, this one is for you The units I've discovered thus far are as follows: Tank, short ranged but fast archers, long ranged but slow morters, healers, heavy hitter, DPS, and self-sufficient. All characters spare Healer and self-sufficent are interchangable. You may equip them with items varying from a rainbow.. bow to a chalk board with Einstine's "E=MC2". Though beware, as weight limits may prohibit you from reaching your characters full potential!

In the world, you may fight to get loot. Beware though! If you lose a fight or flee you may lose your items! You must make the difficult decision of staying outside and battling for more loot as you complete quests, or you can venture back home and attempt to drop off your loot. Very good system!

Wonderful balance. The game does a great job of making you feel challenged but not overwhelmed. Never before in this game have I desired to quit the game because a level was brutally unfair to me. It gives me a great challenge, even if playing with a friend, but if it gets too easy for you INSANE MODE is already implimented in the game and ready to use. Turning it on is as easy as completing the tutorial level.

The game becomes self-aware.. mostly. The game only makes you complete its lengthy tutorial once, and after that you can jump right into your 5 out of 6 starting group and play away the day. It also holds nice polishes as to changes in the HUB city. Incuding little changes you might see after completing a quest.. 

The characters and personalitys are diverse. Going into this I was scared that all of the characters might be static and comedy-esq where I know they only joke. While yes this game has an AMAZING sense of humor, it is very careful to pick and choose when to be full on comedy and when to dawn the garb of light hearted seriousness.

Many refrences. If you're a proud owner of BattleBlock or Castle Crashers like I am, you are rewarded with headwear for your characters that have.. actually pretty reasonable stats. Long live Hatty Hattington, The Tearful Warrior!

Cons:

The interface for equiping weapons and armor is... foreign to say the least. Things don't add up. There are three kinds of swords: Short, Medium, and Large (Forgive me if the names are wrong, but that's the jist). Good mechanic overall, but the swords vary in damage only slightly while other stats such as DODGE and DEF. may suffer or benefit greatly. I found myself unable to equip items that may have looked amazing, or that I got from the games Early Access finale. Worst of all is that the swords add to your weight, so I find myself using almost only the starting weapons since they have the most balance.

Leveling is broken. A big part of the appeal to this game was the Leveling system.. only to find out it does nothing. Amidst the wilds of the map you might discover a wild band of raiders you wish to attack. You kill one and a beam of purple erupts from your character while the letters, "LVL UP!" appear briefly. Is it noticable? No, the ATK, DEF, Ect buff is so small you'd have to level up quite a few times. I'm talking 20+ times, and leveling up does get progressively harder.

Armor eye appeal. There is said to be 1300+ items in the game to equip, and the majority look pretty cool. Be it a cup of joe to a Doge refrence. However... don't expect your people to look cool if you favor stats. As unbalanced as the items are currently, you are ALWAYS stuck with the default "T-shirt" so to speak. Cool helmet? Great. B.A. Sword? Even Better. I just hope those things look cool on your plain white shirt or furry black hair troll.


Overall:

This game is a wonderful game in my eyes, and I hate turn based combat spare Pokemon. It will take you on a few laughs and possibly make you wonder if Stamper's voice hurts after hearing his strange diologue where he occasionally yells. I feel this game is a wonderful addition to the Behemoth family and is on the forefront of breaking the bad trend of video game companies pumping out reskin sequels.

For only the price of 15$ I would reccomend this game if it had a few more fixes onto it. It has a nice touch to it and great replay value to those who enjoy playing with team building options.


What could be fixed/changed:

Wagon upgrades, something to spend the money you'll accumulate as you progress. Something that's not needed nessesaraly, but something that would make the journey more enjoyable if you could customize your ride with cool looking cannons or an alternate horse type.

Biome types. The game is very scattered and geographically makes utterly no sense. While yes, it is the Bear-apocalypse that doesn't mean the world should be as mixed as it is. I feel as if the map should have started with plains at least, expanding into a mountain zone to the west and a lake/island region to the east. Something to help pinpoint where the player is at. Something where the player could say: "To get to the Desert, go North onto the flaming fields, once you've reached the volcano zone stop and head east towards the island region. Follow along this route North-east until the islands begin to clump together and you'll see the desert. Enjoy!" 

Biome types. The characters are diverse in this game, but you take no advantage of it. Keep the little bandits in the fields, and the massive cyclopse men in the farther out areas so the player FEELs threatened. Am I saying exclude them from the lower levels? No, but I would suggest making them more frequent and powerful the farther they are from the current location of your Town is.

Town/HUB Movement. It's a good idea, but if you went off of the Biome type idea I mentioned previously you might see an oppertinuty. This town movement instills adventure out of your comfort zone, but having the biome types could help the player navigate the landscape and perhaps even feel a bit more comfortable dodging the raining bear blood on their next quest.

The Pit. Give the player the choice to "Descend" the pit. It would eliminate part of the feel of grinding enemies outside, but here's the twist. The pit only gives EXP and little gold. The real incentive is if you can make it to X floor then you get a reward. However, to make it a challenge for your team you have to get down to X floor in one go. Perhaps a checkpoint at every 5th, 20th, or 50th floor depending on difficulty of individual floors? This pit idea would make the overworld seem less comforting as you'd be spending less time there, and the game would seem bigger as there's another objective for the player to do.

ADD TORSO EQUIPMENT. I've already said this in my review, but PLEASE add this. My team looks really sad-sack. I know the game is in the apocalypse, but the fact they never change shirts shouldn't hold in that situation either..

Leveling. Perhaps if you got your character to say... LVL 100. There should be some kind of choice you can make. Here's what I think that choice should be. Getting to LVL 100 unlocks a quest where you BLAH BLAH BLAH you're left with the option to keep them at 100, split the 100 with the other team members on your team, or spend the levels on unlockables NOT NESSESARY TO THE GAME. Ex) Rare music disc's, unused Stamper audio, paints to re-color your items to make them match. Things a perfectionist, most people who reach 100 would be this, would crave.



That's about it for now, as I'd hate to waste anyones time who's still reading this. I hope this review helped! Have a nice day!

I absolutely love this game, and I will always recommend Behemoth games.
This is a turn based strategy game, as you may know.
You may also know that this is in Early Access, so I will keep that in mind when I state my opinion.

Pros:
-The game is very fun, even in its early development days.
-This game is comedic and fun, as all the Behemoth games are.
-This game is a great breath of fresh air; its hard to find a good game with a fighting style similar to a turn based hex game.

Cons:

-I'm typing this while in game, and I have no idea how to save unless it saves automatically.
-Fighting can become a nuisance at times with the battling strategies. Theres no real guide to show you what everything does or reminders, you just kinda have to remember everything.
-The online system is a bit wonky and needs tweaking.

There aren't many cons, but the cons listed really Bees my Movie. And if it all came down to it, yes. Yes you should buy this game. Immediately. It is so much fun beyond belief.
