29287159.review:
So, this is one of the first reviews I've written, so if you disagree with what I say that's fine!

To start off with I will just list some of the basic pros and cons

-Pros
By The Behemoth
No microtransactions
f2p, f2w.
A vast variety of customizations, from characters to weapons to... to... HATS!!!
Easy to learn, easy to master (but hard to battle other people who have mastered the game 20/10)
Very addictive and fun.

~Cons
Paid (although this isn't very much an issue, most games are paid and it is quite cheap compared to other games which are lesser of Pit People... im talking to you, Overwatch)
There is a bit of grinding (not too much though)
It is in early access still, so there will be some unwelcome glitches and, unfortunately, exploits (although i have not heard of any exploits)
It is addictive (yes this can be a bad thing)

Now to describe what the game is like!

The game itself is very simple, a team crafting, (slightly) strategized turn-based 2d game. The graphics are top-notch (3D isn't necessary for every game that exists). You can have at maximum 6 fighters in your team, although you may find that you have to have less, as some characters take up more than 1 slot due to sheer awesomeness. There is a wide variety of different species that you can collect, and lots of items to customize them with. If there is something you dont want, ring up a friend in the oversized phonebox to the far left of the city, and you can easily swap items instantly. You can hold up to 500 recruits in this game. Also, some of the species would be the demi-clops, rainbow unicorn and pixie.

Now to the actual game mechanics!

As you are in a battle, you take it in turns to move your team to your desired positons. But, beware, all species have weaknesses. While crafting your team, you can see their health, move points, defense, dodge chance, heal, special abilities and defenses (like freeze resistance). All characters have up to 5 move points. Characters can become the hero to have stat boosts, like health, damage, and usually move points. Now, back to fighting itself! In a battle, each tile is a hexagon. Each hexagon you move costs 1 move point. Some hexagons are different, and damage your team or cost 2 move points, or just can't be moved onto. Some flying creatures, like the pixie, can fly over gaps and water no problem (water is what costs 2 move points). You can have 2 main types of attackers - melee and ranged. But, if you choose so, you can have a troop with melee and range! But the range will not be very powerful, or, if you are a mortar or ranger, the melee will not be very powerful. If your troops can target multiple enemies, they decide which they will attack. This means you really need to make sure you move your character to the exact spot you want them to be, so that you attack the enemy you need to be dead.

If you are lazy, or not exactly the best at the game, or have a team that is too big to control (some characters come with 2 people in only 1 space, so the max amount of characters you can have is 12) you can turn on the Auto Battler! This will move your characters instantly, although it may not always be very reliable. Only use it if you know that it will work well with your team.

That's all for now...

     -ProNub

29286935.review:
キャッスルクラッシャーズも面白かったが、これもかなり面白い。
世界感は相変わらずクレイジーで、意味の分からない会話の多い、コミカルな残酷性RPG。

全てのイベント、ストーリーなどに出てくる全ての敵（ボスも含む）を仲間に出来るのが特徴で、パーティーには無限の可能性を感じる。オンラインにも対応していて、オンラインで協力・対戦なども出来る。

ゲームの内容はチェスを簡単にしたような大雑把なシミュレーションで、各キャラクターには決められた攻撃方法があり、攻撃範囲内に敵がいると攻撃するといったシステムで、標的が複数いるとランダムで攻撃対象を選ぶ。
例えば、兵士ユニットなら目の前の敵に物理攻撃とか、妖精ユニットなら前方に魔法攻撃とか、MPみたいな概念はなく、必ずその攻撃方法で攻撃するので、相手の攻撃範囲に入らないように移動したり、予測したりと頭を使う。

RPGなので、一応レベルの概念があるのだが、各個人のステータスというのがなく、レベルで強くなってるのかが分からない。
同じ種類のキャラクターでもレベルが上がると生存率が上がっているような気がするので、恐らく強くなっているんじゃないか（？）とは思うが、実際強くなるのかは分からない。

This is an inspirational story about a cyclops named Chlorophyllius.

One day in the pit, a band of gladiators were in a battle against the unfair enemies. At round 1, 3 of them died. The 2 remaining, Benedict and Chlorophyllius, were placed against almost a dozen opponents. They killed Benedict, and the only one left standing was Chlorophyllius. He then went to avenge his companion, charging into the crowd.

Despite the fact that he was extremely outnumbered, Chlorophyllius fought back with all his might and defeated the horde. That's when round 3 started. He knew he had to do this completely alone, and stepped forward. Chlorophyllius fought with all his might, blow after blow, kill after kill.

After the dust cleared, there was only 1 gladiator standing.

Chlorophyllius.

He had prevailed. He didn't know how it happened, but still. He did it.
I, however, know how he won.
He never gave up.

Be like Chlorophyllius and go the extra mile for the greater good.

29285184.review:
Hilarious and fun.  It's a more violent, slightly depraved Pokemon.  There's only the tutorial segment and a single story mission as of this review, but htere are multiple sidequests and an astonishing number of in-world 'bonus quests' to see and do.  

I'm at 10 hours played the day after I bought it.  I still want to play it.  8 of those hours were myself and a co-op buddy just wandering around, essentially grinding.  We never noticed - the soundtrack, enemies, names, and just good gameplay held our attention.

Overall, I can't recommend this game enough.  The only points against it would be the lack of hard numbers or detailed tooltips on some status effects.  I'd like to know my chance to stun, what exactly a buff increases or a debuff decreases.  I learned that the debuff decreases a target's defense, accuracy, and damage.  I don't know by how much, and I only know what I do from a loading screen tip several hours into the game.

It's still one of the best turn-based strategy games made; doubly so if you have a friend to play with.  Show me the numbers to sate my desire for detail and it'll go from 9.5 to 10/10.

I've been incredibly hyped for this game to release since the trailer. Behemoth the developer does amazing work and their games are some of my favorites of all time. Customization is endless with over 1000 different items to collect to pimp out your team. Lots of different classes and diversity. Difficulty is meh, it seems to not be very hard so i reccomend actually going into insane mode ASAP. CO-OP is awesome so if you have friends GET THIS. The humor in this game is like all their other games, immature and hilarious. Anything from poop jokes to funny fraises this game is definitatly a great choice for younger and older audiances who love that kind of stuff. Voice acting is probably at its best in this game above all of their previous games, the narrator is just amazing. Campaign is pretty short for an early access game but it has plenty of incredibly fun and unique side-quests that all feel different. I've got about 10 hours on XB1 and 3 hours on PC. If you have a console i reccomend getting it on that, it's just simply better in my opinion. The PvP is good but can be annoying to find a game, that also is valid with CO-OP. I wish there was a gamechat so you could maybe talk to the person you're fighting with or against. With 15$ you'll get on average 15 hours-20 hours before it becomes kind of a numb loot grind if you're trying to get all the customizables. There is one aspect I have not treaded and that is the 3v1 unfair mode which seems fun. I tried it in the beta and boy did it kick my pooper until it was bruised and bloody, not much has changed since the beta besides more side-quests and better connection. For early access I would give it a solid 9/10 because the campaign's length, low difficulty setting, and lack of gamechat.

I tried to be un-biased as possible in this review, so don't take anything with a grain of salt!

29283443.review:
Well, let's begin, shall we?

So, to start off, the fact that it's a Behemoth game does bring multiple hopes and anticipations, no doubt. But it also ensures that this game, even in Early Access, has some bars to reach, or at least start showing the work it's wanting to make to get there. It's an interesting situation, with high potential, but high needs and desires.

Which is why, after the first hour of the game, I can honestly tell you that the promise it shows is magnificent, and the game itself so far is quite enjoyable. Between the artstyle coming together quite well with this sort of genre and gameplay, giving the game a life and enjoyability that's present even when wandering the plains of the game, to the gameplay being simple enough to pick up after the initial tutorial, yet intricate enough to ensure it isn't a "Click to win" situation.

Of course, it does have a few issues. In the beginning, there wasn't a large amount of explanation as to how certain gear works and what some of those stats change, or increase or decrease the chance thereof, and will little explanation as to the nature of whether or not weapons were simply reskins, or have their own stats. I found myself struggling through this sort of issue in the beginning, but had it settle out quite well when you find drops that do infact have stats of their own, albeit rather small and specific, but nonetheless. So while it DOES try to enlighten the player through the tips given while traversing, I found the character loadout designing to be a bit of a beast to understand at first, but as above stated, this is easily remedied with a bit of time in the game. Just a slight warning for anyone who may be turned off because of such.

Ultimately, I'd recommend the game. While it is a bit lacking in content outside of the story (this being in Early Access, that should be obvious), I do feel that it brings enough entertainment and interest in it's state right now, even if you don't find an interest in the online/offline multiplayer. And with the Pit, the playability does infact come in greater and greater amounts.

29282873.review:
So, its a bit like heroes of might and magic meets pokemon but a little simplified.

You start with your small band of fighters, and over time you can capture just about any enemy you fight. You can build your squad and mix and match to your hearts desire... this is where the game really shines.

It also offers co-op which to my knowledge is a unique feature in any tactical turn based game... and one that I would love to see other games adopt/emulate. 

Overall, its a very good game for the price and id recommend it to anyone who enjoys turn based strategy games.

The cons for me were, its a little too simple... the game does advertise that its a strategical position game... and that pretty much sums it up. And then also, the interface feels clunky in that it is obviously geared towards controller use.

I want to use my mouse, and i'd like there to be the option to make it feel more natural when doing so.

That all being said, its still a great game and I'll probably hit the hundred hour mark.

29280365.review:
60小时来写一个评测
属于策略类游戏 需要你抓各种人物和怪物来扩充自己的实力
很喜欢这种有点弱智的画风 背景音乐轻松愉快
人物只需要你控制走位 自己会攻击 累了也可以自动战斗
虽然是策略类型的游戏但基本感觉不到什么沉闷
现在买比正式版便宜不少大家赶紧买买买
——————————————
任务：
ea阶段主线任务能很快打通 
但大地图上支线任务只要你愿意探索其实非常之多
我现在也并没有逛完 
似乎和别的玩家合作打任务得到的奖品更多也更稀有（也许是错觉）
————————————————————————
抓怪：
花点时间还是很容易抓全的 就是大黑妈有点难抓 因为会不停的生小黑
记得出门随时带上铁笼
因为你不知道什么时候就会碰到没见过的神奇宝贝
还有很多装备都是从抓来的人物身上扒下来的（各种奇葩头盔和带属性的武器）
————————————————————————
深坑：
试了好久也没找出一个能稳定挂机过三关的阵容
说几个我个人常用的 相对来说比较稳定
三蘑菇三机器人，英雄给机器人
三个带控制（电或冰）的近战两个投掷物（晕人）远程一个蛋糕人，英雄给蛋糕人
两个黑爪两个吸血鬼 或者三个黑爪，英雄给黑爪
小鬼仙子幽灵僵尸吸血鬼机器人各一个（欧美范）
分数每天北京时间三点结算 
排名到金色的可以得到三件黄金武器或服装（并无属性加成）

至于疯狂难度深坑 其实不难过
三个黑爪运气好点一次就可以过（需要手动操作）
技巧如下：
随时关注血量和经验条 快升级且血多的就让他先上去抗伤害
快升级血少的就躲在后面 记得留一只让他杀 
经验少血多的负责把对方的血量消耗 让快升级的人去收割
经验少血量还少的 可以投降 死一只基本就没戏
因为只有三个人物 所以战斗期间升级的频率要远远高于别的阵容
另外有一个很贱的招
打到最后留敌人一个炮手或者独角兽
不停的围着他转但不要攻击他 直到你三只血都回满为止
————————————————————
联机：
目前联机并不能秒连 合作打地图一般会等个一两分钟就会有人来
深坑的对战联机基本没人 有时候等个五六分钟都没人来
还是需要更多的玩家加入~
————————————————————
下次大更新之前打算暂时休息会儿 不再每天肝深坑了
不过还是欢迎朋友邀请我来带你飞哈哈哈

29278868.review:
[h1]whoops, BUTTERFINGERS[/h1]

Behemoth's stab at a turn-based strategy game is certainly worth a shot, but not without a handful of issues that aren't what you'd expect in EA. So far in my playthrough, the game itself is bug-free and performs without any hitches, much to Behemoth's credit as a respectable developer. However, the controls in menus are just a step above abysmal, clearly being designed to be navigated with a controller. Selections stick and feel imprecise, and at times I feel a need to be extra cautious should I accidentally sell or buy something I don't intend to. The gameplay handles well enough, but when panning the camera via WASD or arrow key the scroll speed is sluggish, and input icons switch to Xbox inputs for whatever reason.

Gameplay itself is deceptively deep, with an easy learning curve and intuitive mechanics leading into a variety of new weapon variants, effects and troop selections once you get a handle on the basics. However, issues again arise in the menus, with visual cues for stats and weapon status effect icons being at best a vague suggestion on how they work. I shouldn't have to play 20 questions worth of guesswork to figure out what exactly something does or how it's implemented, and a lack of a clear-cut glossary or tooltips only serve to frustrate when introduced to what up to that point was a very intuitive and enjoyable experience. Experimenting with different combinations is fun, but not as fun as it could be when I'm left wondering things such as "can I do anything to unfreeze friendly units, or do I have to wait out the effect?"

The story and atmosphere is enjoyable, with the antagonistic narrator that I personally find much more entertaining than Battleblock Theatre, and an experience more in line with what we've seen in the past with Castle Crashers and Alien Hominid. Behemoth's simple, charming signature style works to the game's benefit, with the game boasting a variety of weapons, enemies and recruitable troops that I've only begun to scratch the surface of.

I have yet to touch the MP, but I'll probably write about it later on. Who knows.

Overall a very solid early access title, but not without some glaring issues that I hope to see resolved in the future.

29274339.review:
The game so far is good.  I mean, really, so far the combat is fun. 

However...

- This game's controls are fucking infuriating.  It was clearly made for consoles.  The responsiveness and way the mouse works in this game is just bonkers.

- Related to controls: specifically, navigating the fighter inventory area is clumsy and cumbersome.

- Related to controls: the whole game is built upon "Left Mouse Button selects,  RMB cancels".  It's just not user-friendly for PC.

- The amount of feedback/information about stats, items, etc. is killing me.  The number of times I stared at the screen asking myself "what does this mean?" tells me that they did not get enough feedback on the useability/UX side. 

- During combat: the art style, colors, animations during the planning phase makes it really hard to see what you're doing.  I've made a number of mistakes moving my players around and stuff because the way they display the planning phase is confusing.  There needs to be more of a clear delineation between characters, and a better way to give you a "high-level" overview of the battle during this phase.

- The size of everything is like 300% too big.  It was clearly made for a TV sitting 8 feet away from you rather than a monitor 2 feet away.

TL;DR it feels like a bad port.  The way that everyting is presented to you on screen is clearly indicative of a console game and that really hurts the PC experience.

29272637.review: The gameplay is great, it has the Behemoth feel we know and love. There are plently of references to their other games, which I really enjoyed. The combat is relatively simple, yet very enjoyable. The only downside so far is that there's not too much to do. I've spent about 90% of my hours on this game with a friend, and just from that small solo portion I can already tell it's a game that's better with co-op. We chose to go out and explore and get more classes and cosmetics and whatnot. If you're looking for a long story mode, you won't find it here yet.

29272547.review:
First thing to note is that game being early access just means the story is not complete. Gameplay is finished, and there's a lot a of quests (which vary a lot) and stuff to do, including PvP mode, and extra difficulty. However, expect that after 2 hours, you'll have finished the story in it, which doesn't mean the game ends.

I loved the presentation of the game. classic Behemoth style, with a lot of humor, the same hilarious narrator from Battleblock Theater, and a lot personality behind it. Great music, with a lot of variety. For me, one of the selling points.

The gameplay is also great, however, is much simpler than your average turn based grid strategy game. Your characters attack on their own if they are on range of an enemy, for example. If you're looking for "hardcore gameplay", you might be disappointed with it. But I think that it goes in the right direction and if fits the game, while being very accesible for people not so into the genre. This is neat because the game has local and online co-op, so you can play this with a lot of people, not just hardcore turn based gamers.

Overall, i really liked the game. I would recommend it if you like the presentation, and you want to be playing it just to explore the world that the Behemoth people hace created. If you're looking for a story driven campaign already finished, wait for the full release.

29271015.review:
Disclaimer: [i] I don't think this game is bad. I don't think this game is good. I think this game is OK and got too many positive reviews, which try to push nonsence that if devs made 2 good games all their games will be good. Also I felt like those reviews aren't helpful, so this is my attempt to write helpful review. Next, this is early access, and I think criticism will help devs to create better game. And finally dev said that he not promises to add new units. So here what I think:[/i]

Good:
+A lot of customization options
+Music
+Artstyle could be better, but I like it
+Interesting recruiting mechanic, where you should kill everyone except your target and put him in cage.

Bad:
-You can't choose target for attacking. You just come in attack range and when turn ends your troops choose targets from those that they have in attack reach. In theory this is interesting, but in some places it just becomes annoying. For example on quest to kill Necroduke your troops will attack anyone except of Necroduke itself.
-Next, it lacks tactic. Your troops can: attack, heal, summon allies and throw nets. I believe that's all. And you can't even chose target, you just move them and they act by themselves. 
-And to previous point, it lacks variety as whole. You can see all units in first 1-2 hours. It could be interesting pokemon-like game if it had more variety and dangerous monsters, but there like 18 monsters. And developer said that they won't promise to add new monsters.
-And so it quickly becomes boring. Battles are mostly the same where you dance around trying to cover ranged units and healers.
-I felt like battle result depends from party composition too much. And you can't see enemy party composition before actual battle.
-It has difficulty settings, but no actual reward for playing on insane difficulty. I expected special hats, monsters or at least achievements. I get it, older games had no rewards for hard difficulty, but now I'm so spoiled that want rewards for playing harder difficulty than everyone.
-No actual explanation what soldier stats mean, just some confusing graphs. Same for attack types and moves.
-Level up just refills your HP. I haven't noticed anything else. So low level troops with fast levelling much better than useless veterans with long levelling.
-Sometimes scenery blocks view, for example, again, castle of Necroduke has walls that won't let you see what happens in hexes behind them.

Ugly:
*Humour is not for everyone. I had a giggle in the beginning, but that's all. That's fine I guess, not everyone has same sence of humour.
*Narrator is not that good. I found him not funny, just plain annoying. But again, this is subjective.



Feel free to add your points in comments, but be constructive.

29266790.review:
Early access, so absolutely do not get it if you are expecting a full game with fleshed out story.

That being said, I would still recommend this game to fans of Behemoth and people who like to play games in jolly co-operation. Gameplay is dynamic, though at the moment certain balancing could be (and should be happening) done. Units with high HP like the troll just steamrolls through even if pit against pixies. Support units like mascots and gnomes do not really have a felt impact, you'd rather bring something else of more worth than what is basically chip damage fodders. I have confidence that I can expect more from Behemoth, and do not regret my first ever early access purchase.

Would like to add that the music choice is superb and very "Behemoth", reminiscent of their past games. 

TL:DR 
Get if Behemoth fan, wait for full version if hesitant.

29266548.review:
Knee jerk super early reaction: This is wonderful.

There is tons of potential here, and it looks like The Behemoth will meet it. The art is great, the soundtrack is fucking magnificent (!!), the writing is just as quirky, irreverent, and genuinely funny as one would come to expect from Behemoth. The actual gameplay is where a few niggles come in. The combat system is simplified in a fairly clever manner, and the way the game is able to make absurd, impossible units manageable is commendable, but the UI isn't the best. The controls were clearly designed with controllers in mind, producing some occasional jankiness when it comes to movement and onscreen prompts. The equipment screen in particular is VERY cumbersome (so I left click the character I want to select, left click the space I want them to occupy, then I have to left click again to confirm, despite the lack of any dialogue box... for some reason?).
Apparently the story isn't complete as of writing, but I haven't gone nearly far enough to have anything to say about that, besides the observation that there is a ton of non story content here. You have co-op modes, competitive arena battles, side quests, and free roaming encounters set in what I assume to be a randomly generated overworld (at one point I triggered the all holy bear deity, making him pluck the city/hub off of the map, and drop it somewhere completely different). There is already an insane amount of loot, characters, classes.
I hope some of the UI problems get sorted out, but otherwise, I am having a great time. Definitely worth a look!

29264775.review:
我很少写评测 这款游戏我从几年前就开始关注了 在玩过城堡破坏者和战斗方块剧场之后我自然也是对这次的新作充满了期待 然而游戏的质量不尽人意（或许因为是测试版？） 我看到首页清一色的好评不是很能理解
  来说下游戏本身
  +还是那个带感的美术风格
  +还算不错的战斗系统 很简单易于上手
  +大地图模式且怪物都能捕捉的系统很有趣
  -剧情稀薄（因为不是完整版所以没有剧情我能理解 但是我还是要说一下给那些想入手却又在纠结的人看）
  -兵种很少 作为一个战旗类游戏是硬伤
  -虽然有提供多人对战但是本身没什么策略性（兵种很少 也没有什么组合搭配） 导致可玩性非常低 我现在已经没有意愿去开游戏
  -地图做的比较大 上面也有很多颇有特色的建筑  直到后来我发现这些建筑和看起来像是不同区域的地方都没有任何卵用 他们仅仅是装饰
  -马车不能升级导致可以携带的物品太少 基本打完一两场就要回城 回城之后任务全都要重新接
  -地图上很多支线任务 然而大同小异 实在是没兴趣去做 而且战斗重复度特别高
  -武器种类很多然而除了外形没有任何区别 部分武器带有一些可有可无的特效 完全提不起收集的欲望
  总结：本座是个未完成品 我觉得可能完成度不到六成 游戏系统做的比较有趣 但是目前内容也就是一两个小时摸索完 重复度太高了 作为一个战旗游戏 每一次战斗重复度都很高的设计是致命的 总的来说目前的游戏素质很让人失望 只能期待后续更新了 不过等了这么久就扔出来个这玩意太令人失望了
    评分：4/10

29264745.review:
Currently this game has:

Pros:

-Great humor
-Stamper Narration
-Amazing Music.
-Really, the humor, stamper narration, and music are what seal this game for me since Im not big on RTS.
-Amazing selection of weapons, armor, and the like.
-Hex based system is simple while still being complex enough for more enjoyment.
-Hell of one whild ride.
-Great Art Style
-2 player co-op
-2v2 pvp
-Amazing selection of party members comboing with different styles of weapons creates some extremely interesting choices in how you set up your party.

Cons:

-Game was made with console in mind so the UI and controls will feel more comfortable with a controller in hand.
-The story is currently incomplete so if you want to sit down and finish the game in one go, you cant do that right now.



If you dont buy this game now add it to your wish list/follow it. Take a serious look at it once the story is complete, because man this game is great.

29263572.review:
At first the game seems of, the combat is wierd, the world seems limited (but the comedy is on point). But once you settle into it becomes really fun. The combat becomes strategic (especially if you play on insane mode), its not that strategic that you need to take ages to cotemplate strategies each turn, it just forces you to be smart with every move (perfect for PvP). The world expands into a difficult and large open world, jam packed with content (very strange content). After getting through a weak start the game becomes amazing.

My only dissapointment are the choices of weapons and armour, I was expecting a more RPG type weapon system how every individual item has their own stats, but the game only has set 5 weapons with different stats for each type of weapon (e.g. sheild, sword, ranged). However, this is redeemed by the wide array of characters that you can have in your party. This can vary your strategies depending on the set of character you captured. 

I'm honetly suprised how this game isn't on the "top seller" or "popular new releases" section on steam. It might be early access but I havent come across any bugs.

I think this game is a 9/10, would be 10/10 if the beggining was more engaging.

29256082.review:
I'll write this review from the point of view of a dedicated RTS and RTT player. 

First of all, don't let the cartoonish style fool you, that's simply the 'brand' of the studio behind Pit People, and if you've played any Behemoth game before you should know. I highlight that, because the game is considerably deep when it comes to the mechanics, and I believe it is streamlined, but a moderate extent. The items and features are many, and that allows you to deploy a wide array of tactics, depending on your taste and personal strategy. 

For instance, there are not just shields, swords, maces or raw damage: There are currently 3 types of shields which work differently from each other. The way items work is somewhat based on real life combat (i.e. The massive pavise-like ones provide no protection in melee but great coverage from ranged damage), but there are also illogical details added for the sake of balance: small and medium shields offer no melee protection, bucklers especially were actually good for melee defence and not for small protection from projectiles.
However, overall the positive connotations largely outweigh the negative or unpleasant ones: There is also the concept of pierce and blunt damage, accuracy, and light and heavy armour with their related bonuses and maluses. About that, I don't appreciate that heavy armour decreases so much the attack of a fighter, but that is another story.

Apart from unit customisation, there are also different races you can pick from. Aside from humans you get: arachno-humanoids called spidaurs which are tanky and can be mounted by some fighter types, robots, vampires, trolls, cyclops, mushrooms (yes lol), small jawa like lads that come in 2 for each slot*, fire-shooting fairies called pixies, cupcakes (yeah), wraiths and zombies.

*Slots are what determines how many fighters you can have in your team. You start with 4 open slots and can unlock 2 more easily enough early in the game. Not all races take the same amount of slots. Cyclops and trolls take 2 slots each, the jawa-like gnomes take 1 but come in a couple. Of course, that means that the unit is as strong as the number of slots it takes. 

My general interest with gaming is confined to a few genres, the same to which the following titles belong: Total War's, Heroes of Might and Magic, Age of Empires, etc... Compared to HoMM especially, I can't say there is an abyss in-between. I'm actually very satisfied of the diversity that they put into the game. 

The humour is very likeable, and so is the story. I put these two last because I care much more about the playability of a title and how many hours of entertainment and variety it might offer.

Review updated between 08.01 and 09.01.18, nearing the launch of the game. Little actually changed in the mechanics, so my review is still valid. If I had to say something 'bad' about the game, it would be the following:
-I would have liked a mode to allow a larger team composition. This may allow for units which have little use in a small team to fill their niche in larger 'armies'. A 18 large squad would be very interesting to arm and deploy.
-Some more character and weapon types would be nice for some extra variety, i.e. spears which can hit from 1 tile away. Also allowing for more customisation in non-human units, not to their same extent, but greater than now. Like I suggested during the development, a type of body armor for monsters which can't carry a shield would have been very interesting
-Modding tools in order to allow easy modification of the game values. This would potentially interest me because it would be possible to make a "Realism Mod".

Overall vote: 7.5/10.

29255468.review:
Pit People is an amazing, sarcastic turned based strategy game from the creators of Castle Crashers and Battleblock Theater. Quirky characters, hilarious dialogue, and the game play itself will keep you entertained for hours on end. Plus, the amount of characters you can recruit in game and the countless ways you can style them through in game items is endless. The fights are challenging enough to ensure you are properly building teams to suit your play style, but easy enough where you aren't fleeing each match out of frustration or fear.

Pit People is a must - and I am excited to see it come out of Early Access in the future!

The only 'critiques' is that some of the abilities in game aren't always tutorialized (how to drop poop to find your way home, using the gun on the wagon, various other in game abilities that you just kind of 'learn' over time), and another concern with co-op. In co-op mode, it makes it difficult for both players to choose their actions at the same time as the map auto zooms or allows your mouse to zoom to other locations. This has resulted in my co-op buddies and I just taking turns, and once they confirm their strategy then I make my moves and end the turn. There should be the ability to zoom out the map entirely.

29254357.review:
This game ticks so many boxes:

A "gotta catch-em-all"approach to party/team formation.
Customisable characters.
Online pvp.
Brilliantly wacky single player/co-op story.

However, your enjoyment of this game will hinge upon how much you like games focused on turn based combat. The combat is undeniably the core of the game. As easily accessible as it is, turn based games are not everyone's cup of tea. If you're already a fan of any kind of turn based game, you're sure to find pleasure here. If not, while there's still a lot to love, it may take some adjusting to.

Pit People is a wonderful game all in all. The level of customisation and depth is outstanding considering how easy to access it is for a game of this type. The story content is lacking, but that's why the game isn't full price yet. There's more to come in coming months from a reputable studio. 

One of the safest 'Early Access' bets out there.

29253725.review:
[h1] Get ready for the Pit, People! [/h1]

Ich habe die Closed Beta von Pit People ca 20 Stunden gespielt und mir jetzt, kurz nach Early Access release auch das eigentliche Spiel geholt, und ich muss echt sagen: Es hat sich gelohnt!

Pit People ist ein Strategiespiel/RPG mit vielen Fassetten, voller krudem Humor und Anspielungen auf die Realität. Es knüpft unmittelbar an die Handlung von BattleBlock Theatre an, aber es ist nicht nötig das vorgegangene Spiel gespielt zu haben um die Handlung zu verstehen: 

Die Welt von Pit People befindet sich in einem komplett abgedrehten postapokalyptischen Zustand! Nachdem ein gottähnlicher Weltraumbär [spoiler] ne bessere Beschreibung hab ich für das Vieh nicht! [/spoiler] auf die Erde stürzte sind überall Monster am rumlaufen und der Großteil der Zivilisation ist zerfallen... Du schlüpfst in die Rolle von Horatio, dem bescheidenen Blaubeerfarmer - und verstrickst dich Hals über Kopf in eine extrem lustige Hauptquest, die ich nicht weiter spoilern will.

Ich finde das der Comiclook gut zum Spiel passt, Cutszenes sind flüssig gezeichnet, und die Dialogbilder können einen auch öfter mal zum lachen bringen weil sie einfach so stimmig gezeichnet sind! Die Musik ist wie in den anderen Behemoth-Games auch sehr greifend und passend!

Zum Gameplay gibt es noch zu sagen, dass sich das Spiel ein bisschen wie Pokemon mit "Dress Up- Funktion" spielt - Man fängt Monster die über die Map laufen ein und kann ihnen dann gefundene Ausrüstung anziehen um Stärken und schwächen zu beeinflussen. Im aktuellen Stand des Spiels gibt es bereits eine ansehnliche Anzahl Monster (zB Zyklopen, Einhörner oder Vampire, nur alle in nem eigenen Stil und etwas "trippy"), aus denen man sich sehr coole taktische Teams kombinieren kann - Ich hoffe jedoch, dass die Menge der Monstersorten noch weiter wachsen wird!
Die Kämpfe fühlen sich für mich immer sehr fair und ausgewogen an, gerade bei späteren und härteren Quests, und das taktische Element greift wirklich tief! - Und für Leute dies übel mögen gibt es den knallharten "Insane-Mode", der die Gegner nochmals um einiges bufft!)

Co-optechnisch glänzt das Spiel auch durch einen reibungslos funktionierenden local- sowie Online-Partnermodus, es ist bisher alles gut ausgewogen und spaßig - und in Onlineduellen kann man sein taktisches Können gegen Freunde oder Fremde prüfen und coole Belohnugen sammeln!

Alles in allem kann ich Pit People also ohne schlechtes Gewissen Liebhabern von Taktik, Co-Op und abgedrehtem Humor/Stories die sich selbst nicht so 100%ig ernst nehmen vollstens ans Herz legen - 15€ ist wie ich finde ein wirklich guter Preis für ein so gutes, noch wachsendes Spiel!

Wenn euch das Gelesene gefallen hat, dann hört doch mal bei unserem Podcast-Channel rein! Wir sind zu finden unter: http://dergamerscast.podomatic.com/ , wo wir über Spiele diskutieren und reviewen.

29253124.review:
The first few minutes of this game says it all. Pit People is a hilarious game with great artwork, which is fun to play and does not take itself very seriously. It is very self aware while still delivering an, this far interesting story (I say this far since the Early Access does not contain much of the story, but the little it contains is great).

The gameplay itself is great. It is a fun, casual strategy game. You do not have to be particularly skilled to enjoy it and play it, but you can still apply quite a bit of strategy into it if you are more competetive.

The world map is fun and interesting, and it is great to see all the creative places that the developers have made on said map.

You have loads of customisation for your characters which is also great. It is also worth to note that this is probably the first Behemoth game where playing with controller is not better than playing with mouse and keyboard. You can still play with controller if you prefer that, which is fantastic. It just means more options for the player.

I am looking forward to see the finished product. However this game is definetly worth it buying already, even if it lacks story. It is fantastic and fun both gameplay wise and aestethically. Not only that, but Will Stamper shows once again that he is the best voice actor ever. I cannot get enough of his voice in this game.

Get this game NOW!

Fantastic little tactical RPG that is very simple in its execution. You choose your people's loadout, and they have one attack associated with their weapon. Then you go out in the world and start recruiting all sorts of fat unicorns, robots, giant spider ladies with america-print socks... it's all rather entertaining.

29250375.review:
2017年1月の早期アクセス開始時点で実装されている範囲までのストーリーをプレイしての感想。

ジャンルとしては戦闘がターン制ストラテジーなRPG。
アクションのタグもついているがアクション要素はほぼ皆無なので注意。
街を拠点としてオープンワールド的なワールドマップ上をキャラバンで移動し
うろついている敵やイベントに触ると戦闘開始という形式。
なおワールドマップ上ではワンボタンで任意に排便することが可能。

戦闘部分はとてもカジュアルで、プレイヤーができるのは
毎ターンのキャラクターの移動先を指示することだけ。
各キャラクターは範囲内にターゲットがいれば勝手に攻撃や回復してくれる。
（ターゲットにできる候補が複数いる場合はランダムに選ばれる）
デフォルトの難易度がぬるいと感じる人には難易度：非常識モードもあり。
また純粋に戦闘だけを楽しむための闘技場もあり、PvEとPvPの両方がプレイ可能。

捕獲用のアイテムを戦闘中に使用することで敵キャラクターを仲間にすることも可能。
仲間の種類によって攻撃手段や特殊能力が異なるほかコレクション要素にもなっており
頭や武器のスキンなど収集対象のアイテムはかなり種類が多そう。

特筆すべきはゲームシステムよりもThe Behemoth独特の
イカレた世界観やキャラクターやぶっ飛んだストーリー展開なので
Castle CrashersやBattleBlock Theaterのノリが好きだった人ならジャンル度外視で試してみては。
なお上記のタイトルと同様、マウスとキーボードよりもパッドで遊ぶほうが向いてる気がする。

29250326.review:
This is a great game, if you have a laptop with some beef or any PC you should be able to run this game. Sadly it does not work on my laptop which has no beef so I have to use my PC.

Pros:
+Soundtrack - enjoyable and pleasing, like that of Castle Crashers and BattleBlock Theater
+Humor - the sense of humor you can expect from The Behemoth, it's just overall sillyness
+Gameplay - unlike other turn-based tactical games like XCOM, the game's a bit faster and less complicated, but the depth certainly is there
+Story - the world has been plunged into an apocalypse after the bear crashes into Earth and turns the landscape into hexagons, with bear blood raining from the sky... this game's story is ridiculous, but it's surprisingly good
+Characters - you can play as a blueberry farmer, a princess, a "Demi-clops", a Spanish conquistador, a cupcake, a unicorn, a cactus fly, the possibilites are truly endless, and then there's the costumes...
+Graphics - the beautiful hand-drawn and cartoony graphics straight outta Newgrounds will never get old

Mehs:
Length - the game is short, with not many missions, but this is an Early Access game, and there's always The Pit and online multiplayer to keep you satisfied, and plenty of characters to collect

Cons:
-Early Access - as of now, the game is in Early Access and is as of now unfinished, so the game has a few bugs and no cloud save

Overall, Pit People is a wonderful turn-based tactical adventure game that brings a sense of humor and great gameplay. I'd give this a 9.3/10 at the point it's at, but if it improves, I'll review this better.

29250142.review: Have been waiting for this game to come out since it was annouced 3 years ago... Now that it has finally been released (early acces) I've been loving it! The game has great art and a very funny story!

29250114.review:
Mild spoiler warning, but honestly there is not much to spoil.
***
The mechanics work perfectly, but for now, everything is... basic. Everything works, yes, but it's just the bones with basic strats and counters. There's nothing really special put in yet. You can feel the artwork's funk, that Behemoth style of doing things. Whoever's been working with this has put heart into it.


The world is appealing, it calls for adventure. I could vision theories of what I'm about to face in this game. will there be random or conditionally spawning legendary/unique monsters, can I recruit them as well, will there be hunt quests for them, can I get fat loot out of some rare or secret quests, what will happen in the main storyline as it gets done and so forth. It's a vast land in there and I want to search it's nooks 'n crannies for every conceivable piece of equipment and lore I can find. Or, you know... that's just how it feels in the game's open world.

Ah, the story... the story is left undone. There's literally one main story quest after you get to free exploring. Not only that, so far it took some odd turns before it's unprecedented end. It was a disappointment, to say the least. "Hey the main story ends here but you can still grind for exp... right?" There WERE big warning signs about it though, so it's not like it came as a surprise. It just surprised how little there was.

I get the feel there was multiple ways to do this and none was clearly chosen, every road that could've been taken was as much fun and rewarding for the producer and the consumer so almost none was scrapped. It's still too open to say anything else. I can imagine though. I would very much like an endgame battle where I could slap the antagonist's space nipples with swords and maces. I would like to see the characters grow a bit, y'know a little backstory for them so they won't feel like they're just slapped in. I'd love to see some stuff even after the main story is finished, that's like giving diamonds to me. (or you can just give the 'mondz, man. Give 'em. Come on, gib. Gib!)

Yes, much is to be done. I'm still recommending it, but don't get your hopes up. Buy it now if you feel like supporting Behemoth, but for those who don't care about that: it's not worth yet. At all.

29249591.review: Игра действительно затягивает. Фишка игры состоит в интересной стратегической составляющей игры. В нее входит всё: от выбора расположения 1-ого города до различных вариантов стратегий победы. ИМХО: сложно играть в эту игру исключительно ради удовольствия, даже если играешь с друзьями. Человеку должно быть интересно играть в нее; если такого нет, то лучше уж играть в какое-нибудь донное произведение игропрома типо CS: GO или WoT. На данный момент я наиграл около 60-ти часов, и этого достаточно для критики её геймплея. Хотелось бы сказать, что и синг, имультиплеер оба по своему плохи. Насчет сингла у вас есть два выбора: либо играть с совершенно бестолковым ИИ, который даже не способен нормально захватывать города (Вместо того чтобы вводить рукопашные войска в город, он захочет до изучения космического корабля обстреливать его издалека), либо с таким же по разуму ИИ, но с громадными начальными статами (На 7-ой сложности вы его точно по науке не обгоните никогда). В мультиплеере все плохо в самих игроках, да и вообще там не так много людей играют. Такие оппоненты обычно вылетают когда только начинается игра; есть игроки необщительные, агрессивно настроенные морально и вообще те, кто попросту не умеет играть (точнее те, кто играет не ради интереса). Среди таких людей, к сожалению, есть и мои "друзья". С одной стороны лучше так, чем с рандомными людьми. С другой - это нубы, ламмеры, такие вот "илитные" и "культурные" чуваки. Такие люди играют не ради общения или собственного интереса, а ради пафоса своей личности. Они говорят, как хотят играть сами, а не как все. Ну например, признаюсь честно, я довольно часто веду войны с другими игроками, в основном это представляет собой что-то типо партизанских вылазок, т.е. нанесение вреда инфраструктуре игрока (будь то грабеж рабочих и разрушение улучшений или обыкновенное скопление войск у границ). Но в этом-то и вся "соль" тактической составляющей игры. Она добавляет интерес к игре: как правильно обезопасить себя, как взаимодействовать с другими оппонентами, как правильно использовать насеоение и т.д. Но некоторые просто хотят "посюсюкаться" со своими друзьяжками, мирно и глупо развиваться (если они неопытные в этом деле) и представлять себе грандиозные баталии "плечом к плечу" со своим братиком недонацистом (не дай Бог я перепутаю термины "нацизм" и "фашизм", он же меня в печи сожжёт за это!) В итоге такие игроки оказываются в самом конце списка по развитию, и их уничтожают иногда еще до 60-70-ого хода (Сам по опыту знаю). Особенно забавляют те, кто заранее до конца игры намеревается такой вот тактикой создавать союзы в FFA. В итоге они идут в научную победу и все равно проигрывают, ведь не только свои, но и завхваченные города дают науку, да-да. Чудеса тоже дают науку, представляете! Такие "гнилые" друзьяшки не оставят друг друга в беде ( если отсасывать, то вместе), зато на других игроков будуть яростно кукарекать, называя их петухами, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ми и проч. Такие вот попались хорошие "друзья" В общем, что хочу сказать, играйте в умные игры и с интересными людьми.

29245467.review: For me personally this might be Behemoth's best game so far. Granted they've only had 4 games, Alien Hominid, Castle Crashers, Battleblock Theater, and now Pit People. The humor is like those games but at its best. The narrator brings so much to the game surprisingly. The art style is the typical Behemoth artstyle and looks great as usual. Now, this is Early Access as of this review and the main story is not complete. It'll take you only about an hour an a half, maybe 2, to complete. However it takes a lot of different gameplay mechanics from other games that greatly increase the game's life outside of the story. The combat is like Fire Emblem or Xcom (more like Fire Emblem) where it's turnbased strategy, a sort of rock-paper-scissors mechanic of maces good against helmets, etc. Similar to many classic JRPG's there is a world map to roam and explore, where you can encounter many different types of enemy parties. Like Darkest Dungeon and Xcom, there is a base and like Darkest Dungeon, you have a choice of different, random missions that you can buy provisions for before setting out on the mission. And lastly, like Pokemon, you can capture and collect enemies and use them in your party. Now, many of these mechanics are like those of some Rogue-likes however this is not a rogue-like. If a character dies, they go back to town instead of perma-death. Along the early access path it would be nice to see a hardcore mode with permadeath in it. So far it is a great game and fifteen bucks is more than worth it.

這是一款回合戰棋遊戲
有以下幾個特色

1.戰鬥時的操作很單純   只能控制你的角色移動走位  沒有太多繁雜的技能或指令
所有角色要移動的位置都決定好以後  
下好離手  才全體人員同時行動  並交給AI進行攻擊之行為   

在決定角色走位的時候  介面也會顯示出該角色的攻擊範圍  以及移動路徑
讓你決定角色要如何走位   
且下錯位置都能隨時更改  確認OK後才下好離手  

2.能將敵人捕獲變為我方單位
玩過一些戰棋類遊戲卡片類遊戲  其實單位壓制的現象還蠻普遍的
一手好牌  一手好棋就能殺的敵人慘兮兮
反之當自己被殺慘的時候 就會覺得別人的單位太IMBA   不公平什麼的  

這遊戲的捕獲系統能將戰鬥中的最後一名敵人進行捕獲  而且是100%成功
將其帶回家就變成我方單位了   連該單位當時身上裝備著的裝備也能一併入手
覺得敵人太IMBA?  你不僅可以抓回家  還可以一直抓同樣的單位湊一整隊  
覺得某某武器太IMBA?  你也能想辦法抓回家取得該武器  

＊遊戲裡的AI敵人 唯一勝過玩家的就只有人數而已  
各式各樣的兵種單位 你有我也有  

3.延續這家公司的傳統   
你會看到遊戲中到處都是惡搞元素
而且都能合作同樂    

4. 內建多種語言 包括繁體中文.簡體中文

29243711.review:
Has the utmost potential, depending on how things are executed upon full release.

Pros:
-Hilariously chaotic
-Pretty decent co-op
-Awesome, if not slightly frustrating, combat
-It's got William Stamper, what more do you want?

Cons:
-Units act of their own volition after you move them, causing problems with focusing single enemies
-Driving in the overworld is borderline painful at the moment
-Abusable mechanics

The game is very fun, that much is certain. Sure, the story is far from complete, but the side-quest lines take a while and are balanced to your level (at least from my personal experience). Essentially, the game is Fire Emblem meets Pokemon meets The Behemoth. As prior stated, moving units is the extent of your turn, which makes strategizing both a breeze and maddening at once. Because the battles take place on hexes, if a single enemy unit has enemies on two opposite sides, you only have about a 33% chance of hitting them, as the other two enemies to either side will also be in range. This is both good and bad, as you can also exploit this strategy. The Pit is a gladiatorial arena, which has an "Unfair" game mode. It's three back to back fights with unit death carrying over between rounds. This at first seems like a fun challenge for late game, but as it turns out, it's a totally exploitable experience farm. The day the early access started, I was at the top of the leaderboard, not because I deserved it, but because I was grinding experience and in the process got unique loot that can only be acquired by placing well in The Pit. The game needs some polishing in some areas, but I was happy to take the dive, and The Behemoth delivers once again. 

On the funny scale:
Battleblock Theatre > Pit People > Castle Crashers

Pit People To kolejna gra od studia The Behemoth. Studio słynie z takich gier jak Castle Crashers lub BattleBlock. Jest to strategia-turowa, z ciekawą jak i śmieszną fabułą. Aktualnie jest ona w rozwoju, lecz po 4 update widać dużą różnicę. Misje Fabularne aktualnie zaliczają się do około 4, będzie ich więcej w następnych update'ach.

PLUSY : 
+ sądzę, iż grafika nadal jest moją ulubioną w przypadku tego studia.
+ ciekawa fabuła.
+ optymalizacja, jest wręcz świetna.
+ można nawiązać kontakt w przypadku jakiegoś bug'a. Napisać na ,,facebooku''
+ gra jest całkiem zbalansowana ze względu na rasy różnych bohaterów.
+ podczas gry zbieramy przedmioty, ubranka dla naszych bohaterów, można ich stylizować.
+ w grze jest arena na, której można grać 2vs2 oraz 1vsbot 2vsbot.
+ ciekawe sekrety, które dają wiele FUN'U po ich znalezieniu.
+ nawiązania do innych gier studia, typu Alien Hominid.

Zacznijmy minusy

MINUSY
- aktualnie w grze jest mało misji fabularnych, więc grę zalecam kupić po jej ukończeniu.
- główna rozgrywka oparta na expieniu postaci, zaczyna się po prostu nudzić.

Moim osobistym zdaniem, powinni wprowadzić grę 1 vs 1, 2 vs 2 na graczy będących aktualnie online, byłby to całkiem ciekawy, jak i motywujący do większej ingerencji, aktywności w grzę.

OCENKA : 9,5/10

29241442.review: 早上起来看到邮箱，Pit People出抢先体验版了，立即就入了正，小学开始玩D版的Castle Crashers，中学开始入正，再到BattleBlock Theater，Behemoth的游戏没我失望过，Pit People我等了3年，开始还是熟悉的大鸡头，BGM感觉非常鬼畜，虽然个人不喜欢回合制的游戏，但是这款回合制游戏不会让我感到无聊，先行体验版的剧情很短，还是比较期待完整版的剧情，旁白魔性的声音真的非常喜欢，熟悉的画风，Behemoth的本地多人，能让我和基友们互相撕逼XD，剧情还是熟悉的无厘头，每次出城的地图也许会不一样，现在就是感觉任务太少了，不过我还是比较沉迷抓怪，现在抓了一只巨魔之母感觉不错，虽然不清楚怪有多少种，但是我感觉我肯定抓不完了，购买Castle Crashers会送4个主角的头盔，头盔具有元素抗性，购买BattleBlock Theater则会送一个哈帝的头套，没有属性加成，不明白意义在哪里，但还是比较好看的，游戏中的饰品武器也有很多，总的来说，这款游戏绝对值，即使不是战旗迷或者不是回合制爱好者也会找到乐趣所在，但是战斗中没有加速，就会导致很无聊，我很喜欢砍死敌人的音效，或者自己的人物快要死了忽然来一发升级，虽然现在游戏还有不足，但是毕竟是先行体验嘛，最后顺便说一下，Behemoth不会让我失望！！！

29241367.review: In Pit People you are a farmer and also a father who has lost his home and son. As you continue on, you dive deeper into insanity as you massacre entire populations of towns. You witness as innocent people are kidnapped in front of your eyes while you can't help them. You capture people to kill more efficiently. You let them die but bring them back to life to have them suffer the fate of death again and again. You kill people just for the hat they have on their heads. The story told is dark and chilling, showing us the struggles of Horatio in this unique setting. Pit People is possibly one of the greatest horror games of all time and will remain my favorite.

29241058.review:
Even in this game's current Early Access status, I can easily recommend this to my friends, and to anyone who's played either Battleblock Theater or Castle Crashers. This game has all the charm and uniqueness as these past games, taking aspects of them both (i.e. The Narrator from Battleblock Theater, the stupid but well implimented poop jokes from Castle Crashers) and smashing them all together into a 4X turn based strategy RPG game that re-defines the genre entirely, continuing the saga Behemoth has left behind in their unique twists on the genres of games.

I don't know how to make a long enough or good enough review to give this game the justice it deserves. It's fantastic, and it could easily be released right now but the fact that the devs want people to bug test it, while also adding new things to the game while it's in early access is amazing.

Behemoth and Blizzard are definitely my favorite developers (Blizzard because they don't do DLC's for Overwatch, and Behemoth for their creative games and wonderful humor.)

Thanks a lot guys, and keep up the good work!

29239322.review:
This is purely a review based on release.

The game itself is extremely well put together. It's a Behemoth game, after all. The humor is on point, the artstyle is extremely pleasing, the pure amount of character and party customization is almost overwhelming, and the combat system (which I at first thought was as convoluted as the Undertale path minigame) turned out to be pretty well understood.

Sadly, this is also an Early Access game. And while I should not be expecting THAT much from an Early Access game directly on release, I find myself doing so anyways.

You will almost always be outnumbered, outdamaged, and outplayed in every scenario "3 skulls and above". Now in another RPG this would be fine. But due to just how much damage and random chance (not just crits but location of hits, location of AoEs, who gets healed, etc.) there is, it can be extraordinarily frustrating to set up a team around a point. As there is no permadeath in the game, this is simply a setback and puts you back at the city to do it again. But the fact that most encounters are very focused on luck can be frustrating when you start taking longer routes.

The game is also extremely lacking right now in main content if you don't want to either A. Explore and complete all the mini-quests, B. Complete your customization collection, or C. Fight your friends in the PvP arena. Now I know that the non-story portion is almost the complete focus of the game, but the thing I like most about Behemoth games is that I can run through the story (acquiring collectibles along the way) and basically play through everything. I don't have any incentive to go out and collect customizations (because most customizations are exactly the same stat-wise, with a select few being either elemental or slightly more powerful). I don't have any incentive to go out and capture more recruits (because this is just used to get more customizations and all characters of a class have the same stats). And while I played the single story mission (which you can clear in about 10 minutes) and enjoyed it, I do wish the focus of the game was a bit more linear as the open-world nature of the game let the monotony set in once I realized the above.

This should be a game I enjoy, as "turn-based hex-RPGs" are a favorite of mine (Civ, Fire Emblem, etc.). But the freeform nature of it makes it it hard to recommend right now as anything more than a collectathon. If a friend has is, by all means take a swing. It doesn't take long to get caught up to another person gear-wise, and it's enjoyable for the time I spent on it. But if you're looking for an extreme amount of substance ala Battleblock or Castle Crashers, you won't find that here (yet).

29237420.review:
Behemoth, the people who brought us Alien Hominid, Castle Crashers, and Battleblock Theater. This is their latest game, and I already enjoy it. 
This game is a turn based strategy RPG, and it's a lot of fun. The mechanics are easy, the gameplay is fun and rewarding, and the art style and music is fantastic. There's also a lot of character customization, so you'll be able to make your fighters look really cool, or really goofy. Also, there's this recruit system that this game has that if you defeat all enemies but one, you can capture that last enemy. It's a good mechanic, and it allows the player more freedom and control on what they can have. 
There's actually a story to this game, but because it's in Early Access, only some of it is here. You'll finish what they have right now in rought 2 hours, maybe a little more or less depending on how fast you're playing. This game has a lot of grinding, and a lot of items, and it's also  open world, so you'll be able to explore and collect as much as you would want. 
Despite this game being in an Early Access state, I would still recommend anyone who has played Behemoth's games before, or people who like these kinds of games in general. I trust that this game will be in its fully released state soon because I trust Behemoth, and they've never failed to impress.

29237344.review: I'm no RTS fan normally, but I am a fan the The Behemoth game studio. Castle Crasher is a fond memory of my Xbox days of playing it with friends. Pit People so far has delivered on the comedic stylings and simplistic controls that made its predecessors so great. The randmness of who your units target when surrounded is a little annoying, but with good positioning it becomes a simple task to move forward in this game even if your characters may not be fully leveled. Again, I'm not an RTS buff, but the Behemoth is giving me a chance to enjoy the genre of game.

29236235.review:
非常有趣的遊戲！值得推薦！

目前小玩了一下，遊戲特色如下：
1. 遊戲中有一個主城鎮，主城鎮每隔一段時間會被一隻巨大的熊掌隨機更換位置，讓人能保持地圖新鮮感。
2. 出門打怪要坐馬車，出門之前要先在馬車花錢準備好營火（補血）、牢籠（捕捉敵人）、復活藥等等的補給品，這些補給品會佔用馬車空間，馬車空間同時也是放置戰利品的空間。
3. 遇敵方式是那種「觸碰地圖上的敵人就進入戰鬥」的方式，玩家還可以利用馬車上的大砲把敵人打暈來避免戰鬥。
4. 一場戰鬥勝利後會恢復少量的HP，不過在地圖上跑不會自動恢復HP，要使用馬車上的補給品來補HP，或者回城會自動補滿，所以要在城外連續戰鬥就很考驗玩家資源分配能力。
5. 裝備基本上就是防高就會攻低，攻高就會防低，所以很注重隊伍的能力分配，例如誰要當打手、誰要當坦克，或者是走能力平均流等等。
6. 裝備設計的方式是同一種能力數值有各種外觀可以收集，不過有些還是會有小差別，例如帶特效的傷害會低一點。
7. 各單位種類都有各自的特殊能力。
8. 敵我不分的特效超多！例如除了一般遊戲中常見的範圍攻擊、地板特效會打中隊友外，遠距離單體攻擊有時候會射到隊友... 超白癡www 我很喜歡這點！
9. 劇情非常有趣又無厘頭。
10. 蜘蛛女的腿好讚啊！

以上是遊戲玩了2小時體驗到的遊戲特色，等之後我玩到更多遊戲內容，會再補上更完整的遊戲評論。

=====以下為1/15追加評論=====

1. 目前搶先體驗版本的主線劇情很短。
2. 城鎮中可以接到支線任務，支線任務也是有搞笑劇情可以看，而且同一支線劇情的長度比我想像中的還長。
3. 地圖上有許多等待玩家去探索的景點，會遇到一些人物提供任務，同樣也是有小劇情可以看，某些小劇情解完後，之後會在地圖上遇到後續的劇情。
4. 許多任務的勝利條件不單單是把敵人殺光而已，有一些特殊勝利條件存在。
5. 除了任務中逃跑會失敗外，平常戰鬥逃跑的懲罰很低，會隨機失去一件馬車上的物品，不過失去的物品會掉落在附近的地圖上，玩家可以去撿回來。
6. 在解支線任務時，非主角的隊友會講話跟對方互動，或者平常打怪時，非主角的隊友也會開口嗆聲，讓我覺得自己的隊友不是冷冰冰的NPC，而是有血有肉的好夥伴。
7. 玩家可以設定一個角色為「Hero」來增加該角色的能力，增加的方式會根據兵種而有所不同，基本上都是提升攻、防，有些可能還會增加移動距離。

遊戲缺點：
1. 遊戲中有些圖示雖然是想要玩家直接用看的來了解就好，不過我覺得還是有必要說明一下具體效果比較好，雖然拿去試打個一場大概就知道是在做什麼了。
2. 鏡頭縮放與運鏡做得不太好，開打時鏡頭會拉近專注在一些角色上，如果大家的距離很散，開打的時候會不清楚其他人發生了什麼事，雖然事後再移過去看結果就可以了，可是沒辦法拉遠看整個戰場的感覺不太好（順便一提，滑鼠中鍵按下去可以拉遠鏡頭，可是開打時還是會靠近）。去查了steam討論區後發現，官方開發人員有出來承諾之後會改善鏡頭的問題。
3. 蛇女的近戰攻擊動作不明顯，只有一道不是很明顯的劍氣劃過，常常會讓我以為她是不是發呆沒打敵人。

總之，目前在Pit People搶先體驗版體驗到的主要玩法我認為有下面三點：
1. 享受遊戲公司The Behemoth的搞笑風格。
2. 組一個自己喜歡的隊伍陣容、地圖探索、打寶（嚴格來說是看到敵人身上有好東西，就把抓敵人回家拿走他身上的東西，再把敵人拿去賣掉）。
3. 打競技場衝網路排名拿獎勵。

29235993.review:
* Do remember this is Early Access, and as such the value of this title as I review it.  My review is based mostly upon the mechanics and what is here, rather than a story that has yet to unfold.

Behemoth once again delivers a class A experience with their one of a kind over the top humor. A robust and expansive world, a myriad of memorable characters, and enough loot to make your butt fall off.  Pit People has a diverse and simplistic combat style accessible to players new to the strategy RPG format. Yet still it goes so much deeper than that to the true strategist. Offering near limitless customization this game allows for any playstyle. From people who like to hide behind ponies, to those who crave the boom boom, to those who simply love rainbows. Whether you are a tried and true fan of Behemoth and their past works, or a newcomer to the party, I do believe this is shaping up to be one of the best games of the coming year. 

That being said, if you are looking strictly to play a large story filled with conquest, glory, and pain, Pit People may not be the title you want...YET. As it sits you will not run short of things to do, amongst them being PVP, Co-Op shenanigans, loot hunting, side quests, and dying with laughter. This is not a typical gotcha early access. What you get right now, without the story, is well beyond the price value. Behemoth made the right decision to let us get the jump start on such a sweet game.


Pros:

+ Excellent Voiceover
+ Wonderful and Diverse Art
+ A+++ Soundtrack
+ Fluid and Simple Combat
+ Deep Customization
+ Fantastic Price Point
+ Contains the Color Teal
+ Fantastic and Lag Free PVP Servers
+ Co-Op Couch Play (Bless you Behemoth for keeping the old ways alive.)
+ Early Access (This game is well and far beyond what I expected to get at day 1 early access.)
+ Flawless Controller Play

Cons (Most Likely To Disappear by Full Release) :

- Early Access (This is only a con because my body is ready for the whole thing.)
- Difficulty Curve for The Unsuspecting/New Player (A.I.'s beyond story mode is a CHALLENGE, PVP garnishes more experienced SRPG Players)
- Keyboard/Mouse Controls Need Refined
- Can't Buy The Soundtrack

29235413.review:
De los creadores de Alien Hominid, Castle Crashers y BattleBlock Theater.
No hace falta decir nada más.

Pero bueno, haré un esfuerzo y me explayaré un poco.

Pit People es un videojuego de rol por turnos, en el que controlamos unidades de combate; rollo Fire Emblem o Civilization.
Si te gusta este tipo de juegos, pues estupendo. Pit People no es el más complejo, pero es bastante entretenido.

Si eres como yo, y este tipo de juego no es que sea tu perdición, no pasa nada. El juego es súper entretenido y divertido aunque no seas un apasionado del género.

Puedes crear tu equipo a lo Pokémon y customizar tus personajes con alocadas armas y cascos de lo más variopintos.
El humor del juego es de 10, y Stamper ha vuelto como narrador, así que súmale otro 10, o 100.

Como he dicho, es de The Behemoth, así que ya sabes que los gráficos y demás apartados siempre cumple.

Aunque bien, como dicen los desarrolladores, el juego está en Acceso anticipado. Aún falta contenido, y aunque no haya poco ahora mismo, habrá bastante más en el futuro.
Tú eliges si comprar el juego ahora y ahorrar un poco, o esperar a que haya más.

En mi opinión: joder si vale la pena.

29235378.review: Highly polished tbs. Everything about it is done well from its unique asthetics to the excellent and amusing voice work to the gameplay. I am told that the single player content to this point is pretty short but even once the storyline is finished I can see it becoming a game you only go back to for what would seem to be some cool pvp and co-op pvp. Regardless of how it turns out in its final state this game is certainly worth its price as it is now. The devs have also indicated that the, admittedly low given its quality, price will change to an extra 33% once Pit People leaves early access. Given that it's in good shape already my advice would be simply "don't wait". And that's a rare thing from someone who hates the whole way Early Access generally works.

I would recommend this game for anyone who wants a game to play with one other person, even though there are more enemies to defeat. Personally my favorite character would have to be the mascot, they're really helpful during fights because they allow you to gain more damage, to receive more experience to help you level up so you don't die. Back when castle crashers was originally made, 2008, I played it on my playstation 3. Now I know what you're all gonna say, "you console pleb" "PC master race". Well this was back 9 years ago, and I only had my father's laptop, a Lenovo Thinkpad. Anyways, I have loved all of the Behemoth games they have released, and played most of them on ps3 and pc. One thing I noticed though while playing this game today, was that when I ran into an enemy on the map, I shot a rocket at him, I was about to enter battle phase, but it took me out. I don't know if this was intended or not, but it's really helpful for sticky situations.

29235294.review:
After being introduced to The Behemoth a few months before the release of the Pit People Early Access, and having fallen in love with their game titles and quirky artstyle, I was excited the see what their new game would be like. A friend and I bought it the day it came out, even though I'm not a huge fan of turn-based strategy games. However, Pit People is so much more than that: with its incredible humour, interesting characters, and thousands of unlocks and things to do, it's so much fun to play with a friend.

The updates have been releasing at a good pace, with it currently being on the fourth one, and with more story missions on the way, I'm very excited to see where this game goes from here. I'm definitely glad that The Behemoth decided to make an Early Access for it, as we get to see the game develop and become bigger until eventually it is a final product.

Pros:

-Incredible humour.
-Fun gameplay.
-Lots of customisation.

Cons:

-Currently an unfinished product.
-Occasional bugs.
-Much better with two people.

8/10

29235254.review:
As expected, "The Behemoth" did another nice work.

PRO:

- There is an open world with quests, and many monsters that you can recruit by using a cage. Your home is always visible on the world map; it's where you find the online/single-player arena, and a market to buy even more characters, and weapons.

- Characters of your team are customizable: the appearance changes by equipping different items, and different items may have passive bonus (like a chance to freeze your enemy, for example); also, items are divided in something like "light", "medium", "hard", so if you choose an item that increase your defense, you are slower because of weight and you can't move as much as another character with a light armor. The same is for weapons.

- You level up every single character, so it's already enough to play thousands of hours.

- Friendly fire based on positioning or area damage.

CONS:

- Personally, i find that graphics is horrible, and not because it's minimal, but because i don't like the style. It's well done and full of humor though.

- The UI is quiet confusing, especially at a first look.

- You can't choose abilities in combat (it's very simple), or who you want to attack: basically you just move characters, and they decide their targets.


It's a solid game overall. You won't regret of its gameplay, contents and quality.

29234257.review:
Never thought The Behemoth of all companies would pull an Early Access "GOTCHA!", but here we are.

Sure, I saw the usual Early Access disclaimers, but I've been following this game for 3 years, I thought for sure I'd get 5-10 hours worth of my $15.

NOPE. 3 Years of development has apparently allowed them to finally establish the fundamentals of Pit People, but the game has ZERO CONTENT. You've got your basic intro quest, and ONE STORY QUEST (combined these two things take less than a single hour). Aside from that, you've only got repeatable filler quests, and repeatable arena skirmishes.

Don't get me wrong:
-The dialogue and story is hilarious
-The gameplay is excellent
-The sound and visuals are The Behemoth at its absolute best

But there's only a fart's worth of content so far. If you want to support the company (they WILL finish it eventually I'm sure, unlike other Early Access scams), go right ahead, but don't expect more than a tiny, tiny sneak peak at the game itself.

Yes.

I already loved the style, humor and battle gameplay of this game, but the "capture new recruits" mechanic of the game sealed the deal for me. 

The game can be played almost entirely with a regular mouse and this is a huge plus for me. You do have to tweak the controls a bit though and I would have prefered if the mouse 3 button could be used to end the turn by default (instead of just space) but this could still change of course if there is enough demand for it. 

It's still a little rough around the edges (eg. menu control feels a bit clunky to me with mouse) but this is to be expected for an early access title and is subject to change. Still, it already plays like a finished product and the fact that things will still improve is very, very promising.

Overall I think Pit People is a really fun game with loads of more potential. I recommend it to anyone who isn't afraid of early access.

29232725.review:
I haven’t seen very many qualitative reviews yet, so I’m attempting my own. This is based on what I’ve experienced in the game so far playing three hours on my Xbox One and on Steam altogether.

A turn-based strategy game, you can build a team of up to six characters with their own customized equipment. Everyone can have different weapons, some with effects and some that are strong against enemies wearing particular equipment. An example of this is that swords will be weak against people with helmets but maces will be strong against them. While customizing you character, you will see a bar graph which tells you their equip load, damage, range, defense, and dodge. Going above 100% equip load will reduce the character’s move points by one, and staying below 50% grants an additional move point. You can designate one person on your team as the hero. Doing so gives them more health, damage, and greater equip load.

The combat is fairly simple. Move your melee team members adjacent to enemies, and they will attack them. Ranged team members supposedly need at least one empty space between the enemy and themselves. If there are multiple enemies that can be targeted within the vicinity, that unit will seemingly choose a random enemy to strike. Some of the fights can take a few minutes depending on how fast your thinking is when it comes to moving your team.

Early in the game, you will find a city where you will be buying some of your items, fighting in the pit against A.I. or other people online for gold, and customizing your characters or changing your team members as you obtain equipment and people throughout the game. Gold and items can be obtained outside of this place, but you are limited to how many items you can carry. Two important items I’ve come across are campfires, which allow you to heal your team outside of combat, and recruit cages, which allows you to recruit enemies to join your team. Mind that you will need to unlock the recruit cages through meeting a certain character first. I would recommend not fighting in the pit early in the game against A.I.'s beyond story mode. Three consecutive rounds can be difficult to finish.

Story mode is not finished yet, but there are many battles across the map you travel through outside of combat. Alongside the story mode quests, there are other quests you can choose from. You can also encounter optional quests while exploring the map. The game will point you to the objective once you’ve accepted a quest.

The art and music are reminiscent of previous titles, but they feel updated as well. The narration is just as funny as it was in Battleblock Theater. Castle crasher players will recognize the combat style immediately. Battleblock Theater players will know how this game is loosely connected to it.

I've recently tried co-op. Pretty much the second person you play with will have the same stuff as you from the very beginning. When you unlock a character, they get a variation of them as well. They will also have the main characters in character selection when they have the chance to change team members.

I have not tried PvP yet, so I can’t say anything about them. Hopefully someone else can tell you guys about them. Other than that, that’s all I can tell you about the game. Hopefully you will find other qualitative reviews better than mines. If you buy the game, I hope you enjoy playing it as I did.

Great turn-based strategy game. At first it may seem a bit simplistic, but as soon as you get to choose your fighters' gear, you can customise them quite a bit.
Controls on the map and during battle are really easy. Activating an ability or attacking an enemy is done by standing on the appropriate tile/the right distance for the action.
The humour is amazing, in the short time I've played, the game made me laugh out loud a few times. Artwork and music are great, too.
The only thing I'd like to see changed are the loadout controls with keyboard an mouse as they are a bit jumpy.
Also the loadout screen is a bit confusing. Some tooltips might help.
Other than that it's a great game. Really recommend getting it if you like turn-based strategy. Or even if you're not a huge fan of it: Get it, it's easy enough to learn the basics and it's so much fun.

29231569.review:
Наконец-то вышла игра которую я ждал очень долго! Студия The Behemoth, подарившая миру Castle Crashers и BattleBlock Theater,запустила ранний доступ своей новоиспеченной стратегической ролевой игры Pit People. Позже игра уже выйдет из Раннего доступа. В данный момент разработчики используют ранний доступ для слежения за балансом игры и продолжения сбора отзывов от игрового сообщества.Студия считает, что на настоящем этапе игра "более чем занимательная, а контента, разнообразности и времени прохождения, учитывая еще и стоимость, довольно, чтобы держать кого-то довольным". И не поспоришь! Летом 2016 года студия предоставила Бета-тест своей игры и очень порадовала своих фанатов. Лично я был очень доволен проделанной работой разработчиков!
В этот раз, в своей 4 игре, студия решила сделать занимательную стратегию. По словам соучредителя, дизайнера и художника Behemoth Дэна Паладина (Dan Paladin), он давно мечтал заняться чем-нибудь более сложным, чем те игры, над которыми они работали раньше. При этом компания все еще не намерена отказываться от своего специфического юмора.
[quote=Дан Паладин]«Мы развиваемся со временем. Я всегда хотел сделать игру с гексагональным полем и пошаговой системой боя, но до сих пор это было только идеей. Мы стараемся не относиться к себе слишком серьезно, и это отражено в юморе наших игр, в том числе и здесь»	[/quote]
На данный момент Pit People выглядит как забавная пошаговая тактика с необходимостью продуманного планирования, уже привычным для творений Behemoth стилем и набором любопытных нововведений. Так, например, армию можно пополнять, оснастив одного из своих воинов сетью и просто захватывая зазевавшихся оппонентов. Чем-то напоминает абсурдное решение из Metal Gear Solid V, но в этой игре смотрится вполне гармонично и добавляет тактики.
[quote=Дан Паладин]«Я каждый день работаю над чем-то новым. Захват врагов – это только одна из идей, которая предоставляет новые возможности. Разработка стратегии – непривычный процесс для меня и для всей команды, так что внедрение таких идей это отличный опыт» [/quote]
Как вы понимаете, я рекомендую эту игру к покупке. Особенно пока идет Ранний Доступ, т.к вы получите "ПЛЮШКИ" :D
На ребят Behemoth всегда можно положиться. Они мастера своего дела! СПАСИБО ВАМ ЗА ЕЩЕ ОДНУ ШИКАРНУЮ ИГРУ!

熟悉的Behemoth风格：癫狂不羁的旁白声音，非常有特色的美术风格。搞怪到有点无厘头的剧情以及设定（地图上手柄按B会主角会拉坨shit下来）。

  游戏中最吸引人的可能就是收集要素：敌人可以成为队友，方式是杀怪杀的只剩你想要的那个，然后扔出精灵球（误）。
  任务，大地图探索，装备，升级这些要素也有。感觉上可以概括为勇者斗恶龙怪兽篇战棋版？或者说是无氪阴阳师战棋版？
  虽然是EA但是玩下来感觉已经相当成熟了，后续值得期待。

29228785.review:
Qué os voy a contar, el 4º juego de The Behemoth, los creadores de maravillas como Battleblock Theater, Castle Crashers o Alien Hominid.
Juegué la Beta cerrada hace un tiempo y fue justo lo que esperaba de ellos (o incluso mejor): sus gráficos tan característicos, Will Stamper de nuevo como narrador, mecánicas de combate muy "chachis" y humor como para parar un tren.
Mucho tiempo he esperado por este juego y ahora me toca jugarlo a fondo para hacer un análisis más completo. 100% recomendado, y sobre todo ahora, que durante el Acceso Anticipado cuesta 5€ menos. Para comprarte unas pipas.

[spoiler]Por cierto, si jugasteis a la Beta, seguís teniendo vuestra partida ;)[/spoiler]

29228613.review:
Buy it! Buy it for your friends! Buy me another copy! CONQUER ZE WORLD! 

I have a ton of hours in this from beta. It's an amazing game. Great combat. Great story. Absolutely hilarious (even after 30+ hours). The music is STELLAR, especially the techno track; I can't wait to see what else they have in store. Co-op PVP AND co-op campaign; we can be friends. The beta was my favorite game of 2016, pretty sure this is going to be my favorite game of 2017 as well.

So.. stop reading and buy it. I'm a huge SRPG/Tactical Turn based fan and this game gets it so right. 

Some people have complained about the "cartoonish" graphics... and as Cypress Hill said, "Some people can F*ck off and go to hell". ^_- No, but seriously, I adore the graphics and animations and their 'language', it totally fits with the awesome narration.

BUY IT.
